 El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y uno de ellos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: 5 pliegos de zinc para el techo de su casa de habitación, ya que las que tenía estaban en mal estado.
Julio dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel  a hora cuenta de seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Julio T. Martínez works as a hygiene inspector in Managua’s Candelaria Market. He takes care of two children, one of which is of school age. He is married and has had loans with CEPRODEL for one year. In this period of time, thanks to the financing granted by CEPRODEL, he has invested a loan in the improvement of the house in which he lives.

The loan applied for is to invest in the purchase of construction materials such as 5 sheets of zinc for the roof of his house, which is in a bad state. Julio said that, thanks to financing granted by CEPRODEL, he now tells his children that they have better security and living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improvement and enlargement of a house

loans.name: I.c.a. Camp Group

texts.en:
Eline K. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called I.C.A. Camp. In the photo, Eline is the one holding the sign. She is 37 years old, married, and has five children who are 5, 9, 11, 14 and 17 years old. In addition to her children, Eline supports her siblings.

For four years, Eline has been selling peanuts on 17th Street, which is located in the Sinkor neighborhood of Monrovia. She communicates well with her customers, which keeps them coming back.

Eline plans to use her 9,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 42,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more peanuts. Her goal is to grow her business and to be healthy.


About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating micro-finance institution with thirteen branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase more peanuts to sell

loans.name: Alberto Perez

texts.es:
El Señor Alberto Pérez Sánchez, Labora como Conserje en el Instituto Manuel Olivares Rodríguez.
 El tiene un  hijo a su cargo, y este se encuentra en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante tres año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cerámica y cemento para su cuarto de habitación, por lo que anteriormente estaba solo embaldosada.

Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Alberto Pérez Sánchez works as a janitor in the Manuel Olivares Rodríguez Institute. He is married and has a son in his care who is school-aged. He has worked with CEPRODEL for three years. Thanks to the financings granted by CEPRODEL he has been able to take out 3 loans over this time, which were used to improve the home that he lives in. He is an excellent client. The loan he now requests will be used to buy construction materials such as ceramic tile and cement for a room in his house, because previously the floor was covered only in bare concrete. He takes this loan with the objective of providing better security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: David

texts.es:
El Señor David Cárdenas C., Labora como Vigilante en el Mercado Roberto Huembés de Managua.
 El tiene cinco  hijos a su cargo, y cuatro de ellos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra  para la  construcción de un muro en la parte delantera de la casa.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
David Cárdenas C. works as a security guard in the Roberto Huembés market in Managua. He is married and has 5 children in his care; 4 of them are school-aged. He has worked with CEPRODEL for a year. Thanks a previous loan granted by CEPRODEL he was able to improve the house that he lives in. He is an excellent client. The loan he now requests will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and stone to build a wall in the front of the house, with the objective of providing better security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Domingo Javier

texts.es:
Domingo E. Bermúdez, Labora como Vigilante en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua.
 El tiene dos hijos a su cargo, y estos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, esta casado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.
El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piedra  para la  construcción de tres pilares de concreto para  su casa y 5 pliegos de zinc, para el techo de su casa de habitación.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Domingo E. Bermúdez works as a security guard for the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. He is married and has 2 children in his care; they are both school-aged. He has worked with CEPRODEL for a year. Thanks a previous loan granted by CEPRODEL he was able to improve the house that he lives in. He is an excellent client. The loan he requests now will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, sand and stone to build three pillars of concrete for his house, and 5 sheets of corrugated metal for the roof of his home. His aim is to provide better security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Ricardo Jose

texts.es:
Ricardo F. A., Labora como Aseador en la Universidad Nacional Autónoma de Nicaragua. 
 El tiene un hijo a su cargo, y se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es padre soltero, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante un año, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido un crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento y arena para repellar una de las paredes de su casa  de habitación, ya que anteriormente no tenía repello.

Ricardo dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel  a hora cuenta de seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ricardo F. A. works as a janitor for the National Autonomous University of Nicaragua. He is single and has a son in his care who is school-aged. He has worked with CEPRODEL for a year. Thanks to a previous loan granted by CEPRODEL he was able to improve the house that he lives in. The loan he requests now will be used to buy construction materials such as cement, and sand to plaster one of the walls of his home which is unfinished. Ricardo said that thanks to the loans granted by CEPRODEL he now has security and a better quality of life for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: home improvement

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a motorcycle

loans.name: Volodimir

texts.en:
Volodimir is married and he and his wife live in Gladkovka, Kherson region, a predominantly agricultural area of Ukraine.

Volodimir owns a greenhouse where he plants and grows early spring vegetables and then sells them wholesale in the markets of his region. He launched this enterprise about fifteen years ago. Currently, he has 8,000 Grivnyas (approx. $1,000) invested in this trade. His net profit amounts to 3,500 Grivnyas a month.

Volodimir is requesting an 8,000 Grivnya loan to purchase polyethylene film, seeds and firewood for his greenhouse.

Volodimir is very sociable and communicative. He is also a man of integrity and relates to all his competitors with due openness and honesty. Volodimir always tries to achieve all his goals. We believe his natural vigor and perseverance will help this borrower to repay the current loan and succeed in his business.

loans.use: To purchase polyethylene film, seeds and firewood for his greenhouse

loans.name: Fermin De Jesus

texts.es:
Fermín de Jesús Hernández, Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Mayoreo de Managua.

 El tiene cuatro hijos a su cargo, y tres de ellos se  encuentran en  edad escolar, es ajuntado, ha trabajado  créditos con CEPRODEL durante diez años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido quince crédito en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL.
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena y piso para la casa ya que anteriormente solo tenía concreto.
Fermín dijo que gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por ceprodel  a hora cuenta de seguridad y una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Fermín works as a custodian in the Mercado Mayoreo in Managua. He has four children, three of which are school-aged. He has been working with and getting loans through CEPRODEL for the past ten years. Up to now he been able to invest the money from 15 loans to improve his home, thanks to CEPRODEL. He is requesting this loan in order to buy building materials, such as cement, sand and flooring for his home, as he only has a concrete floor. Fermín said that thanks to the loans he has been able to get through CEPRODEL, his children have a more secure place to live and a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of ready-to-wear for children

loans.name: Raisa

texts.en:
Raisa is married with a grown son. She owns a greenhouse in Gladkovka, in the Kherson region which is a well-known farming area of Ukraine. Raisa grows vegetables and greens in her greenhouse and sells them at a good price in March and April. She started this venture 10 years ago when she invested 8,000 UAH  in this enterprise. Her net profit amounts to 2,800 UAH a month.

Raisa is seeking a loan of 5,000 UAH to purchase farming supplies for spring sowing season. She is also planning to use the loan to refurbish and improve her greenhouse. Raisa is a typical entrepreneur striving to make a better life for her family. We believe her natural talent to carefully assess her environment and take advantage of it will allow her to stimulate her business growth, keep it sustainable and profitable, and ultimately achieve independence and security in life.

loans.use: to purchase polyethylene film, seeds and firewood

loans.name: Carmen Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Carmen R. R., es una señora  emprendedora dueña de un negocio de venta de colchones y camas. El cual comenzó con un capital inicial de C$10,000.00 que lo adquirió producto de un préstamo hace 10 años. Este negocio está ubicado en ciudad Sandino.
Ella vende ambulante junto con su esposo en los departamentos del norte del país.  
 El crédito solicitado es para invertir en capital de trabajo del negocio; como es la compra de hilaza y tela  para la elaboración de los colchones.
Es casada, con tres hijos a su cargo, dos de ellos se encuentra en edad escolar. Dice que antes de tener este negocio ella Trabajaba como domestica.

Lleva 7 créditos en  CEPRODEL a lo largo de 3 años los cuales ha invertido en su negocio con los que ha ido creciendo, diversificando sus productos para poder competir en el mercado, esto gracias a los financiamientos otorgados por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Carmen R. R. is an enterprising woman who owns a store that sells mattresses and beds. She started this store with an initial investment of 10,000.00 Nicaraguan Cordobas that she obtained through a loan 10 years ago. This business is located in the city of Sandino. She also travels with her husband to sell her products in the northern departments of the country. The loan requested is to be used for working capital to buy heavy duty thread and fabric to make the mattresses. She is married with 3 children in her care, 2 of whom are school-aged. She says that before having this business she worked as a domestic. She has had 7 loans with CEPRODEL over the period of 3 years, which she invested in her business. These financings granted by CEPRODEL helped her to grow, diversifying her products so that she could compete in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy heavy-duty thread and fabric for the production of mattresses

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of a portable Illico and rechargeable phone cards

loans.name: Cristina Eusebia

texts.es: La Srta. Cristina D. H. es soltera, vive en el distrito de Ocucaje, no tiene hijos, vive en casa de sus tías desde niña ya que es huérfana de madre, una de sus tías la apoya en el negocio de venta de comidas que tiene en el mismo domicilio brindando pensión de alimentos y desayuno a personal que trabaja en la zona. El negocio es conducido integramente por la titular y su tía a la cual le paga semanalmente, anteriormente trabajaba en otra ciudad como auxiliar en educación. Posee experiencia crediticia en Banco Azteca por uso de tarjeta de crédito. Sus excedentes los ha utilizado en mejoramiento de la vivienda e inversión de su negocio. Solicitan apoyo para cubrir gastos de remodelación y compra de mobiliario para su negocio. Sus sueño es hacer crecer su negocio y apoyar a sus tías las cuales son mayores de edad y mejorar su calidad de vida. La Srta. Cristina D. agradece el apoyo que le podamos brindar para hacer realizar sus sueños.
texts.en:
Miss Cristina D. H. is single, does not have any children, and lives in the district of Ocucaje. She has lived in her aunts' house since childhood, since she was an orphan. One of her aunts supports her in the business of selling food, which she has in the same house. They provide meals for people that work in the area. The business is run entirely by Cristina and her aunt, whom she pays weekly. Previously, she worked in another city as an educational assistant. She has experience with credit in Banco Azteca through the use of a credit card. She has used her savings for improvements to her home and investment in her business. They are requesting support to cover remodeling expenses and the purchase of furniture for their business. Her dream is to make her business grow and support her aunts, who are older in age, and improve their quality of life. Miss Cristina D. is thankful for the support that we can provide her to realize her dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase furniture for her business

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is married with a 4-year-old son, Slava. She lives in the town of Gladkovka, Kherson region. Tatyana owns a greenhouse and grows early spring vegetables for retail sale. She built her greenhouse next to her house which facilitates her business activity. Tatyana has been in this trade for seven years. She has 20,000 UAH invested in inventory. Her income amounts to 10,000 UAH. 

Tatyana is seeking a 15,000 UAH loan to purchase seeds for the upcoming sowing season, as well as to buy supplies to reconstruct her greenhouse. She is a very disciplined and determined entrepreneur. Tatyana invests much time and effort in her venture. Her main desire is to see it grow and expand, bringing her stable income as a result.

loans.use: to purchase seeds and supplies to reconstruct her greenhouse

loans.name: Graciela De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora Graciela de Jesús Moraga, ella tiene a su cargo dos hijos, y uno  de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta casada, es el segundo crédito que Trabajado con CEPRODEL, este lo ha invertido en mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda con el Créditos otorgados por CEPRODEL.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y pintura. Para terminar de cambiar el techo de su casa de habitación ya que este se encontraba en mal estado y en invierno el agua se pasaba.
Graciela dijo que gracias a los prestamos otorgado por ceprodel ha podido mejorar su casa de habitación por lo que a hora cuenta con mejores condiciones  en su hogar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Graciela de Jesus M.is married and has two children, one of whom is of school age. This is the second credit that she has requested through CEPRODEL, and this one will be invested in improving the conditions of her home. She will purchase construction materials such as zinc and paint. She needs to finish replacing the roof of her house, since it is in poor conditions and in the winter water leaks through it. Graciela said that thanks to the loans granted to her through Ceprodel, she has been able to improve her house and now lives in much better conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand her home

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase of cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé de quatre femmes mariées majoritairement dans des familles monogames avec en moyenne 37 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent le quartier Darsalam  de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles  se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage  et de leurs activités commerciales.
Ce groupe fait des activités diverses et variées. 
Après avoir correctement remboursés les cinq prêts précédents, elles  sont à leur 6ème  prêt solidaire qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 16 pièces de pagnes wax,  20kg de « sarkatanè », 8 kg de « n’gueni », 8 verres de « magnon kissè horon », 24 flacons d’Eau de Cologne (mourouni et Alices), 40 petits flacons de parfum pour encens,1/2 douzaine de parfum, 2 sacs de sucre,1 sac de gingembre,1 sac de feuilles d’oseille de Guinée, 1sac de lait en poudre de 25kg, 1carton d’arôme, des bouteilles et des sachets  plastiques où mettre les boissons locales pour la vente.  
 Elles s’approvisionnent en pagnes wax à Bamako et à la foire hebdomadaire de Ségou pour les autres articles achetés. La vente des marchandises se fait généralement à domicile et en ambulant à travers les quartiers de Darsalam, Médine et à Hamdallaye, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle  composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants.
 Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 37.750FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt de Soro Yiriwaso et satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is of four women married mostly in monogamous families. They have an average age of 37 and have on average four children. They live in Darsalam de Ségou (Fourth administrative region of Mali). They met each other through ties in the neighborhood and commercial activities. This group has diverse and varied activities. After having fully reimbursed their five previous loans, they are on their sixth group loan. It will be used to purchase 16 lengths of Wax brand pagnes [colorful West African fabric], 20 kg of sarkatanè, 8 kg of n’gueni, 8 glasses of magnon kissè horon, 24 bottles of perfume (Mourouni and Alices) [All ingredients for making incense], 40 small bottles of perfume for incense, half a dozen perfumes, 2 bags of sugar, 1 bag of ginger, 1 bag of hibiscus sabdariffa [bissap], one 25kg bag of powder milk, 1 box of flavoring, bottles and plastic bags to fill with local beverages for sale. They get their Wax brand pagnes in Bamako and the other items at the weekly fair in Ségou. The sale of merchandises is usually made from home and door-to-door through the neighborhood of Darsalam, Médine and in Hamdallaye. They sell for cash and on credit to customers who are men, women and children. They hope to make an average monthly profit of 37,750 Francs CFA, which will be used to reimburse their Soro Yiriwaso loan, and to fulfill small family needs.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various items

loans.name: Juan Francisco

texts.es: El señor  Juan Francisco Juárez es trabajador de Universidad popular como vigilante, es padre de familia de UN niños, carga del señor Juárez , ha obtenido TRES créditos de CEPRODEL y se siente agradecido por su apoyo y colaboración para mejorar su casa por que con esto ha podido darle a sus hijos mejor comodidad , con el primer crédito compro materiales para reparar el , techo con el segundo ,comprara materiales para hacer el piso  de su casa.
texts.en:
Mr. Juan Francisco J. works as a security guard at a university and is a family man. He has obtained three loans through CEPRODEL and feels thankful for its support and collaboration in improving his house, because he has been able to give his children greater comfort. With the first credit he purchased materials to repair the roof of his house, and with the second one he will buy materials to form the floor.

Translated from Spanish by Mark Broscoe, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and expand his home

loans.name: Sabougnouman Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Sabougnouman comprend quatre femmes dont une célibataire et trois mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogames.  Ayant en moyenne 34 ans et 2 enfants, elles vivent dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali). 
Elles  se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté  et de leurs activités commerciales  axées généralement  sur commerce d’articles divers. 
Après cinq prêts tous correctement remboursés, elles sont à leur 6ème prêt qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 16 sacs de pomme de terre, 28 seaux  en plastiques (20 petits et 8 moyens) contenant de la pâte d’arachide, 8 cartons de mèches, 1carton de parfum, 2 cartons de crèmes et pommades pour le corps et les cheveux.  
 Elles sont approvisionnées hebdomadairement, en pomme de terre,  par les forains de Loulouni et les transporteurs en provenance de Sikasso, en mèches et produits de beauté  de Bamako, en pâte d’arachide en provenance de Kita (1ère Région administrative du Mali).  La vente des marchandises se fait généralement à domicile, au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle  composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elles comptent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 31.350FCFA qui sera utilisé pour rembourser le prêt de Soro Yiriwaso et satisfaire les petits besoins familiaux notamment.
 Elles ambitionnent avoir une maison à usage d’habitation et avoir un moulin pour la transformation de l’arachide.
texts.en:
The Sabougnouman group is made up of four women, one single and three married, the majority of whom are in monogamous relationships. Averaging 34 years old with two children, they live in the Darsalam quarter of Ségou (4th administrative region of Mali). They know each other as neighbors, parents, and through their commercial activities, trading diverse articles. After five loans repaid in full, they are on their sixth loan. This loan will be used to buy 16 sacks of potatoes, 28 plastic buckets (20 small and 8 large) of peanut butter, 8 cartons of hair locks, 1 carton of perfume, and 2 cartons of hair and body cream. They purchase their stock weekly. Potatoes are purchased at the Loulouni fairgrounds and transported from Sikasso, hair and beauty products purchased in Bamako, and peanut butter in Kita (1st administrative region of Mali). Sales are generally made at home, in cash and credit, to a male and female clientele. They plan on making a monthly profit of 31,350 FCFA which will be used to repay the Soro Yiriwaso loan and meet the small needs of their families. They dream of having a home to live in and a mill to make peanut butter.

Translated from French by Kelly Percival, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of various articles

loans.name: Llama De Amor 123 Group

texts.en:
Sixto is the coordinator of her group Llama D. Amor (Call of Love).  Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti). Her group is located in the Samana peninsula, a lush but rugged area with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home in a simple structure with her husband and their three children.

Sixto is excited to be requesting her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loans and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business growing and selling name (yam), plantain, and yuca, all basic staples here in the DR. She will use the profits to invest in her home by remodeling it and purchasing a new floor as well as buying school supplies for her family. Her long term goal is to have her own corner store. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: purchase supplies for plantain, name (yam), and yuca farming

loans.name: Reward Group

texts.en: Moses Z. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called the Reward Group. He is 39 years old and married with three children who are between 5 and 10 years old. Moses was only able to attend school through 6th grade because of a lack of support from his parents. For four years, Moses has been selling food and drinks, such as sardines, milk, tomatoes and candles, at the 72nd Barracks in Paynesville, near Monrovia. He says that he sells the drinks very cold and sells good quality sardines and milk, which keeps customers returning. Moses plans to use his 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 22,000 Liberian dollar group loan to purchase more foodstuffs and drink for resale. His goal is to expand his business, and most important, to help his children by paying for their school fees. In the photo that accompanies this profile, Moses is the one holding the sign. About LEAP: The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To purchase sardines, milk, drinks, tomatoes, candles and other goods for resale

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es: El señor Reynaldo B. L. tiene de laborar en CEPRODEL  aproximadamente 18 años como guarda de seguridad su salario es de 178 dólares, con la ayuda de los créditos de CEPRODEL  ha logrado salir adelante ya que tiene una pequeña finquita donde siembra , frijoles, maíz y sus créditos han sido algunas  veces para este destino , también ha logrado mejorar su vivienda , salud de sus hijos , matriculas ya que tiene dos hijos en edad escolar se siente agradecido por el apoyo brindado por CEPRODEL.
texts.en:
Mr. Reynaldo has been working for CEPRODEL as a security guard for about 18 years. His salary is $178. With the help from loans from CEPRODEL he has been able to move forward. He has a small farm where he grows beans and corn. He sometimes uses his loans for his farm. Also he has improved his home. He has also provided healthcare for his children. He has two school-aged children. He is appreciative of the support that has been provided by CEPRODEL.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: healthcare for his daughter

loans.name: Francisco Javier

texts.es:
El señor francisco Javier Labora para Alcaldia de Managua , es de oficio mecánico pero el se desempeña como operario de limpieza,
Es padre de familia de sod hijos los cuales están en edad escolar , por lo que su crédito lo utilizara en compra< de útiles escolares para sus dos hijos .
El lleva dos años de trabajar con CEPRODEL  dos créditos en termino de dos años loc cuales los ha utilizado en momentos de emergencia y los ha sabido utilizar ya para el el desarrollo de familia es lo mas importante los montos han sido de acuerdo a la capacidad de pago ya que su salario es de 200 dólares poco para la situación económica del país.
texts.en:
Francisco Javier works for the municipality of Managua. He is a mechanic by trade, but he is working as a cleaner. He is the father of two children who are of school age. The funds from this loan will be used to buy school supplies for both of his children. Francisco has worked with CEPRODEL for two years, receiving two loans during that time. He has used those funds during times of emergency, and he has been able to use them effectively for his family's development, which is most important. The amounts have been in accordance with his capacity to pay, since his salary is 200 dollars, which is low for the country's economic situation.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing school supplies and paying school fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a motor-pump

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Hernández E. labora Para universidad Popular como vigilante durante cuatro años , con CEPRODEL  ha tenido la oportunidad de trabajar dos créditos  los cuales los ha utilizado para mejoras de vivienda , compra de materiales de construcción como arena , zinc , piedrín , bloque. para mejorar su calidad de vida de su familia aunque poco a poco por que los créditos van en dependencia de la capacidad de pago de acuerdo al ingreso ya que es una persona de escasos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel has been working as a security guard for the Popular University for the past four years. He has had two loans from CEPRODEL. He has used the loans to improve his home by buying construction materials such as sand, zinc, stone, and cement blocks. Improving his home has improved the quality of life for his family. This construction has occurred slowly as the loan amounts are dependent upon ones capacity to repay the loan. This capacity is based on income. He is a person that has scarce economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and enlarge his home.

loans.name: We Are Blessed Group

texts.en:
Helena V., on the right, is the leader of a group of five borrowers called "We Are Blessed." She is married with six children ranging in age from 5 to 15, all of whom attend school; her oldest child is the 12th grade and the youngest is in the 1st grade. Helena herself is a high school graduate. In addition to her children, Helena also helps care for her mother and grandmother.

Helena sells foodstuffs such as rice, cooking oil, flour, and onions from a table at the Red Light Market. Red Light is Liberia's largest market and is situated on the outskirts of the capital, Monrovia. She has had this business for about seven years, and started it with working capital of 4,000 Liberian dollars given to her by her parents. She says she maintains a good relationship with her customers and keeps them coming back by "being nice and friendly and making them laugh."

Helena hopes to be able to grow her business in the future. She will use her 6,000 Liberian dollar portion of this 26,000 Liberian dollar group loan to buy more foodstuffs to sell. "I will buy more goods to put on the table I sell from so that the table will be packed," she says. She wants to be able to continue to support her children's education, and hopes they all finish high school and go to college.

About LEAP:
The Local Enterprise Assistance Program (LEAP) is Liberia's largest and oldest continuously operating microfinance institution with 13 branches across the country. Founded in 1994, the non-profit organization has survived periods of civil war and severe socio-economic hardship. LEAP seeks to help rebuild post-conflict Liberia through its group and individual loans to micro- and small-scale entrepreneurs, and puts emphasis on lending to women.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs such as flour, rice, and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Nory Edith

texts.es:
Nory R. G. tiene 44 años, vive en el municipio de San Jacinto Bolívar, con su esposo que realiza labores del campo y sus 2 hijos en las edades de 20 y 17 años, su trabajo es  producir hamacas y bolsos, oficio que heredó de su mamá y lo realiza desde la edad de los 12 años, pues terminó su bachillerato haciendo hamacas de día y estudiando en horario nocturno.  En la actualidad Nory tiene un taller donde trabajan ella, su madre y su cuñada, las cuales  se dedican al tejido de estos productos artesanales hecho en telar de madera donde se realiza la traba de la hilaza y luego el tejido. Su mercado se encuentra en su misma localidad, pero algunas veces  envía  sus productos a la ciudad de Cartagena.  
Desde su ingreso al programa de grupos solidarios Nory ha recibido 5 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, en montos que oscilan desde $100.000, con el que inició hasta el que ahora requiere por valor de $ 1.500.000 que usará para comprar hilazas para elaborar  hamacas y bolsos. Todos sus créditos han sido cancelados oportunamente y le han servido para complementar el sostenimiento de su hogar pues gracias a los ingresos de ella y de su esposo, su entorno familiar ha mejorado y tienen casa propia.
Su meta es ayudar que sus dos hijos terminen en la universidad las carreras tanto de Química como de Farmacia y Medicina. Sus desafíos más notorios hacen referencia a  los grandes esfuerzos  creativos que debe hacer  épocas en que bajan las ventas  pues ella siempre le inventa un nuevo producto o un nuevo diseño que le da valor e impulsa la comercialización.
texts.en:
Nory R. G., 44, lives in San Jacinto Bolívar with her husband, who is a farmer, and their two children, who are 20 and 17 years old. She manufactures hammocks and bags. She inherited these skills from her mother and she has done this kind of work since she was 12 years old. She finished high-school at night because she would spend days making hammocks and bags. Currently, Nory has a workshop where she, her mother and her sister-in-law work. They weave these artesanal items on a wood loom where the thread is hooked and woven. Her customers are in her same town but she sometimes sends her items to Cartagena. Since her incorporation into the communal bank, Nory has received 5 loans from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo in amounts that vary from $100.000 that she began with to the one she is requesting now for $1.500.000, which she will use to buy cordage to make her hammocks and bags. She has repaid all her previous loans on time. She has used them to add to her family income. Thanks to her and her husband's earnings, the living conditions of her family have improved; they own their own home now. Her goal is to see that her sons finish their college education in Chemistry, Pharmacy and Medicine. Her most notable challenge is the great effort entailed in calling upon all her creative energy to create new and attractive designs for her products in order to ride out times of lowered sales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cord to make hammocks and bags.

loans.name: Roberto Francisco

texts.es: El señor Roberto Francisco González es trabajador de Uponic labora como conductor con tres hijos a su cargo , lleva dos crédito trabajados en dos años, el primer crédito lo utilizo para compra de materiales , como bloque , cemento mano de obra ya que son prestamos pequeños para construir  se necesita  mas dinero.
texts.en:
Mr. Robert works for Uponic. He works as a driver. He is responsible for three children. He has had two loans in the past two years. The first loan he used to buy construction materials such as cement block and cement. These are small construction loans. He needs more money.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To improve and enlarge his home.

loans.name: Toribio Gustavo

texts.es: EL señor TORIVIO GUSTAVO R. G.labora como vigilante para Universidad Popular y es primer crédito que trabaja con CEPRODEL esta vez lo solicita para ayudar a su esposa en su pequeño negocio de venta de tortillas, compraría maíz, leña. Para incrementar sus ingresos y poder salir adelante se siente contento con CEPRODEL  por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Torivio Gustavo R. G.works as a guard for the Universidad Popular. This is his first loan working with Ceprodel. He is requesting a loan to help his wife in her small business of selling tortillas. He will buy corn and firewood. He will do this to increase their earnings and to be able to get ahead. He is happy about the help offered by Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy basic grains and supplies for his wife's business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a freezer and Sodabi, a local drink

loans.name: Santos Hernan

texts.es:
el señor Santos Hernan N. C. tiene 50 años de edad, vive en union libre y tiene a su cargo tres hijos los cuales estan estudiando. Santos vende pescados desde hace unos 10 años, tiene su propio vehiculo donde transporta el producto desde Cedeño Choluteca hasta los puestos del mercado de San Lorenzo, Valle.
 
esta solicitando el crédito para comprar mas pescados y asi tener mejores ganancias.
su meta a corto plazo es comprar un carro pickup mas reciente para transportar su producto ya que el que tiene en estos momentos esta un poco viejo y empieza a darle problemas.
texts.en:
Mr. Santos is 50 years old. He lives with his partner and has three children for whom he is responsible. The children are studying. Santos has sold fish for the past ten years. He has his own vehicle that he uses to transport fish from Cedeño Choluteca to the stalls in the market in San Lorenzo, Valle. He is asking for a loan in order to buy more fish, which will allow him to increase his income. His short-term goal is to buy a newer pick-up truck to transport his products. The truck he currently uses is getting old and is starting to give him problems.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Benigno Octavio

texts.es:
El señor Benigno P. labora arduament como agente de seguridad en un centro de labores en el municipio de Somotillo. Es un caballero muy trabajador y que preocupa por el bienestar de su familia y por el mejoramiento de su vivienda que ha estado en malas condiciones.

La razón por la que solicita el crédito es para la compra de materiales de construcción como bloque,  zinc, arena, perlin y otros para mejorar la vivienda y así tener mejor condición de vida él y su amada familia.
texts.en:
Benigno Octavio P. works as a security guard at a labor center in the municipality of Somotillo. He is a very hardworking man that is very concerned about the well being of his family and improving his home which is currently in bad conditions. He is requesting this loan so that he can buy construction materials like concrete blocks, zinc, sand, timber and other items to improve his home and living conditions for himself and his family.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Improve and enlarge his home

loans.name: Nueva Union 5,6 Group

texts.en:
Alejandra is the coordinator of her group La Union (The Union), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Samana, a lush but rugged peninsula with a nascent tourism industry, where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and their three children.

Alejandra is excited to be taking her first loan with Esperanza and is excited for the opportunity to grow her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling sandals by the beach by purchasing different varieties of sandals to sell. She will use the profits to invest in her home by purchasing food and silverware, she would also like a TV. She will also invest in ehr children by purchasing school supplies. Her long term dream is to have her own home. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: Sandals to sell

loans.name: Bonerges

texts.es:
el señor Bonerges O. García tiene 60 años de edad, esta casado con Josefina Mejia con quien tiene  tres hijos, todos ellos ya adultos.
Bonerges tiene una venta de golosinas y una pulperia, tiene varios años de tener su negocio que esta ubicado en su comunidad de Jicaro Galan Nacaome,
Don Bonerges era cambista de dinero en las fronteras con El Salvador y Nicaragua pero un asalto lo dejo enfermo de sus brazos y una pierna, desde entonces se dedica a la venta de productos en su casa, esta solicitando el credito para surtir su negocio.
texts.en:
Mr. Bonerges is 60 years old and married to Josefina with whom he has three children. The children are all adults. Bonerges sells sweets and groceries. He has had this business for many years. It is located in the community of Jicaro Galon Nacaome. Mr. Bonerges was a money-changer on the border between El Salvador and Nicaragua. An assault left injuries to his arms and a leg. Since then he has been selling products in his home. He is asking for this loan in order to provide a larger variety of products to his customers.

Translated from Spanish by Esther Levandoski, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy milk products, sodas, rice, lard, oil, beans, corn and wheat flour, bread, juice, margarine, pastry, churros, water, eggs, sugar, coffee.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Donald Rogelio

texts.es: El señor Donald es un hombre muy trabajador, tiene 46 años de edad, casado y con tres hermosos hijos que estudian. Su negocio es una pulpería que tiene, pues se ha dedicado a la venta pero cuando lo buscan para trabajo de electricidad va a trabajar para ganar ese dinero. Ya que su profesión es electricista industrial, ha trabajado por muchos años en su profesión, luego, renuncio y trabajaba por cuenta propia. Ahora esta invirtiendo en el negocio de la pulpería en donde vende una variedad de productos de granos básicos, golosinas, jugos, gaseosas, pan, cartulinas, cosméticos, carnes, embutidos pollo entre otros. Con estos prestamos se ha beneficiado ya que ha logrado mejorar su casa, con el crédito anterior logro hacer un muro y ahora desea dividir la parte de donde tiene la pulpería ya que no tiene privacidad en su sala es por eso comprara materiales de construcción  para comenzar hacer la obra.
texts.en:
Donald is a very hard-working man. He is 46, married, and has three beautiful children who go to school. His business is a mini-market that he has. He has devoted himself to sales, but when they look for him to do electrical work, he does it to earn the money. He is an electrical engineer, and he has worked many years in his profession. He later resigned and worked on his own. He is now investing in the mini-market where he sells a variety of products like basic grains, sweets, juice, soft drinks, bread, cards, cosmetics, meat, sausages, and chicken, among other things. He has benefited from these loans and he has improved his house. With the previous loan he built a wall. Now he wants to partition the part where he has the mini-market. He does not have privacy in his living room. That is why he will buy construction materials to start the construction.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy construction materials to partition the living room and the mini-market for privacy

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of sheet metal

loans.name: Juana Delmy

texts.es:
la sra. Juana Delmy M. es una señora de 45 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estan ya grandes de edad, uno trabaja y el otro esta estudiando.

Juana se dedica a la venta de baleadas, café y osmil desde hace 12 años, se levanta a las tres de la mañana todos los dias para preparar sus productos y venderlos en su puesto que esta en la orilla de la
carretera panamericana, lugar que es muy transitado por carros pequenos y pesados, esta solicitando el credito para comprar una estufa nueva de gas ya que la que tiene ya esta vieja y le esta fallando.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana Delmy M. is a 45 year old woman. She is a single mom and has two adult children, one who works and one who is in school. Juana has been making a living selling "baleadas" (Honduran flour tortillas filled with beans), coffee, and oatmeal for 12 years. She gets up at 3AM every day to prepare her products and sell them at a stand she has on the side of the pan-american highway, a location that with heavy traffic from large and small vehicles. She is asking for a loan to purchase a new gas stove since the one she has is old and not working properly.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of gas stove

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Maria, 37, is a borrower who lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Renacer (Rebirth), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Maria is a single mother who lives with her two children in Samana, a small city in the northeastern region of the Dominican Republic. Life there can be rough with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Maria runs a successful business selling home products to her friends and neighbors. With this loan, Maria will purchase sheet sets to sell for a small profit.

This is Maria’s eighth loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve life for her family. With her profits, she hopes to purchase a small van in order to make her business more mobile. This will add to her profits, which will allow her to improve her home by finishing her bathroom and to purchase a computer for her children. Computers are difficult to afford, but are one of the best investments a low-income household can make. It gives access to the world of information that those of us in the developed world take for granted while teaching children to use the invaluable tools of modern technology. Maria hopes to have her own house one day — something of value she can pass on to her children.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Maria and the Nuevo Renacer group!

loans.use: To buy sheet sets for resale

loans.name: Glinis Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Glinis madre de familia de dos hijos, tiene 36 años de edad, junto su esposo se esfuerzan para poder hacer las mejoras a su casa, vive en el barrio Healeah,  pues han logrado ir a poco a poco haciendo las mejoras, su esposo es albañil lo que se le ha hecho mas fácil en la construcción ya que la mano de obra es cara. Su negocio es una pulpería que inicio hace siete años con dinero que su esposo dio, productos de su trabajo, cuando comenzó, palmeaba tortilla, vendía leña, y frijoles cocidos, y luego comenzó con la pulpería lo cual ha sido para ella una buena inversión ya que apoya a su esposo, cuando este no tiene trabajo. sus planes es poder seguir mejorando su casa ya que le falta el repello de las paredes por dentro, mejorar los baños, y lo que desea hacer con este financiamiento es poder cambiar el techo que esta totalmente dañado por viejo y desea hacerlo ante que comience el invierno ya que se ha mojado las otras temporada lo cual comprara: zinc, perlines, golosos, soldadura para cambiar todo su techo y poder estar mas tranquila cuando comience a llover. Con esta solicitud es su tercer ciclo el cual han sido de mucho beneficios ya que ha logrado mejorar las condiciones de vidas.
texts.en:
Mrs.Glinis has two children and is 36 years old. She and her husband make an effort to improve their home. They live in the neighborhood of Healeah as they have been able to improve their situation little by little. Her husband is a bricklayer which has made construction easier since labor is expensive. Mrs. Glinis' has a grocery store which she started seven years ago with money earned by her husband. Earlier she sold tortillas, firewood, and cooked beans. Afterwards, she started her grocery store business which has been a good investment for her as she is able to help when her husband is out of a job.
Her plans are to continue improving their home as she needs to plaster the walls and renovate bathrooms. She is requesting this loan to fund the fixing of the roof which is severely damaged due to age. She would like to fix the roof before the winter begins as it has gotten wet in the past. She plans to purchase zinc, beams, hinges, and weld to replace the entire roof and be able to have peace of mind when it starts to rain. This is her third round of loans; the previous loans have been very beneficial, allowing Mrs. Glinis and her family to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials to replace roof

loans.name: Leslie Yamileth

texts.es:
la señora Leslie Yamileth F. M. tiene 31 años de edad, vive en union libre con el señor Haylan Danilo Nuñez quien labora en la empresa nacional portuaria, son personas muy trabajadoras.
La señora Leslie se dedica al negocio de maquinas de juegos electronicos desde hace 05 años, poseen 12 aparatos que los rentan en varios lugares de San Lorenzo, esta solicitando el credito para comprar dos maquinas mas.
Leslie necesita el credito para salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Leslie Yamileth F. is 31 years old and lives with her common law husband, Haylan Danilo Nunez. He works for the national ports department. They are very hard working people. Leslie has been in the video game business for 5 years. They have 12 machines that they rent in various parts of San Lorenzo. She is requesting this loan to buy two more. Leslie needs this money to improve the lives of herself and her family.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy electronic games

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: La Ilusión De Los Ríos Group

texts.es:
Este banco comunal es llamado “La ilusión de los ríos”, es conformado por 19 socios, pertenecientes a la ciudad de Temuco. Ellos se dedican principalmente a negocios de repostería, peluquería, almacén y venta de ropa nueva y usada. 
Ana es la presidenta de este banco comunal, en la foto esta ubicada en 2º fila justo detrás del hombre agachado. Ella trabaja en un centro de Internet y librería, que es un negocio familiar, ubicado en la casa de uno de sus hijos. Invertirá este préstamo en artículos escolares, como por ejemplo resmas, lápices y cuadernos, además seguirá ahorrando para comprar una impresora. Su sueño es seguir pagando los estudios de su hijo, de 23 años que estudia pedagogía básica, y tener un negocio en su propia casa. Para Ana ha sido muy alentador trabajar con Fondo Esperanza, ya que le motiva trabajar con personas esforzadas igual que ella y también por la calidez del trato hacia ellos por parte del Asesor de Fondo Esperanza, quién es el encargado de impartir educación emprendedora.
Temuco es la capital de la región de la Araucanía. La ciudad se ubica a 670 kilómetros al sur de Santiago (capital de Chile) y posee una serie de balnearios lacustres y una flora y fauna nativa muy llamativas. Cabe destacar que en esta región habita el 50% de los mapuches, pueblo indígena, existente en nuestro país.
texts.en:
This communal bank is called "La ilusion de los rios". Its 19 members live in the city of Temuco and work mainly in the areas of; confectionery; hairstyling; warehousing; and used and new clothing sales. Ana is the president of this communal bank. In the photo, she's in the 2nd row behind the seated gentleman. She works in an internet cafe and bookstore, which is a family business located in the home of one of her children. She will invest this loan in school supplies; for example paper, pencils, and notebooks. She will also continue to save up for a printer. Her dream is to be able to continue paying for her 23 year old son to study education, and to have a store in her own home. Working with Fondo Esperanza has been very beneficial for Ana, since she finds it motivational to work with strong people like herself, and also because of the quality of her treatment by the Fondo Esperanza advisor, who is responsbile for entrepreneurial training. Temuco is the capital of the Araucania region. The city is located 670 km south of Santiago (capital of Chile) and features several lakeside resorts as well as very lovely native flora and fauna. It's also worth pointing out that 50% of all the indigenous mapuche people in the country live in this region.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: School supplies (paper, pencils, and notebooks, among other things)

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Maria se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras que durante mucho años vende en su casa y también  ambulante. Tiene 46 años de edad, procreo cinco hijos,  de los cuales solo dos están estudiando, su esposo sé dedica a la venta de leña y junto trabajan para poder pagar los gastos básicos y de alimentación, ya que todo esta caro. Cuando inicio lo hizo con poco dinero que su esposo dio producto de sus ventas, comenzó vendiendo verduras ya que eran baratas, ahora vende frutas y su proyecto es vender granos básicos, es por eso esta solicitud comprara: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, jabón, ase, frutas y verduras para aumentar las ventas y ayudarse más. Sus planes es poder hacer mejoras a su casa ya que le falta repellar las paredes, embaldosar, reparar los baños, para una mejor higiene pero aun no hace estas mejoras ya que todo esta a altos costos y no alcanza, pero espera lograrlo ahora que aumentara su capital. Con la solicitud anterior compro un caballo en el cual van a comprar las verduras al mercado Mayoreo en la capital de Managua a si como también  hacen sus ventas, y se le hace mas fácil. Todo gracias al financiamiento que Afodenic les ha dado.
texts.en:
Maria sells fruit and vegetables, and has been doing so for many years, both out of her home and on foot. She is 46 years old and has 5 children, only 2 of whom are in school. Her husband sells lumber and together they work to pay the basic costs of food, in these times when everything is expensive. When she began, she did it with what little money her husband was able to earn from his sales. She began by selling cheap vegetables, and now she also sells fruit. Her future plans are to sell basic grains, and that is why this loan will pay for; rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, fruit and vegetables to increase sales and get ahead. Her plan is to make improvements to her house, which needs plastering, tiling, and bathroom repairs for better sanitation. She has not yet been able to make these repairs, since everything costs so much, but she hopes by increasing her capital to be able to do so. With a prior loan she bought a horse, which they now use to go to the bulk market in Managua and buy vegetables, which makes the trip much easier. This is all thanks to the financial help Afodenic has given them.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, oil, soap, fruit and vegetables to increase sales and get ahead

loans.name: Yadira Liceth

texts.es:
la señora Yadira Liceth A. tiene 32 años de edad, es casada y tienen tres hijos, su esposo se dedica al comercio y Yadira se dedica a la venta de pescados, sus padres le enseñaron el negocio desde muy pequeña, esta a sido la actividad que ellos han realizado por siempre.
 
yadira trabaja desde muy corta edad tiene su propio negocio y le va muy bien esta solicitando el credito para surtir de pescado seco ya que se aproxima la epoca de semana santa.
en semana santa la venta de pescado es muy grande.
texts.en:
Yadira Liceth A. is 32 years old, is married and has 3 children. Her husband is a businessman and Yadira sells fish. Her parents taught her the fish business at a very young age, as they had always done it themselves. Yadira has been working since she was very little and has her own store. It's going very well and she is seeking a loan to increase her stock of fish in preparation for Easter season. During Easter season, fish sales rise dramatically.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lucia Yamileth

texts.es:
la sra. Lucia E. tiene 41 años de edad, vive en la colonia Brisas del Sur en la ciudad de Nacaome, Lucia se dedica a la venta de productos de consumo popular, tiene varios años de tener su pulperia. en estos momentos necesita el credito para poder comprar mas mercaderia y asi poder surtirla mas, tiene el problema que los carros repartidores solo pasan una vez por semana y a veces no logra comprar lo suficiente para tener producto en toda la semana, es por tal razon que esta solicitando el credito.
nos comento que se siente feliz ya que su negocio esta creciendo cada dia un poco mas. piensa que dentro de unos años se puede convertir en un mercadito bien surtido.
texts.en:
Lucia E. is 41 years old and lives in the Brisas del Sur neighbourhood of Nacaome city. Lucia sells consumer products and has had her shop for several years. Now she needs a loan to be able to buy more merchandise and be able to get ahead. She tells us that because supply vehicles only come by once a week, she is often unable to buy enough product to keep her shleves stocked all week. This is why she is requesting a loan. She says she feels very happy that her business is growing a little more every day. She thinks that within a few years it will become a thriving little market.

Translated from Spanish by Nadine Riopel, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lozenges, sodas, juices, eggs, beans, bread, cookies, rice, sugar, water, dairy products, lard, margarine, oil, coffee, peppers, jams, pastries, salt, milk, and spices

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a motorcylce taxi

loans.name: Luisa Amada

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca ubicada en el centro sur del país, esta ciudad es una fusión de tres culturas ricas en simbolismo tradición y arte como Cañari, Inca y Española los integrantes de éste banco son mujeres  luchadoras cabezas de hogar  en busca del bienestar de sus familias, son un grupo muy alegre y solidario que siempre están dispuestas a colaborar  entre ellas para que todas salgan adelante tanto familiar como económicamente. 

Luisa F.  tiene 49 años vive  en una casa arrendada en  la urbe de la ciudad de Cuenca con  tres de sus seis hijos,  los tres primeros ya son casados y viven independientes,  sus hijos de 16 y 13 estudian en un colegio nocturno para  trabajar y ayudar a su madre en casa ya que no tienen papá.

Luisa trabaja como cocinera en el  restaurante Pio Pio  hace 15 años y sus horarios son rotativos de 8 a.m. a 4 p.m. y el otro  de 3 p.m. a 11 p.m. y cuando falta alguno de sus compañeros tiene que doblar el turno,  además de ésta actividad  se dedica a la cría de pollos pero más sólo para entretenerse en casa  y no para negocio.

La señora Luisa se integró al banco comunal Alianza Unida  hace  cinco  años motivada por una vecina que es miembro del mismo, los créditos le han ayudado a salir adelante con sus hijos y tener hábito de ahorro, el dinero del préstamo solicitado  va a invertir en la educación de sus hijos pagando pensiones y  en la compra de nuevos uniformes y si le queda algo comprará  mas pollos.

Su meta es  comprarse un terreno para poco a poco ir construyendo su casa propia.
texts.en:
The communal bank "Alianza Unida" was formed in the city of Cuenca, located in the central southern part of the country. This city is a fusion of 3 rich cultures in its traditional symbolism and art, the Cañari, Inca and Spanish. The members of this bank are women who are heads of their households, and who struggle to provide for their families. They are a happy and supportive group; they are always ready to work together so that they all see their families advance economically. Luisa F. is 49 years old and lives in a rented house in the suburb of the city of Cuenca with 3 of her 6 children. The three oldest of her children are already married and live independently. Her children who are 16 and 13 years old study at a night school so they can work and help their mother at home, since they have no father. Luisa has worked as a cook in the restaurant Pio Pio for 15 years, and her schedule rotates from 8am to 4pm, to 3pm to 11pm. When one of her co-workers does not show up, she has to double her shift. In addition to this activity she raises chickens, but only to enjoy at home and not for a business. Luisa joined the communal bank "Alianza Unida" 5 years ago; she was encouraged by a neighbor who is also a member. The loans have helped her to get ahead with her children, and to have the habit of saving. The money from the loan she requests will be invested in the education of her children, paying school fees and buying new uniforms. If there is any money left she will also buy more chickens. Her goal is to buy herself some land so that, little by little, she can start building her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay school fees and buy new uniforms for her children, and also to buy chickens

loans.name: Enyel Bladimir

texts.es:
el joven Enyel C. tiene 22 años de edad, vive en la colonia brisas del sur en la ciudad de Nacaome, Enyel se dedica a la venta de zapatos para dama, caballero y niños, ahorita empieza la temporada escolar y desea comprar bastantes zapatos para niños y jovenes que estan empezando la escuela y colegio. 
necesita comprar zapatos al por mayor, ya que asi se tienen mejores ganancias.
dice sentirse muy feliz ya que a su corta edad tiene su negocio propio y le todo le esta saliendo muy bien.
su meta a corto plazo es poder tener un local y tener su negocio mas establecido y con muchas variedad de zapatos para todos los gustos y tamaños.
texts.en:
The young Enyel C. is 22 years old and lives in Colonia Brisas del Sur, in the city of Nacaome. Enyel sells shoes for women, gentlemen and children. The school year is beginning and he wants to buy enough children's and young people's shoes to supply primary and secondary students. He needs to buy shoes at wholesale and, in that way, he can earn more. He says he feels very happy that at his young age he can have his own business, and that all is going well for him. His short-term goal is to have a store and to have his business better established, with a wider variety of shoes for all tastes and sizes.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING SHOES FOR WOMEN, MEN, AND CHILDREN TO SELL

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Concepcion

texts.es: La señora Maria tiene la edad de 44 años, durante su trayecto de vida ha logrado tener su propio negocio venta de cereales, y venta de tortilla, procreo un hijo, y su esposo trabaja en un hospital de la capital, en donde trabaja en bodega y en la cocina es el que prepara la comida nutricionista. Doña Maria desde horas temprano se levantaba para palmear sus tortillas ya que salía ambulante a vender por los andenes de Managua. Entregaba en cargo de cereales y tortillas  en una empresa Telmark Nicaragua. Las ventas se vinieron poniendo bajas lo cual ella decide buscar trabajo en Telmark en donde le dan de conserje ya que la conocían. Lo cual para ella fue de gran oportunidad ya que tiene un salario fijo. Pero sigue haciendo cereal que se lo compran sus compañeros. Con esta solicitud de préstamo invertirá en la compra de materiales de construcción para hacer un muro por lo menos en la parte de alado levantarlo para ir poco a poco cerrando todo y poder tener un poco mas de seguridad ya que en el barrio que vive asecha mucho la delincuencia. Lo que es, para ella una necesidad en tener mas seguridad.
texts.en:
Maria is 44 years old. In her life's journey, she has succeeded in having her own business selling cereals and tortillas. She has one child, and her husband works in a hospital in the capital, where he works in the storeroom, and he prepares nutritious food in the kitchen. Maria used to rise early in the mornings to make her tortillas since she went out walking to sell them on the sidewalks in Managua. She gave up her cereal and tortilla sales to work for a company called Telmark Nicaragua. Her sales were going down, so she decided to look for work at Telmark, where they gave her a job as a janitor since they knew her. This was a great opportunity for her since she now has a fixed salary. But she keeps making cereal, which her coworkers buy. With this loan, she will purchase construction materials to build at least a side wall on her house, so she can close the house up little by little and have a little more security, since there is a lot of delinquency in her neighborhood. So she needs the wall for greater security.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials such as: stone, sand, cement and iron to build a side wall on her home for security

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of a motorcylce taxi

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Cereal purchase

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase of groceries and food staples

loans.name: Chantal

texts.fr: Chantal T. est une femme de 55 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 6 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de MBORO depuis 10 ans et a 2o fois de suite bénéficié de prêt. Avec son crédit elle développe un petit commerce de viande de porcs et d'une boutique installée à domicile. Son objectif est de subvenir aux besoins familiaux et d'aider son mari à la prise en charge de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Chantal T. is a 55-year-old woman, married and mother of six children. She has been a member ot the MBORO “Banc Villageois” loan group for the past ten years and was granted two successive loans. Her loan allowed her to develop a small business selling pork meat and a home-based store. Her objective is to meet family expenses and assist her husband in providing for their children.

Translated from French by René McConnell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Promote her small business

loans.name: Divin Niño Jesús Group

texts.es:
El comité  Divino Niño Jesús se formo hace un año después de que la mayoría de la gente que estuviera en un comité se retiro y decidieron entre ellas volver a formar un nuevo comité, ya con la esperanza de crecer y no volver a cometer los mismos errores que en el pasado.
Actualmente el grupo esta conformado por 15 señoras que viven en el asentamiento Divino Niño Jesús de San Lorenzo. En el ciclo pasado tuvieron dificultades con una de las señoras que retiro el crédito, entre todas -en medio de la pobreza en que viven- asumieron la deuda de su compañera, la cancelaron y así tuvieron la posibilidad de seguir trabajando con la institución. 
Una de las integrantes del comité es la señora Clotilde quien se dedica a la venta de frutas en una casillas frente a su casa y muchas veces de forma ambulante por la zona céntrica de la ciudad esto es cuando no vende sus productos en su barrio y no se genera el ingreso suficiente para mantener el negocio, ya que ayuda bastante con los gastos de la casa especialmente para la alimentación.
Cada señora tiene una experiencia de trabajo diferente que resulta muy interesante, en el listado se colocan las actividades que realiza cada integrante.
1
Clotilde G.
Venta de frutas y verduras
2
Delia F.
Venta de Ensalada de Frutas
3
Gloria Fernández
Reciclaje
4

Venta de empanadas
5

Almacen
6

Almacen
7

8

9

10
