texts.en:
The Divino Niño Jesús comittee was formed a year ago when most of the original members left and the remaining ones decided among themselves to form a new committee hoping to grow and not commit the same mistakes from the past. Currently, the group is made up of 15 women who live in the Divino Niño Jesús de San Lorenzo settlement. In the last cycle, they had a problem with one of the women who withdrew the funds. The rest of them, notwithstanding the poverty in which they live, assumed their fellow member’s debt, they repaid it and were able, therefore, to continue to have the possibility of working with the institution. One of the group members is Clotilde who sells fruit from a stand in front of her house and often as a peddler in the city center. The latter occurs when she does not manage to sell all her fruit in her neighborhood and she does not earn sufficient income to sustain the business because she contributes heavily towards meeting household expenses, especially food. Each woman has her own unique line of work, which is very interesting. The following list shows what each group member does: 1 Clotilde González Sells fruits and vegetables 2 Delia F. Sells fruit salad 3 Gloria Fernández Recycling 4 Daysi R. Sells turnovers 5 Maria A. Grocery store 6 Teodosia R. Grocery store 7 Marlene M. Clothing sales 8 Dalva R. Underwear sales 9 Jessica E. Perfume sales 10 Fatima B. Sells prepared meals 11 Laura L. Sells prepared meals 12 Gloria G. Sells beverages 13 Gladys T. Sells beverages 14 Virginia P. Sells fruit 15 Flora G. Manicurist

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lettuce, tomatoes, onions, peppers, cucumbers, oranges, apples and bananas.

loans.name: Silvia Johana

texts.es:
El banco comunal Alianza Unida se formó en la ciudad de Cuenca ubicada en el centro sur del país, esta ciudad es una fusión de tres culturas ricas en simbolismo tradición y arte como Cañari, Inca y Española los integrantes de éste banco son mujeres  luchadoras cabezas de hogar  en busca del bienestar de sus familias, son un grupo muy alegre y solidario que siempre están dispuestas a colaborar  entre ellas para que todas salgan adelante tanto familiar como económicamente. 

La señora  Silvia N. es una socia muy alegre de éste banco, está en su cuarto ciclo trabajando con la Fundación gracias a su amiga Zoila quien la invito a formar parte este gran grupo de mujeres. Con  apenas 23 años Silvia es casada y madre de dos niños de tres años y otro de cinco meses de nacido, su  esposo trabaja como cajero en un estacionamiento público de la ciudad, la casa en la que viven es arrendada siendo su mayor  sueño comprar un terreno para construir su casa propia y un local para incrementar su negocio.

Los prestamos accedidos anteriormente los invirtió en su antiguo negocio de venta de productos Yanbal, actualmente se dedica a la elaboración y venta de humas y tamales (realizadas de  maíz y queso), lleva ocho meses en ésta actividad y ya cuenta con su clientela fija, sus  actividades inician muy temprano ya que elaborar estos bocaditos es muy laborioso  y tiene todo listo a las 4pm que inicia sus ventas.

Con el dinero que recibirá del crédito solicitado va a comprar maíz, queso, mantequilla, huevos  y otros ingredientes para la preparación de sus humas y tamales.
texts.en:
The Alianza Unida communal bank was organized in the city of Cuenca, which is located in the south-central part of the country. This city combines three cultures rich in symbolism, tradition and art: Cañari, Inca and Spanish. The members of this bank are tenacious woman who are heads of household; they struggle daily for the well-being of their families. They are a cheerful and united group that is always willing to cooperate among themselves so that all will progress both personally and economically. Silvia N. is a very cheerful member of the bank. This is her 4th loan cycle with the Fundación thanks to her friend Zoila, who invited her to be part of this great group fo women. Silvia is only 23 years old, she’s married and has two sons: a three-year-old and a five-month-old. Her husband is a cashier in a public parking lot. They rent their home and her greatest wish is to buy a lot so that they can build their own house and a locale in which to set up her business. She used her previous loans in her previous business, which was the sale of Yanbal brand products. Currently, she makes and sells humas (cheese tamales) and tamales (made of cheese and corn). She has been in this line of work for 8 months and she already has her regular customer base. She starts her work activities very early because making these little bites is very labor intensive; she has everything ready for her sales that start at 4pm. She will use the funds to buy corn, cheese, butter, eggs and other ingredients needed for the preparation of humas and tamales.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for humitas (a type of cheese tamal flavored with anise) and tamales.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr: Jacqueline F. est âgée de 47 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est membre du banc Villageois de MBORO depuis 10 et a une bonne expérience en matière de crédit pour en avoir bénéficié à 20 fois de suite. Elle fait de l'embouche porcine et du maraîchage.Son activité lui a permis de construire une chambre pour ses enfants. Son ambition est de soutenir son mari dans la prise en charge de sa famille.
texts.en:
Jacqueline F., aged 47, is married and the mother of five children. She has been a member of the village bank of Mboro for 10 years and has a great experience with loans in that she has had 20 consecutive loans. She breeds pigs and grows vegetables. Her activity enabled her to build a room for her children. Jacqueline’s ambition is to support her husband with family expenses.

Translated from French by Robert Mouris, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her working capital

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
“Los Angeles”, es una alcancía comunal conformada por  10 socias entusiastas y emprendedoras, quienes tienen por afinidad realizar actividades de comercio minorista, trabajan con  EDAPROSPO- Prosperidad desde hace 1 año.
Magaly Carmen asume el cargo de presidenta, a sus 31 años, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos de 2 y 12 años de edad.
Desde hace 6  meses se dedica a la venta de salchipapas, decidió iniciar este negocio por que las  ventas de ropa no cubrían sus necesidades, con el esfuerzo de su labor diaria ha mejorado su vivienda y ha comprado artefactos electrodomésticos, sus ingresos cubren el pago de servicios, gas y la educación de sus hijos. Poner una tienda de abarrotes es el gran sueño de Magaly,  el reciente préstamo será destinado a la compra de mercadería (gaseosas e insumos) para su negocio, todos nuestros socios agradecen el apoyo brindado de los inversionistas y se comprometen a pagar en los plazos pactados. En la foto (niños hijos de las socias).
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Los Angeles” was formed by ten enthusiastic and enterprising members who have connected with each other through their small businesses. They have been working with EDAPROSPO-Prosperidad for one year.

Magaly Carmen was selected to be the group’s president. At 31 years of age, she is a single mother of two children, ages 2 and 12. For the past six months, she has been selling salchipapas (a fast food dish consisting of sausages and fried potatoes). She decided to start this business when her clothing sales did not generate enough income to cover her basic expenses. With great effort, Magaly works every day so that she can make improvements to her home and purchase appliances. Her income is enough to pay for utilities, gas, and her children’s education. Magaly dreams of opening a grocery store one day. This recent loan will be used to purchase merchandise (soft drinks and supplies) for her business.

All of the members appreciate the support of their investors and promise to make their payments on time. In the photograph, the members appear with their children.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Luz Y Progreso 1, 2, & 4 Group

texts.en:
Elba, 43, is a borrower who lives in L. Alcarrizos, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, Luz y Progreso (Light and Progress), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Elba is a single mother who lives with her three children in L. Alcarrizos, a small suburb of Santo Domingo, the capital of the Dominican Republic. Life in urban areas of the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Elba runs a successful beauty salon. With this loan, she plans to purchase a new hair dryer and more hair products for her customers.

This is Elba’s second loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve her home life for her family. Elba came to Esperanza not just for her loans, but because she likes the ideas and principles behind the work of the MFI. With continued profits, Elba hopes to purchase her own home someday. She also hopes to send her children to the best schools to get a great education. With your loan, she will be well on her way to accomplishing these goals.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Elba and the Luz y Progreso group!

loans.use: Hair dryer and haircare products

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo, the owner of A. Janitorial Services, has nine years of janitorial cleaning experience. Until recently, he worked for a large janitorial company, but in November of 2009 Leonardo made the commitment to strike out on his own. Between the demands of his new business and his part-time job at a golf course, he now works seven days a week, often from 7 a.m. to 9 p.m., but Leonardo is visibly enthusiastic about how things are developing. “I get great satisfaction being able to build my own company… this is something I am doing for my children,” he says.

Orphaned at the age of four, Leonardo was raised in Mexico City by his grandmother and uncle and the lessons they passed on inspired him to start his own business. “I saw the difference between people who had goals and a vision for the money they earned, and those who didn’t. My uncle was very good at business, and I could always look to him for advice.” With a strong determination to be his own boss, Leonardo makes time on top of his work schedule to take English lessons twice a week. It has been a great challenge, but he understands the need for good communication skills to help him attract new clients. 

With this loan Leonardo will be able to purchase a commercial-grade vacuum cleaner and the other new equipment that is necessary to continue his janitorial work at a local school, as well as expand the business. “This loan is a great help. With a little bit of investment I will be able to earn a lot more and provide a better future for my children.”

loans.use: To buy a commercial-grade vacuum cleaner and other janitorial equipment

loans.name: Luz Neila

texts.es:
Luz Neila Marin T., tiene 41 años de edad  y vive en el barrio España ubicado en el centro de la ciudad e Cartagena con sus 2 hijos  de 10 y 12 años de edad.  Ella tiene un negocio donde realiza actividades económicas mixtas: confecciones, variedades y peluquería; es separada y tiene la  custodia de sus menores porque su padre viajó al extranjero y por eso muy sola trabaja para sacarlos adelante;  Con mucho  esfuerzo se ha capacitado en  los oficios de confecciones, peluquería manualidades y artesanías, actividades de las que vive y le permiten luchar con vehemencia para conseguir el sustento de sus hijos. 
Ha recibido 11 créditos de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo desde su primer ingreso en el programa de grupos solidarios, hasta hoy  que está vinculada individualmente. Su participación en esta organización ha marcado una diferencia  en su vida, porque la han apoyado no solo con  crédito  sino  con asesoria empresarial y personal. En la actualidad aplica a un crédito de $1.500.000 que invertirá en la compra de útiles escolares, papelería, lencería,  accesorios para confeccionar disfraces vestidos de primera comunión y mercancía como sabanas y calzado.
En su negocio, tiene durante todo el año, convenios con colegios de la ciudad a los que les arrienda disfraces vestidos de primera comunión, porque fabrica todo tipo de vestidos y ropa deportiva. Mediante esta actividad ofrece a personas de escasos recurso su negocio de alquiler de vestidos ocasionales a muy bajo costo; ella también  vende útiles escolares y mercancía en general, por eso es muy conocida en esta comunidad.
Su  principal sueño  es adquirir vivienda propia con un local contiguo para su negocio  y llevar  a sus hijos a la universidad  y darles la educación que ellos merecen. Su desafío principal es sostenerse en el mercado con un buen nivel de competitividad.
texts.en:
Luz Neila Marin T. is 41 years old and lives in the España neighborhood in central Cartagena with her two children, ages 10 and 12. She has a business where she engages in three economic activities: a sewing workshop, a variety store, and a beauty salon. Luz is separated from her husband and has custody of her children because their father left the country. Therefore she must work with great effort in order to get ahead. She learned how to sew and style hair, skills that enable her to make a living and fight vigorously to support her children.

Since first entering the solidarity group program, Luz has received eleven loans from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She now receives individual loans. Her participation in the organization has made a difference in her life because she has received business and personal advice in addition to taking out loans. At the moment, she is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 COP to purchase school supplies, stationery, lingerie, accessories for making first communion dresses, linens, and shoes.

Throughout the year, she has contracts with schools in the city to rent out first communion dresses since she manufactures all kinds of clothing and sportswear. Through this activity she gives poor people the opportunity to wear clothing for special occasions at a very low cost. Luz also sells school supplies and general merchandise, so she is well-known in the community.

Her main goals are to acquire a home of her own that is adjacent to her business and provide her children with the college education they deserve. The main challenge that she faces is maintaining her business in a competitive marketplace.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for making first communion dresses, as well as school supplies, stationery, lingerie, linens, and shoes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fertilizer

loans.name: Jenny

texts.en: With a solid, loyal client base, Jenny approached ACCION USA for the capital and know-how she needed to expand her home-based cosmetics business. With her one-year old daughter by her side Jenny enjoys being her own boss. Having weathered the recent financial crisis, Jenny feels she is now in a good position to grow her business. With the knowledge she gained at ACCION USA's educational seminars Jenny plans to continue expanding her business, supporting her family, and increasing her independence. She placed her loan request well in advance of Valentine's Day, so she was ready to capitalize on this big sales opportunity. Jenny was so happy working with ACCION USA that she often refers other entrepreneurial friends. Originally from Honduras, Jenny feels that she is living proof that you can achieve what you dream. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products

loans.name: Medardo

texts.en: Medardo and his wife moved their women's clothing import-export business from Mexico City to Miami in 2006, hoping to better serve their increasingly global client base. Their decision paid off since their business has steadily grown; they now have an employee and clients who sell their products locally. Medardo and his wife, originally from Honduras, heard about ACCION USA from their daughter. The proceeds of their loan will be used to purchase bathing suits and sportswear and other items from their suppliers' Summer 2010 collection. This investment ensures that they can fill orders fast, better serving their clients and, hopefully, increasing profits. About U.S. Microfinance and ACCION USA: Have you ever thought about how the cute new café on your corner or the salon you frequent every month got the financial resources to start their business? Chances are, they drummed up support from their friends and family, dipped into their personal savings, used a high-interest credit card, or all of the above. An estimated ten million small businesses in the U.S. face difficulty obtaining loans from traditional banks, even prior to the current “credit crisis”. Microfinance institutions, like ACCION USA, support these “unbanked” small businesses by giving them access to fairly-priced capital and business education. Small businesses also help stabilize low- to moderate-income neighborhoods and rebuild our economy through income growth and job creation. Self-employment provides workers with a way to increase their incomes, support their families, and strengthen their communities. As unemployment rises in the U.S., more and more people are turning to self-employment and start-up enterprises as a way to take control of their economic futures and provide employment opportunities in their communities. The need for support of small businesses in the U.S. is great, and it is one that ACCION USA has been striving to meet since 1991.

loans.use: To buy bathing suits and sportswear

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buy ingredients

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
Alicia tiene domicilio propio junto a su esposo y sus hijos, la casa esta ubicada en la zona D. la portada C/ Mariano Mamani Nº 2119, tiene un puesto en la plaza Eguino donD. venD. los sacos confeccionados por su esposo, a demás D. vender chamarras chinas.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado para aumentar su capital D. trabajo (compra D. paños para confección D. sacos).

Su trabajo, y la experiencia le dan la oportunidad D. acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Alicia lives with her husband and children in her own home, which is located at No. 2119 C/ Mariano Mamani in the District of Portada. She has a vending post at the Eguino Plaza where she sells bags manufactured by her husband as well as jackets from China.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her operating capital (to buy material for making bags). Her work and experience qualify her for this opportunity to access a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material for making bags

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat flour

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wheat

loans.name: La Solucion 8 Group

texts.en:
Ayde, 42, is a borrower who lives in Samana, Dominican Republic. She is the coordinator for her group, La Solucion (The Solution), and her story is representative of those in her group and other Dominican and Haitian borrowers at Esperanza International.

Ayde and her husband live with their two children in Samana, a small town in the northeastern region of the Dominican Republic. Life in the Dominican Republic can be rough, with no potable running water, frequent power outages (if one has power to begin with), and inadequate healthcare. Despite these difficulties, Ayde runs a successful mobile clothing business. With this loan, she plans to purchase new shirts and undergarments to sell to her friends and the women in her community.

This is Ayde’s second loan with Esperanza International, and she hopes to continue taking out loans to grow her business and improve her home life for her family. She hopes to purchase a radio and new dishes for her home, as well as new school supplies for her children. Ayde’s profits also have allowed her to have fun activities with her family, such as ordering pizzas or going out for ice cream. In the past, these types of activities would not have been possible. Her long-term dream is to have enough money to buy a small store where she can run her business, rather than having a mobile business as she does now.

Esperanza International seeks to free children and their families through initiatives that generate income, education and health, restoring self-worth and dignity to those who have lost hope. We have over 8,500 active associates in eleven offices in the Dominican Republic and Haiti. Thank you for lending to Ayde and La Solucion group!

loans.use: To buy shirts and undergarments for resale

loans.name: Amalia Benedicta

texts.es:
Amalia vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona Alto San Pedro, junto a su esposo e hijos, elabora artesanías que son vendidas en diferentes ferias de La Paz y el interior del país.

El crédito que solicita será utilizado para incrementar su capital de trabajo (compra de tela y adornos).

Su trabajo y la experiencia le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito.
texts.en:
Amalia lives with her husband and children in the home of her parents located in the district of Alto San Pedro. She makes handicrafts that she sells at different fairs in La Paz and in the interior of the country. The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her operating capital (for buying fabric and trim). Her work and experience gives her the opportunity to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fabric & trim

loans.name: Las Conquistadoras Group

texts.es:
Este grupo  de personas, se encuentran ubicado actualmente en la Colonia Santa Marta
Mazatenango, Suchitepéquez, en la cual son personas que se conocen entre si, y cada una 
de ellas tiene su pequeño negocio en la cual están colaborando al ingreso familiar, y como
también son personas que visionan la buena vida de sus hijos, dándoles una educación y
salud para tener una vida mejor,  ellas han venido desde atrás, luchando cualquier 
dificultad en la vida y a base de eso han creado sus propios negocios en compra y venta de 
ropa,  productos básicos, como azúcar, frijol, y venta de comidas, en la cual no tienen un
local propio y son ambulantes, pero les da un ingreso para poder sostenerse, la cual 
con la visión de que sus negocios tengan estabilidad, y proporcionar un mejor servicio
 a sus clientes se vieron en la necesidad de acudir en la Asociación Asdir, para la solicitud de 
un préstamo para el cubrimiento de sus necesidades y una vida mejor.
texts.en:
This group of individuals currently lives in the district of Santa Marta Mazatenango, Suchitepéquez. They know one another and each of them has a small business from which they generate income for their families. In addition, they envision a good life for their children by providing them with an education and good health in order to have a better life. Coming from behind, they have fought to overcome any difficulty in life. As a result, they have created their own businesses buying and selling clothing; basic products such as sugar and beans; and prepared foods. They do not have their own shops, but work as traveling merchants instead. The income they generate allows them to support themselves, stabilize their businesses, and provide the best service to their customers. They decided to request a loan from Asociación ASDIR to help them cover their necessities and achieve a better life.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital to expand their respective businesses

loans.name: Marta Ester

texts.es:
Doña Marta Ester P. Ocho, quien actualmente cuenta con 25 años de edad, y reside
en el municipio de san Antonio Suchitepéquez, solicita su crédito especialmente para el 
mejoramiento de educación de sus dos hijos, la cual ella tiene la visión de mejorar 
las condiciones de vida de sus niños, ella anteriormente se dedica a oficios domésticos 
pero la cual con el tiempo se profesionalizo y tiene actualmente un trabajo que lo 
ayuda al sostén de la vida diaria, pero se vio en la necesidad de elaborar el préstamo 
porque lo que le ingresa no son suficientes para satisfacer todas sus necesidades.
texts.en:
Marta Ester P. Ocho, 25, lives in San Antonio Suchitepéquez. She is requesting funding to improve the education of her two children. She hopes to thus improve their living conditions. She used to be a domestic worker but she has gradually received training and has become more professional; she now has a job that helps her with her daily expenses. However, she needs funding because her earnings aren't sufficient to meet all her needs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay annual tuition for her two children.

loans.name: Norma Lucia

texts.es:
La señora Norma es socia del Banco Comunal “San Pedro” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Acora, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 02 hijos. Ella  estudio primaria completa, se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado.

Norma nos cuenta que con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles con el cual podrá comprar un toro.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar sus ventas para así vivir mejor.

Lo que mas le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones que se realiza cada mes.
texts.en:
Norma has been a member of the “San Pedro” communal bank for 3 years. She is from the Acora district in the Puno province and department. She is 43 years old, a single mother and has 2 children. She has an elementary school education and buys and sells livestock for a living. Norma tells us that with the first loan she received from the Manuela Ramos Movement, of 300 PEN, she was able to increase her capital. She is asking for a loan of 1500 PEN so that she can buy a bull. Her dream for the future is to increase her sales so that she can have a better life. What she likes the most about her communal bank are the monthly meetings.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: TO BUY A BULL

loans.name: Medalith

texts.es: Medalith, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive en el Distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 42 años, es madre de un menor de edad, ella se dedica al alquiler de su motocar, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja como chofer de motocar. Medalith forma parte del Banco Comunal “El Fruto Bendito”, desde hace 2 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de comida, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será destinado a la adquisición de un motocar. La meta de Medalith es tener otro motocar para generar más ingresos y así llegar a poseer una flota de motocarros.
texts.en:
Medalith is a very entrepreneurial woman. She lives in the District of Manantay, of the Ucayali region. She is 42 years old, and became a mother at a young age. She rents her motorcar with the help of her husband who works as a motorcar chauffeur. Medalith has been a member of “El Fruto Bendito” Community Bank for 2 years. The first loan that she received was for 300 soles, which she invested in food sales. She now needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be used to acquire another motorcar. Medalith's goal is to have another motorcar so that she can create a greater income and eventually possess a fleet of motorcars.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcar.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
La Sra. Francisca tiene 50 años, es viuda y tiene un hijo mayor de edad con quien trabaja. 
Ella tiene un terreno en el cual cultiva distintas plantas ya sean ornamentales, como de estación, para luego comercializarlas en el Mercado municipal de Itaugua ; también las vende casa por casa con su hijo en una carreta a tracción animal y a hogares particulares en las cuales ademas de vender sus plantas realizan trabajos de jardinería ( Siempre en compañía de su hijo). 
El crédito será de ayuda para la compra de semillas de Azalea Brasilera, esta especie es muy requerida por sus clientes y es un tanto costosa, como es el inicio de su temporada desean realizar la compra para cubrir los pedidos que van recibiendo, ademas de esto desean seguir adquiriendo las semillas de estación.
El anhelo de Doña Francisca anhela poder adquirir un puesto fijo en el Mercado de Itaugua lugar cercano a la Ciudad de San Lorenzo para la ubicación en el mismo de un vivero permanente.
texts.en:
Francisca is 50 years old, a widow, and the mother of an adult son that she works with. She has a plot of land on which she grows many different seasonal ornamental plants in order to later sell them in the municipal market of Itaugua. She also sells them door to door with her son in an animal-drawn cart, and at some specific houses where in addition to selling her plants she does gardening jobs (always in the company of her son). The loan will be used to help her buy Brazilian Azalea seeds, a species in high demand by her clients that is a bit expensive. As it is the beginning of its growing season she wants to buy enough to cover the orders that she is receiving. Additionally she would like to continue to acquire the seasonal seeds. Francisca's wish is be able to acquire a permanent place at the Itaugua market, a place close to San Lorenzo City and to have a permanent residence there also.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Brazilian seeds, and other seasonal seeds.

loans.name: Patricia

texts.es:
Patricia, es una mujer trabajadora, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 41 años, es madre de 2 hijos mayores de edad, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su vivienda, es divorciada. Patricia forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2”, desde hace 4 años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido  en la compra de gaseosas.
Con este crédito de 500 soles, comprará productos para su bodega como arroz, azúcar, fideos, etc. La meta de Patricia es ampliar su negocio y seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Patricia is a very hardworking woman. She lives in the Calleria District of the Ucayali region. She is 41 years old, divorced, and the mother of 2 adult children. She runs a grocery store out of her home. Patricia has been a member of the “Las Golondrinas 2” Community Bank for 4 years. The first loan that she received was for 300 soles which she used to buy soft drinks. With this loan of 500 soles she will buy products for her store, such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc. Patricia's goal is to continue progressing and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy products for her store, such as rice, sugar, noodles, etc

loans.name: Jessica

texts.es:
Jessica, es una mujer muy laboriosa, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 34 años, es madre de un menor de edad, ella se dedica a la compra de tucos de volaina (para la elaboración de escobas), esta actividad la realiza en su local de aserrío, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien le ayuda en las compras. 
Jessica forma parte del Banco Comunal “Nuestra Sra. De la Esperanza”, desde hace 5 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de repuesto para su aserradero, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 3000 soles, que será destinado a la compra de cubota para su aserradero. La meta de Jessica es implementar su local con mercaderías y productos de belleza.
texts.en:
Jessica is a very hard-working woman. She lives in the District of Calleria, Ucayali region. She is 34 years old and the mother of a young child. She buys tree trunks of the volaina (used for making brooms and lumber for construction). She carries out this activity at her lumber mill. She relies on the support of her husband, who helps her in the purchases. Jessica has been part of the “Nuestra Sra. De la Esperanza” Communal Bank for 5 years. The first loan that she received was for 300 soles and was invested in the purchase of a replacement for her saw. Now she needs a loan of 3000 soles, that will be used to purchase of a kubota motor for her sawmill. Jessica's goal is to supply her location with merchandise and products of beauty.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a cubota for her sawmill.

loans.name: Cecilia De

texts.es: Cecilia es una señora que está casada y vive en una casa que es propia. En la casa vive toda su familia que consta de 6 personas, ella su esposo y sus cuatro hijos, Cecilia trabaja como empleada fija en una empresa que se dedica al servicio de limpieza a empresas privadas y también a residencias particulares. Por otra parte su esposo es maestro contratista de albañilería. La competencia en sus actividades es media ya que hay otras personas  que desarrollan las mismas actividades. Pero el tiempo que ambos desarrollan sus actividades les permite contar con experiencia y sobre todo con clientela fija. El crédito será destinado como capital de trabajo del esposo para la compra de materiales de construcción  que requiere en algunas obras que efectúa como obra vendida. Esta será su sexta operación de créditos con Agrocapital, con un excelente cumplimiento de pago en todas sus otras operaciones. Los esposos son personas muy responsables y trabajan juntos para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Cecilia is a lady who is married and lives in a house that is her own. In the house lives her entire family that is comprised of 6 people: Cecilia, her huband and their four children, Cecilia works as a regular employee in a business that is dedicated to providing cleaning services to private enterprises and also to private residences. Her husband is a master bricklayer. There is the usual competition in their fields now that there are other people that offer the same services. But their early beginning permits them to build on their experience, above all with their regular clientele. The loan will be used as working capital for the husband for the purchase of building materials that he requires in some works that he prepares as finished goods. This will be her sixth loan cycle with Agrocapital. She has an excellent record of payment in all her other loans. The couple are very responsible people and work together to help their family get ahead.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buy building materials for her husband's bricklaying business

loans.name: Arco Iris (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Arco Iris está  formado por mujeres muy alegres, activas que buscan la unión y cooperación entre ellas para salir adelante y sobre todo tienen un vínculo familiar , el banco está ubicado a  unos diez minutos a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca  en la comunidad Tres Marías en  la parroquia Turí, esta localidad es conocida como el balcón de Cuenca, su gente se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería, muchos habitantes  han migrado a las grandes ciudades en busca de un buen trabajo y una mejor calidad de vida.

Nancy C. es una señora de 37 años y es una de las socias más alegres  del banco, vive  en su casa propia en la comunidad Tres Marías a las afueras de la ciudad de Cuenca junto a su esposo de profesión albañil y sus cuatro hijos de 15, 14, 11 y 10 años, su hijo mayor trabaja en una carpintería para sus gastos personales porque no le gusta estudiar y su hijo de 11 años es un niño especial que requiere mayores cuidados. 

Nancy se dedica a la venta de salchipapas, colas, golosinas,  lleva ya 10 años en este negocio que lo tiene en su misma casa, tiene días buenos y otros no tanto pero sigue adelante. Este  es su octavo ciclo en la fundación y los créditos  obtenidos ha invertido en la construcción de su casa, con el préstamo que pronto le entregarán va a comprar colas, papas, embutidos y salsas para incrementar su negocio y hacer realidad su sueño.

 Marcia tiene 27 años vive con su esposo  y sus  dos hijos que se encuentran de 8 y 7 años de edad, su esposo es albañil de profesión, no poseen casa propia por lo que viven en la casa de sus padres,  

Marcia C.  se dedica a la cría y venta  de cuyes y  pollos estos son  vendidos en su comunidad ya pelados lleva varios años  en esta actividad que le ha permitido estabilizarse económicamente, es su octavo ciclo en la fundación y los créditos le han ayudado para incrementar su negocio.

Con el dinero que reciba del préstamo solicitado va a  comprar  pollos y alimento para su crianza e ir incrementando su criadero de pollos y hacer su sueño de tener casa propia una realidad.
texts.en:
The Rainbow communal bank is formed of active, very happy women that seek union and cooperation among them to do well. Above all they have a family link. The bank is located some ten minutes on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca in the Tres Marías community of the Turí parish. This area is known as the balcony of Cuenca. Its people are dedicated to agriculture and stockbreeding. Many inhabitants have emigrated to the large cities in search of good work and a better quality of life. Nancy C. is a lady of 37 years and she is one of the happiest associates of the bank. She lives in her own house in the Tres Marías community on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca along with her husband, a professional bricklayer, and their four children ages 15, 14, 11 and 10. Her oldest son works as a carpenter for his personal expenses because he does not like to study. Her son of 11 years is a special boy that requires great care. Nancy is dedicated to the sale of salchipapas (a fast food made of fried potatoes and hot dogs or sausage), carbonated drinks, and other delicacies. She has been running this business for 10 years from her house. She has good days and bad days, but she continues ahead. This is her eighth loan cycle with the foundation and the loans she has obtained have been invested in the construction of her house. With the loan that she now requests, she will buy carbonated drinks, potatoes, sausage and sauces to increase her business and to make her dream a reality. Marcia is 27 years old and lives with her husband and their two children that are 8 and 7 years of age. Her husband is a bricklayer by profession. They do not have their own house, but live in the house of their parents, Marcia C. is dedicated to the raising and sale of guinea pigs and chickens, which she sells already prepared in her community. She has carried out this activity for several years, and it has allowed her to become economically stable. This is her eighth loan cycle with the foundation and the loans have helped her to grow her business. With the money that she will receive, she is going to buy chickens and food for breeding them and grow her chicken coop. She hopes to make her dream of having her own home a reality.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy carbonated drinks, potatoes, sausage for a fast food business and also chicks and feed for a chicken raising business, among others.

loans.name: Remberto

texts.es: Remberto cuenta con 27 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos y cuenta con casa propia que está dotada de los principales servicios básicos. Su principal actividad es el transporte de pasajeros con su propia vagoneta, en la ruta local perteneciendo a la cooperativa de la localidad, contando con ruta y parada fija. Tiene 5 años de experiencia en el rubro del transporte. En el sector del transporte de pasajeros existe fuerte competencia, sin embargo su fortaleza radica en que trabaja en una ruta fija y cuenta con una parada fija perteneciendo a una cooperativa de transporte, quienes por su estabilidad y el buen servicio cuentan con bastante clientela que requieren de sus servicios, y cuya parada está estratégicamente ubicada frente al mercado central de la ciudad. El crédito que lo obtuvo lo destino a arreglos en su vagoneta. Remberto y su familiar cuentan con 4 créditos en la Institución, demostrando un excelente comportamiento de pagos, contando con crédito tan solo en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Remberto is 27 years old, single, has no children, and owns a home that is equipped with essential basic services. His main business activity is trasporting passengers in the station wagon that he owns. Remberto drives along a route that belongs to the local cooperative and has five years of experience. In the passenger transport sector there is strong competition, but Remberto has the advantage of operating on a route owned by the transportation cooperative, which is known for its stability and providing good service to its customers. His station is also strategically located in front of the city’s central market.

The loan he is requesting will be used for repairs to his station wagon. Remberto and his family have taken out four loans with the Institution. He has demonstrated an excellent payment history and has only requested loans from our Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es:
Teofilo cuenta con 22 años, es soltero, no tiene hijos y  cuenta con lote de terreno. Su principal actividad es el transporte de pasajeros con su propia vagoneta, en la ruta local perteneciendo a una línea de los trufi local, contando con ruta y parada fija. Tiene 4 años de experiencia en el rubro del transporte. En el sector del transporte de pasajeros existe fuerte competencia, sin embargo su fortaleza radica en que trabaja en una ruta fija y cuenta con una parada fija perteneciendo a una línea de transporte que cubre la ruta de una ciudad a otra que se encuentra al otro lado del país, quienes por  el buen servicio cuentan con bastante clientela. El crédito que lo obtuvo lo destino para el amurallado de su lote y compra de un portón.
Teofilo y su familiar cuentan con 4 créditos en la institución, demostrando un excelente comportamiento de pagos, contando con crédito tan solo en nuestra institución.
texts.en:
Teofilo is 22 years old, single, does not have children, and owns a plot of land. His main business activity is providing passenger transportation services in the station wagon that he owns. Teofilo operates locally as a “trufi” (a taxi that travels along a specific route and has fixed stops) and has four years of experience in this business. In the passenger transport sector there is strong competition, but Teofilo has the advantage of driving a fixed route with established stops for a company that is known for providing good transportation services to the other side of the country and has a steady clientele.

This loan will be used to build a wall on his property and purchase a gate. He and his family have taken out four loans with the Institution and has demonstrated a good payment history. Teofilo has only requested loans from our Institution.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a wall and install a gate on his property

loans.name: Maria Magdalena

texts.es:
La señora Maria es socia del Banco Comunal “Las Calceteras” desde hace 3 años atrás, del distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 52 años de edad, es separada y tiene 03 hijos. Ella estudió hasta quinto de secundaria, se dedica a la compra y venta de golosinas, paralelamente vende tejidos a mano.

Maria nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 400.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella requiere un crédito  de S/. 1,500.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  galletas, chocolates, caramelos, lana, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de abarrotes. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los ahorros y encontrarse con las compañeras en cada reunión
texts.en:
Sra. Maria has been a member of “Las Calceteras” Communal Bank for three years. She is from the District of Juliaca, San Román Province, Department of Puno. Maria is 52 years old, separated from her husband, and has three children. She completed her studies through the fifth year of secondary school. Her businesses include buying and selling candy and making hand-woven articles for sale.

Maria says her first loan from Manuela Ramos was in the amount of 400 soles and used to increase her operating capital. She now needs a loan of 1500 soles in order to buy cookies, chocolates, caramels, wool, etc. Her dream for the future is to open a grocery store. What she enjoys most about her Communal Bank are the savings account and the meetings with the other members.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase cookies, chocolates, caramels, wool, etc.

loans.name: Nuevo Horizonte Group

texts.es:
El comité Nuevo Horizonte nace hace poco mas de 7 meses para tener acceso al crédito y demás servicios que ofrecen la fundación. Se unieron varias vecinas que se conocen desde hace varios años y a partir de ahí tomaron el habito de reunirse todos los domingos por las tardes, se ayudan bastante y todas juntas están aprendiendo a construir su comité. 
El crédito será utilizado para la compra de los artículos dependiendo de la actividad a que se dedica. .
Así la Señora Rosana se dedica a la venta de ropa y lo realiza de manera ambulante visitando a los clientes a quienes ofrece sus productos para vender.
Las actividades a que se dedican las demás integrantes son:

texts.en:
The “Nuevo Horizonte” (New Horizon) Committee started more than seven months ago so that its members could access credit and other services offered by the Foundation. The group consists of several neighbors who have known each other for many years and conducts its meetings every Sunday evening. They help each other out and are learning together how to build their committee.

This loan will be used to purchase items based on their respective business activities. Sra. Rosana sells clothing as a traveling merchant who visits her customers to offer the products she has available to sell. The business activities carried out by each member are as follows:

1. Mirna G. – clothing sales 2. Leila B. – shoe sales 3. Isabel B. – food sales 4. Zulma A. – sales of cakes /sweets 5. Ramona O. – sewing 6. Paulina C. – clothing sales 7. Jazmin G. – food and beverage sales 8. Luz G. – clothing sales 9. Reinera D. – vending kiosk 10. Zunilda G. – costume jewelry sales 11. Cresencia R. – grocery store 12. Dora P. – food sales 13. Laura I. – cosmetic sales 14. Romina A. – fruit sales 15. Ever A. – clothing sales 16. Liz A. – clothing sales 17. Petrona P. – costume jewelry sales 18. Lilia T. – charcoal sales 19. Claudelina C. – clothing sales

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Operating capital for their respective businesses

loans.name: Buenas Amigas Group

texts.es:
El centro focal de "Cascada" acoge entre sus asociaciones, a la asociación comunal "Buenas Amigas", como asociación ya han renovado credito mas de 10 veces.  13 socias alegres y trabajadoras y 1 varon que ha sabido adaptarse al trato de las socias, siendo que es el único varón.
La señora Litce C. V., socia jóven de 20 años de edad, indica que ya cuenta con 5 ciclos en Pro Mujer y que en este tiempo ha podido mejorar su negocio de venta de comida, el ciclo anterior a puesto un teléfono para uso público en su puesto y que ahora quiere darle màs impulso al negocio de la comida.  Ella trabaja los dìas martes, sábado y domingo de 8 de la mañana hasta el medio día.
Lo que más le gusta es conversar, reir con las compañeras de la asociación.
texts.en:
Among the groups that meet at the Cascada Community Center, the “Buenas Amigas” (Good Friends) Communal Association has renewed their loan cycles more than ten times. The only male in the group has successfully adapted to being with 13 cheerful and hardworking women.

Sra. Litce C. V. is one of the youngest members at 20 years of age. She has already participated in five loan cycles with Pro Mujer and has been able to improve her business of selling food. In the previous loan cycle, she invested the money in a public phone booth in her shop but now wants to focus more on her food business. She works Tuesdays, Saturdays, and Sundays from 8am until noon. What she enjoys most is talking and laughing with the other members of her group.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a stove, dishes, cookware, and a refrigerator

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Dios es Amor” desde hace 2 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 25 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió secundaria completa, se dedica a la compra - venta de lavadores y cocinas.

Juliana nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella requiere un crédito  de S/. 1,800.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar  lavadores, baldes, cocinas, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es aumentar su negocio y sus ganancias. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal es como esta organizado y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Juliana has been a part of the “Dios es Amor” (God is Love) communal bank for past two years. She lives in the Juliaca district of San Román, in the Puno department. She is 25 years old, is married and has one son. She completed junior high school and buys and sells washboards and kitchen supplies. Juliana tells us that she used her first loan of 300 PEN, through Movimiento Manuela Ramos, to increase her working capital. She needs this loan of 1,800 PEN ($650) so that she can buy more washboards, buckets, kitchen supplies, etc. Her dream is to grow her business and income. What she likes about her communal bank is its organization and opportunities.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in washboards, buckets, kitchen supplies

loans.name: Adrian Jhonny

texts.es: Adrian cuenta con 50 años de edad, está casado pero actualmente su esposa no se encuentra con él porque ella trabaja en el sector de salud fuera de la ciudad. Ambos tienen dos hijos de los cuales uno está trabajando en España y el otro aun vive con ellos. La familia cuenta con casa propia. Adrian tiene su propio taxi y trabaja de lunes a sábado en el mismo, ocasionalmente también trabaja en el sector de la construcción. Según lo que indica Adrian la competencia en su rubro es fuerte pero él tiene experiencia y no tiene problemas con la oferta de sus servicios. El destino del crédito es para la compra de llantas y para pagar el saldo que tiene en Agrocapital. Se considera a Adrian como un cliente con un comportamiento normal, tuvo algunos retrasos debido a que se arruino su automóvil, en las demás cuotas demostró ser responsable en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Adrian is 50 years old, he is married but his wife does not currently live with him because she works in the health sector outside the city. They have two children, one who lives in Spain and the other who still lives with them. The family has its own house. Adrian has his own taxi and works Monday to Saturday doing this and occasionally he also works in the construction sector. According to Adrian the competition in his industry is fierce but he has experience and does not have any problems offering his services. The loan is to be used for the purchase of tires and to pay the balance that he has with Agrocapital. Adrian is considered to be a customer with normal payment patterns, he had some delays due to his car being damaged, in his other instalments he proved to be responsible in his payments.

Translated from Spanish by Catherine Dent, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: PURCHASE OF TIRES AND PAYMENT OF AGROCAPITAL BALANCE

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
El Señor Miguel tiene 28 años, esta casado con la Sra. Eva Jara y  tienen dos hijos menores de edad. 
Miguel se dedica a la venta de artículos varios, como prendas deportivas, accesorios y aparatos celulares, electrodomésticos pequeños y todo tipo de mercaderías de acuerdo a los pedidos que recibe, sus ventas las realiza en ciudades del interior del país como Concepción y San Pedro.  Se inició en esta actividad en el año 2008.
Ellos viven en la ciudad de San Lorenzo.
Este crédito será de mucha utilidad para la compra de mercaderías que respondan a los pedidos de temporada escolar que ya se está iniciando, pues están realizan mas viajes de lo previsto gracias a que están aumentando los pedidos y la clientela.
El anhelo de este matrimonio es poder ampliar la casa que con mucho sacrificio están logrando construir, ademas de poder adquirir un vehículo propio que les permita realizar sus viajes de una forma mas segura .
texts.en:
Miguel is 28 years old. He is married to Eva Jara and they have 2 young children. Miguel sells various goods, such as athletic clothing, cellular parts and accessories, small household appliances, and all kinds of requested merchandise. He works in the interior regions of the country, such as in Concepción and San Pedro. He has been doing this work since 2008. Miguel and his wife live in the city of San Lorenzo. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise being requested for the upcoming school year. He is making more sales trips than he expected, thanks to more orders from his customers. The goal of this couple is to be able to expand their home, which they are currently doing with a lot of sacrifice. They would also like to be able to buy their own vehicle, which would provide them a safer means of travel.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cellular phone accessories, sandwich grills, lunch boxes, insulated thermoses, cotton t-shirts, etc.

loans.name: Diana Luz

texts.es: Diana, es una mujer muy emprendedora, vive en el distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 29 años, es madre de dos hijos, ambos menores de edad, ella se dedica a la administración de su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien es taxista. Diana forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Triunfadoras”, desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la compra de productos para su bodega, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en la compra de gaseosas y productos de primera necesidad. La meta de Diana es ampliar su negocio y vender otros productos.
texts.en:
Diana is a very entrepreneurial woman. She lives in the Calleria District of the Ucayali region. She is 29 years old, and is the mother of two children, both minors. She runs a grocery store out of her home with the help of her husband who is a taxi driver. Diana has been a member of the “Las Triunfadoras” Community Bank for two years. The first loan that she received was for 300 soles, which was used to buy products for her store. Now she needs a loan of 1000 soles which will be invested in soft drinks and other necessary products. Diana's goal is to expand her business and to sell other products.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Scinta, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and other necessary products for her store.

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
El señor Rafael Riquelme  tiene 63 años , es casado tienen tres hijos adultos, con quines trabajan en el Taller confeccionando Escobas de Pajas este trabajo los viene realizando desde hace mas de 30 años con su familias pero ya desde joven trabajaba con su Padre de quien Heredo este oficio .
Aporte de sus hijos estan trabajando 2 personas  mas con ellos    o sea  da mano de obra a dos familias mas..La idea de el es ir creciendo el Taller ya que su producto tiene mucha salida y pesar  de la competencia con la esobas de plasticos.
texts.en:
Rafael is 63 years old. He is married and has three adult children who work with him in his shop making straw brooms. He has been doing this with his family for more than 30 years and, as a child, he used to work with his father, from who he inherited this business. Besides his children, two other persons work in his shop, so it provides work for two families. His goal is to continue to grow the shop, now that his brooms are selling well, despite the competition from plastic brooms.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for manufacture of brooms

loans.name: Gregoria De

texts.es: Gregoria es una señora de 47 años de edad, ella está casada y tienen tres hijos, toda la familia vive en una casa que es propia. Gregoria se dedica a la comercialización de frutas, ella trabaja en este rubro desde hace con 16 años atrás, se puede ver que tiene mucha experiencia en el rubro. A pesar de la competencia ella cuenta con clientela propia por ser antigua en el rubro. Con este crédito Gregoria comprará frutas desde una ciudad, la persona que le enviará la fruta es su esposo. Esta es su tercera operación en la institución, cuenta con buen historial crediticio.
texts.en:
Gregoria is 47 years old, married, and has 3 children. Her family lives in a house they own. Gregoria has sold fruit for a living for the last 16 years, it is clear she has a lot of experience in this type of work. Despite competition, she has many loyal customers because she has been in the trade for so long. With this loan Gregoria will buy fruits from a different city, sent to her by her husband. This is her third loan transaction with the institution, and Gregoria has good credit history.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchaes of fruit.

loans.name: Diolizana

texts.es: Diolizana, es una mujer muy responsable, vive en Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 39 años, es madre de tres menores de edad, ella se dedica a la repostería, esta actividad la realiza en su domicilio, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien es Ingeniero Agrónomo. Diolizana forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Golondrinas 2”, desde hace 2 años, el primer préstamo que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en su negocio de repostería, ahora ella necesita un crédito de  1,000 soles, para invertir en la compra de materiales e insumos para repostería. La meta de Diolizana es crecer en su negocio y como empresaria.
texts.en:
Diolizana is a very responsible woman. She lives in the Calleria district of the Ucayali region. She is 39 years old and the mother of 3 young children. Diolizana makes baked goods from her home, where she is assisted by her husband, an agronomist. Diolizana has been part of "Las Golondrinas 2" (The Swallows 2) community bank for 2 years. The first loan she received was for 300 PEN, which she invested in her bakery business. She now needs a loan of 1,000 PEN to invest in the purchase of materials and supplies for baking. Her goal is to develop her business and her entrepreneurial skills.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of materials and supplies for baking.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es: Julia tiene 55 años de edad, tiene 3 hijos, ella actualmente es soltera y tiene vivienda propia. Julia se dedica a la venta de comidas, recibe renta de una moto y un auto que presta servicio de transporte local. La competencia  es bastante pero hay bastante demanda sobre todo en el transporte de auto y moto. El destino del crédito es para compra de moto, para ponerla a trabajar al igual que la que tiene. Julia tiene dos créditos ambos en nuestra institución uno como crédito individual y el otro en un grupo, ya que este crédito es un paralelo.
texts.en:
Julia is 55 and has three children. She is currently single, and she has her own home. Julia sells food, and she gets rent from a motorcycle and a car that are used for local transportation services. There is plenty of competition, but there is plenty of demand, especially in car and motorcycle transportation. The loan is to buy a motorcycle to put to work like the one she has. Julia has two loans, both with our institution. One is an individual loan, and the other is a group loan. This loan is simultaneous.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Idalia Francisca

texts.es: Idalia Francisca tiene 56 años, su actividad económica es la venta de comida por lo que tiene más de 31 años de realizar este pequeño negocio. Ella es una persona muy generosa y trabajadora, por lo que siempre le ha gustado mejorar la vida de su familia. A pesar de los problemas que enfrenta como es problemas de salud, ya que ella elabora las comidas y al mismo tiempo  las vende, pero con la poca  ayuda de sus hijos ha logrado mejorar en el servicio de sus clientes. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para la compra de arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, queso, verduras y además frutas para la elaboración de refrescos naturales. Ella sueña con mejorar sus ingresos y las condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Idalia Francisca is 56 years old. Her economic activity is selling food. She has been doing this small business for more than 31 years. She is a very generous and hard working person. This is why she has always liked to improve her family's life. Despite the problems she faces, such as health problems, she makes the food and also sells it, and with a lttle help from her children she has been able to improve the service for her clients. The financing she is asking for is for working capital which will be used for the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, oil, cheese, vegetables and fruit as well to make natural drinks. She dreams of improving her income and her living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: France

texts.es:
La señora Fance es socia del Banco Comunal “Cristo Blanco” desde hace 3 años, vive en el distrito de Juliaca, provincia de San Román y departamento de Puno, tiene 33 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 01 hijo. Ella estudió superior completo, se dedica a la compra y venta de cosméticos. Paralelamente se dedica a la venta de golosinas.

France nos cuenta que el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, le sirvió para aumentar su capital.

Ella solicitará un crédito  de S/. 700.00 nuevos soles, con el cual podrá comprar labiales, cremas, perfumes, etc.

Su sueño para el futuro es dar una buena calidad de servicio a sus clientes. 

Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son los temas educativos y la unión entre compañeras
texts.en:
Señora Fance has been a member of the Communal Bank "Cristo Blanco" for three years. She lives in the district of Juliaca, province of San Román, and the department of Puno. She is 33 years old, a single mother of one child. She is studying, and she works buying and selling cosmetics. She also works selling sweets. Fance tells us that the first loan she asked for from the Movimiento Manuela Ramos was for 300 Soles, which helped her augment her capital. She is going to ask for a loan for 700 soles, with which she will be able to buy lipsticks, creams, perfume, etc. Her dream for the future is to be able to give good quality of service to her clients. What she likes best about her communal bank is its education themes and the union between its partners.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lipstick, cream, perfume, etc

loans.name: Florinda

texts.es:
Florinda A. B. tiene 55 años vive en el barrio Porvenir del municipio de Soledad-Atlántico,  ella vende cosméticos celulares y ropa, está casada  y tiene 3 hijos entre los 28 y 35 años de edad.
Se vinculó a los programas de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo hace 14 años en los cuales ha recibido 5 créditos que  le han servido para apoyar el estudio y la educación de sus hijos y para sus gastos personales, ella inicialmente se inició en el programa de grupos solidarios, pero ahora tiene un crédito individual.   Comenzó su negocio con el apoyo de su esposo, que empleado en una empresa de refrescos en el año 1989,  le  dio su primer capital para invertirlo en ropa y calzado. En ese entonces vendía esta mercancía a clientes de varias empresas y entre los compañeros de trabajo de su cónyuge, pues siempre ha preferido incursionar en el mercado de personas que están empleadas, protegiendo así su capital de trabajo; Su negocio fue progresando hasta llegar a que  en el año 2007,  compraba mercancía en Venezuela y la vendía en Soledad y Barranquilla por encargo, así trajo los primeros celulares, cámaras y encargos electrónicos a sus clientes.
 En la actualidad aplica a un crédito por valor de $1.500.000 que lo invertirá en materiales e insumos  y camisetas para decorarlas y para comprar cosméticos encargados. Como meta se propone   remodelar su casa, adecuarla con un apartamento y local para su negocio al mismo tiempo. Ella sabe que si se propone lo puede cumplir así como pudo apoyar a sus hijos en la educación y por eso tiene uno que es administrador de empresas. Su desafió mas grande fue la enfermedad y muerte de su hijo que   hace mucho tiempo la dejó iliquida y le tocó después de este dolor empezar nuevamente.
texts.en:
Florinda A. B., age 55, lives in the Porvenir neighborhood in the Soledad-Atlántico municipality. She sells cosmetics, cell phones, and clothes. She is married and has three children between 28 and 35 years old. She has been involved in the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation’s programs for 14 years. In that time she has had five loans, which have been used to help educate her children and for their personal expenses. She started in communal banks, but now she has an individual loan. She started her business with help from her husband. He worked for a soft drink company in 1989, and he gave her money to invest in clothing and footwear. At that time she sold her merchandise to customers in various businesses and to her husband’s co-workers. She has always preferred to venture into the market of people who are employed. That way she protects her work capital. Her business was progressing, and in 2007 she bought merchandise in Venezuela and sold it by order in Soledad and Barranquilla. That is how she brought the first cell phones, cameras, and electronics orders for her customers. She is currently applying for a loan for 1,500,000 COP to buy materials and supplies like t-shirts to decorate. She will also buy cosmetics that have been ordered in advance. Her goal is to remodel her house and to equip it with an apartment and a place for her business at the same time. She knows that if she makes up her mind, she can do it. That is how she helped her children with their education, and now one of them is a business administrator. Her biggest challenge was the illness and death of her son. For a long time she was left with nothing, and after this agony she needed to start over again.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials, supplies, t-shirts to decorate, and ordered cosmetics

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, es una mujer muy atenta, vive en Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 51 años, es es madre de tres hijos independientes, ella se dedica a administrar su bodega, esta actividad la realiza en su casa, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja en Essalud (Entidad del estado). Rosa forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desde hace 10 años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de comida, ahora ella necesita un crédito de 600 soles, que será invertido en la compra de productos de ferretería para venderlos en su bodega. La meta de Rosa es poner una ferretería y mantener su bodega bien implementada con todos los productos que exigen sus cleintes.
texts.en:
Rosa is a very considerate woman. She lives in the Yarina Cocha district in the Ucalayi region. She is 51 and has three independent children. She runs a convenience store in her house. She has her husband’s support; he works for Essalud (a state entity). Rosa has been part of the Las Dinámicas Communal Bank for ten years. The first loan that she received was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy food. She now needs a loan for 600 PEN, which she will used to buy hardware products to sell in her store. Rosa’s goal is to set up a hardware store and keep her convenience store well stocked with all of the products her customers require.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy hardware products to sell in her convenience store

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
María Lourdes,  es una mujer muy amable, vive en el Distrito de Calleria, región Ucayali, tiene 55 años, es viuda.  Tiene cuatro hijos que son todavía dependientes, ella se dedica a la costura. María Lourdes forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las activas”, desde hace cuatro años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que fue invertido en la compra de telas.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en la adquisición de listones, telas y accesorios para mejorar su negocio. La meta de María Lourdes es tener un taller más grande donde pueda producir más.
texts.en:
María Lourdes is a very considerate woman. She lives in the Calleria district in the Ucayali region. She is a 55 year old widow. She has four children who are still dependent upon her. She is a seamstress. María Lourdes has been a part of the Las Activas Communal Bank for four years. Her first loan was for 300 PEN, which she used to buy fabric. She now needs a loan for 1,000 PEN to buy ribbons, fabric, and accessories to improve her business. María Lourdes’s goal is to have a bigger shop where she could produce more.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy ribbons, fabric, and accessories to improve her business

loans.name: Benigna

texts.en:
Benigna C. is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Doldol, Valladolid, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by running a general store.

Benigna’s husband Sebas, 55 years old, is a farmer and they have four children who are between 22 and 31 years old. All of her children have their own work and contribute to uplifting the living conditions of the family.

Benigna joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life of their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family income by running a general store. Now she earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,400 from her business activities.

Benigna is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 was used to fund operations of her general store, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is borrowing her 13th loan, in the amount of PHP 19,500, which she intends to use on her general store. Benigna is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family, which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life.

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Ana Cesilia

texts.es: Ana Cesilia tiene 52 años, su actividad económica es la vetan de ropa, hace mas de 10 años que se dedica a este humilde negocio. Ella es una mujer que le gusta trabajar y siempre le ha gustado sacar adelante a sus 3 hijos que son la parte más importantes en su vida. El negocio inicio hace aproximadamente 10 años, cuando decidió viajar a Managua a comprar mercadería y le dio muy buenos resultados pues le proporciono el alimento diario, es por eso que se ha interesado a mejorar sus ingresos con este negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas, vestidos y cosméticos. Su deseo es incrementar su negocio para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Ana Cesilia is 52 years old; she sells clothing. For more than 10 years, she has dedicated herself to this humble business. She is a woman who likes to work, and she has always liked to help her 3 children get ahead, since they are the most important part of her life. She started this business about 10 years ago when she decided to travel to Managua to buy merchandise, and she had such good results that she was able to provide her family's daily bread. That's why she is interested in increasing her income from this business. The loan she is requesting is to buy pants, shirts, skirts, dresses, and cosmetics. Her wish is to increase her business to improve their living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Maria Theresa

texts.en:
Maria Theresa V. is a single parent who supports her family by operating a general store and a piggery. She lives in Brgy Guimbala-on, Silay City, Negros Occidental with her three children who are between 2 to 12 years old. 

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since May of 2007 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and piggery business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 9,000.

Maria Theresa is now borrowing PHP 15,000 so that she can maintain her general store and piggery. This will be her eighth loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 13,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Maria Theresa aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Charlita

texts.es:
Charlita, es una mujer muy jovial, vive en el Distrito de Yarina cocha, región Ucayali, tiene 27 años, es madre de un menor de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa usadas, esta actividad la realiza de manera ambulante, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que trabaja como obrero en una triplayera (venta de madera). Charlita forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Dinámicas”, desde hace un año y medio, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, que fue invertido en la venta de cerveza.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 1000 soles, que será invertido en la compra de ropa usadas para su posterior venta. La meta de Charlita es poner un negocio de venta de cerveza y una tienda de piñaterías y decoraciones.
texts.en:
Charlita, a very cheerful woman, lives in the Yarina Cocha district, in the Ucayali region. She is 27 years old and the mother of a small child. She sells used clothing, which she does as a traveling salesperson. She has the support of her husband who works in a plywood factory. Charlita has been part of the community bank "Las Dinámicas" for a year and a half. The first loan she received was for 300 soles, which she invested in beer to sell.

Now she needs a loan of 1000 soles, which will be invested in buying used clothing to sell. Charlita's goal is to start a business selling beer and a store with piñatas and decorations.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Second-hand clothing

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina L. is a widow who supports her family through her general store. She lives in Pescadora St., San Enrique, Negros Occidental with her three children ages from 33 to 39 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1999 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 7,000.

Josefina is now borrowing PHP 10,000 so that she can maintain operations of her general store. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 10,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Josefina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams.
