They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Sindy

texts.es:
Sindy, es una mujer muy honrada, vive en el distrito de Callería, región Ucayali, tiene 20 años, es soltera.  Se dedica a la venta productos de belleza Avon, paralelamente se dedica a la venta de comida al paso, ambas actividades las realiza en su casa. Sindy forma parte del Banco Comunal “Las Américas”, desde hace dos años, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles que fue invertido en la compra de productos Avon.
Este crédito de 300 soles, también lo piensa invertir en la compra de productos Avon para su posterior venta. La meta de Sindy es llegar a tener un restaurante.
texts.en:
Sindy is a very honorable woman who lives in the district of Callería, in the Ucayali region. She is 20 years old and single. She works selling Avon beauty products, and she also sells fast food. She carries out both activities in her home. Sindy has been a member of the “Las Américas” communal bank for the past two years. The first loan she received was for 300 Peruvian soles, and she invested it in purchasing Avon products. She also plans to invest the current loan for 300 soles in purchasing Avon products to sell. Sindy's goal is to eventually open a restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing Avon products to sell

loans.name: Camila

texts.es:
Camila, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive en el Distrito de Manantay, región Ucayali, tiene 41 años, es madre de cinco hijos dependientes, ella se dedica a la venta de jugos, esta actividad la realiza en el mercado Bellavista, cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo quien trabaja en un amepresa de la zona. Camila forma parte del  Banco Comunal “Fruto Bendito”, desde hace 4 meses, el primer crédito que recibió fue de 300 soles, éste dinero fue invertido en la compra de insumos.
Ahora ella necesita un crédito de 500 soles, que será invertido en la compra de azúcar, huevos,2 cuchillos de licuadoras, veterragas, insumos y vasos. La meta de Camila es tener una fuente de soda en su casa.
texts.en:
Camila, a very hard-working woman, lives in the Manantay district, Ucayali region. She is 41 years old, and the mother of 5 dependent children. She sells juice in the Bellavista market, and has the support of her husband who works in a business in the area. Camila has been part of the community bank ¨Fruto Bendito¨ for 4 months; the first loan she received was 300 soles, which she used to buy ingredients.

Now she needs a loan of 500 soles, which will be invested in buying sugar, eggs, blenders, beets, ingredients, and glasses. Camila's goal is to have a soda fountain in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Iverson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Sugar, eggs, blenders, beets, ingredients, and glasses

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva A. is a married woman who supports her family by selling Ready to Wear clothes and running a general store. She lives in Brgy Basak, Cuayan, Negros Occidental with her husband and their three children who are between 20 and 27 years old. One of their children already has a family and the other two children work and help the family.

Eva has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her ready to wear and general store business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 8,000.

Eva is now borrowing PHP 19,500 so that she can sustain her ready to wear business and her general store. This will be her 12th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 21,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Eva aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Claudia Cordelia

texts.es: Claudia Cordelia tiene 55 años de edad, su actividad económica que es una pulpería. Es una mujer muy luchadora y además es su fuente de ingreso necesario en su familia. Ella inicio este negocio como un medio de vida para ella, por lo que anteriormente solo vendía refrescos naturales al no tener el capital suficiente, para seguir decide realizar un financiamiento para comprar más productos esto no  la detiene a seguir con este negocio y que le fue de mucha ayuda para mantener a sus 2 hijos es una mujer muy inteligente y ha logrado administrar muy bien su actividad. El sueño Claudia es seguir adelante y mejorar su vivienda. Es por eso que realiza este financiamiento para la compra de jabón, detergentes, granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas y café.
texts.en:
Claudia Cordelia is 55 years old. Her business is a general store. She is a very determined woman, and her business is a necessary source of income for her family. She began the business in order to support herself, at first only selling natural beverages because she did not have sufficient capital. To continue her business, she decided to take out a loan to buy more products. All of this has not deterred her from continuing with her business, which has been a great help in supporting her 2 children. She is a very intelligent woman and has been able to manage her enterprise very effectively. Claudia's dreams are to keep making progress and to renovate her home. For this reason, she is now taking out a loan to buy soap, detergents, bulk grains, juices, soft drinks and coffee.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en: Marilyn N. is a 56-year-old married woman who supports her family by running a general store, providing electronic reloading services, and retailing gasoline. She lives in Brgy Camingawan, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental, with her husband, Romeo, who is now retired and their five children who are 24 to 33 years old. Three of her children are already married and two are working. Marilyn has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of 12,000 Philippine pesos (PHP). Marilyn is now borrowing 18,000 PHP so that she can sustain her general store, electronic reloading and gasoline retailing business. This will be her 13th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP (which she paid off well within its term) was just another step on her journey toward economic freedom. Marilyn aspires to improve her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the “Dungganon” way. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en: Carmelita P. earns her living by candy making. She is a 53-year-old married woman who lives in Brgy Talubangi, Kabankalan City, Negros Occidental. Carmelita’s husband, Armando, 55 years old, helps run the business by delivering the finished product to a local market and other general stores. They have three children who are between 23 and 27 years old: two of them work and one already has a family. Carmelita joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2003 in the hope that she would be able to help her husband improve the quality of life for their family. With the help of her loans from NWTF-PD, she has been able to increase their family's income by making candy. Now she earns an average monthly income of 54,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) from her business activities. Carmelita is a member in good standing. Her previous loan of 19,000 PHP was used to fund the operations of her candy business, and it had a positive impact on both the business and the family’s living conditions. Now she is requesting her 17th loan, in the amount of 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use making candy. Carmelita is working hard to achieve her dreams and aspirations for her family which are to provide them with a brighter future and a more comfortable life. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital for a candy business

loans.name: Edilberto Jorge

texts.es: El Sr. Edilberto R. M. tiene 36 años de edad, es conviviente, vive en casa propia en el disrtrito de Ocucaje junto a su esposa y un hijo de dos años y una hija en edad escolar. Cliente realiza la actividad de taxista en la ruta Ica - La Venta u Ocucaje desde hace 08 años apróximadamente para la empresa de transportes Virgen del Carmen en la ciudad de Ica, el vehículo que posee es propiedad de su hermano el cual es policía y vive en el centro de la ciudad, su esposa realiza labores de campo por temporadas actualmente no está laborando ya que está al cuidado de su pequeño hijo. No cuenta con endeudamiento en ninguna institución financiera. Actualmente está construyendo un módulo de vivienda para damnificados del terremoto por lo cual requiere de préstamo para solventar gastos de mano de obra y concluir con dicha construcción. Son personas muy trabajadoras las cuales brindan educación a sus hijos con mucho esfuerzo y pretenden tener una mejor calidad de vida. Su sueño es poder concluir con construcción de su casa. Ambos agradecen la ayuda que le brindemos para lograr hacer realidad sus sueños.
texts.en:
Edilberto R. M. is 36 years old and lives with his common-law wife in his home in the Ocucaje district, along with a son who is 2 years old and a daughter who is school-aged. He has worked as a taxi driver on routes from Ica to La Venta or Ocucaje for about 8 years for the transport company Virgen del Carmen in the city of Ica. The vehicle he has belongs to his brother, who is a policeman and lives in the center of the city. His wife does seasonal work in agriculture; she is currently not working since she must care for her small son. Edilberto is not indebted to any financial institution. Currently they are building a room on their house for people displaced by the earthquake. For this they need a loan to take care of the expenses for labor and to finish the construction of the room. They are hard-working people who provide for the education of their children with great effort, and aim to have a better quality of life. Their dream is to finish the construction on their home. They both are grateful for the assistance offered to help them fulfill their dreams.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to pay for construction expenses

loans.name: Mujeres Rumbo Al Progreso Group

texts.es:
El Señor Nolasco siempre trabajo como personal D. limpieza en diferentes empresas lamentablemente el sueldo que percibía era mínimo y no le alcanzaba para el sustento D. su familia es por  ello que deciD. invertir sus ahorros implementando una bodega  en su propia casa empezó vendiendo golosinas y algunas pocas cosas, a pesar D. la competencia  le va bien en su negocio, trata D.  mantenerlo surtido para que sus clientes siempre encuentren lo necesario, en la bodega trabaja el y su esposa ella lo ayuda las veces que el se ausenta ya que sigue dedicándose al servicio D. limpieza 3 veces por semana en forma independiente. Con sus  ingresos  ha podido comprar una exhibidora y una congeladora que es indispensable para mejorar su negocio,  también pueD. ayudar a su hijo en sus estudios.
Para  el futuro el Señor Nolasco quiere buscar un local adecuado para poner una bodega más granD. en un lugar estratégico,por otro lado pertenecer al grupo" MUJERES RUMBO AL PROGRESO" le ha servido D. mucho en sus proyectos es el unico hombre y se siente feliz dentro del grupo, en esta ocasión su préstamo lo usara para comprar alimentos para aves D. corral, incursionara en esto por que la mayoría D. sus vecinos se dedican a la crianza  D. aves  y le piden mucho este producto. El esta feliz por que en EDAPROSPO ha encontrado apoyo para lograr sus objetivos.
texts.en:
Señor Nolasco always worked providing cleaning services for various companies. Unfortunately the salary that he was earning was minimal, and was not sufficient to support his family. For this reason he decided to invest his savings to start up a store in his home where he started selling sweets and other small items. In spite of the competition, his business is doing well. He tries to keep it well-stocked so that his customers can always find what they need. He works in the store and his wife helps him at times when he is absent, because he is also continuing to work independently as a cleaner 3 times a week. With his income he has been able to buy a display case and a freezer which he needed to improve his business, and he also helps his son pay for his studies. For the future, Señor Nolasco wants to look for an appropriate site where he could have a bigger store in a strategic location. He belongs to the communal bank "Mujeres Rumo al Progreso," and it has helped him a lot with his projects. He is the only man, and he is happy to be a part of the group. On this occasion he will use his loan to buy food for poultry, venturing into this area because the majority of his neighbors raise poultry, and they get a good price for this product. He is pleased that EDAPROSPO has supported him in achieving his goals.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy poultry feed

loans.name: Basilia

texts.es:
Basilia es una mujer de 45 años, está casada con Juan de 43 años y tiene 7 hijos, pero sólo vive con 5 de ellos. Su casa es modesta, pero cálida y lo más importante, es propia.
Durante esta época de invierno en su zona, viene luchando a diario con las lluvias y los fuertes vientos que retrasan los trabajos agrícolas, pero eso no la intimida pues está logrando proteger poco a poco sus cultivos de papa, arveja y flores (gladiolos). De esa manera que lo viene haciendo desde hace 20 años con la ayuda de su esposo y de sus hijos mayores.
De su labor lo que más le gusta es cosechar, porque según refiere: mientras llena los costales agradece a Dios por la productividad que le da, ya que por la venta de los productos obtiene buenas ganancias económicas que le permiten pagar la educación de sus menores hijos y vivir cómodamente. 
Para el futuro, desea comprar una casa en la ciudad donde instalará un negocio de venta de comestibles, por lo que de todos sus ingresos una parte ahorra y otra invierte en sus sembríos.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y como siempre asegura que pagará puntualmente sus cuotas, porque no quiere hacer quedar mal a la gente de su banco comunal con quienes trabaja años, en busca de progreso. Con el dinero que solicita piensa comprar tres botellas de insecticidas para fumigar sus terrenos donde sembró flores y papa, para evitar que proliferen las plagas.
texts.en:
Basilia is a 45 year old woman. She is married with 43 year old Juan. They have seven children and live in a modest, but warm home. During the winter they have to fight the rains and strong winds that causes them to fall behind on their agricultural work, but this does not intimidate her and she is able to protect her potato, pea, and flower (gladiola) crops little by little. This is how she's been doing it for the past 20 years, with the help of her husband and adult children. The part she likes most about her work is the harvest because, as she says, she is thankful to God for the productivity and for filling her sacs, and the sale of her products allow her to pay for her younger children's education and to live comfortably. In the future she would like to buy a home in the city, where she will start a food sale business. She saves part of her income and invests another part into her business. This will be her sixth loan through MFP and she promises to make her payments on time, as she has always done, because she does not want to make the people in her communal bank look bad. She has been working with them for years while trying to get ahead. She will use the money from this loan to buy three bottles of insecticide in order to fumigate her fields and protect her flower and potato crop from plagues.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy insecticide

loans.name: Celestino

texts.es:
Celestino es un hombre trabajador de 47 años, vive junto a su esposa Dominga, de 38 años, y sus dos hijos: Noemí de 17 y Raquel de 15 años, en su casa propia.
Está muy orgulloso de ser agricultor desde hace 20 años, teniendo el apoyo de su esposa, quien es la que le da ideas para progresar. Con esfuerzo y dedicación en lo que mejor sabe hacer desea brindarles una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia, ya que con las ganancias que obtuvo de la agricultura pudo comprar su casa y amoblarla, también pudo comprar terrenos fértiles donde cosecha gran cantidad de papa, arveja, maíz y flores (gladiolos).
Para más adelante, planea comprar terrenos productivos en una zona cafetalera de la selva central del Perú.

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y como la primera vez, demostrará que es responsable en sus acciones. Asimismo asegura que está contento de pertenecer a un banco comunal muy organizado. Con el monto que ahora solicita comprará tres sacos de fertilizantes y dos botellas de insecticida para proteger sus sembríos, y también pretende cubrir el pago de los operarios que contratará.
texts.en:
Celestino is a hard-working, 47 year old man. He lives with his wife, 38 year old Dominga, and his two children, 17 year old Noemí and 15 year old Raquel. They live in their own house. He is very proud to have been a farmer for 20 years. He has his wife’s support; she gave him the ideas to progress. With effort and dedication in what he knows how to do best, he wants to give his family a good quality of life. With the income from the farming he was able to buy a house and furnish it. He was also able to buy fertile land where he harvests a great quantity of potatoes, peas, corn, and flowers (gladiolas). Later on he plans to buy fertile land in a coffee growing area in the central jungle of Perú. This is the second loan he has had with MFP. Like the first time, he will show that he is responsible in his actions. He affirms that he is happy to belong to such an organized communal bank. With the amount that he is now requesting he will buy three sacks of fertilizer and two bottles of insecticide to protect the plants in his fields. He also intends to pay the workmen he will hire.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Luis Modesto

texts.es: El Sr.T. Morón Luis Modesto natural de ICA , vive con su esposa en su casa propia ubicada en los Grimaldos C-01, se dedica a manejar su mototaxi, la cual adquirió con mucho esfuerzo, el a parte percibe una jubilación ya que tuvo un problema de salud en su pierna derecha la cual, le colocaron  mal una inyección intramuscular, el cual estuvo cerca de 02 años con un largo y costoso tratamiento, ya que con el apoyo de sus hijos pudo salir adelante. Dia busca su superación para el bien de su familia. Solicito el crédito para mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
T. Morón Luis Modesto is from Ica. He lives with his wife in his own house, which is located in the Grimaldos C-01. He drives his “mototaxi” (three wheeled motorized vehicle), which he got through a lot of effort. He receives a pension because he had health problems with his right leg. They placed an intramuscular injection poorly, and he had two years of a long and expensive treatment. With the help of his children he was able to get ahead. He looked to overcome the problem for his family’s well-being. He is asking for a loan to improve his house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es: LUZ TIENE 42 AÑOS D. EDAD VIVE CON SU ESPOSO, LA CASA ES PROPIA. ELLA TIENE UNA AMPLIA EXPERIENCIA EN EL NEGOCIO D. VENTA D. ROPA, VEND. POR LAS MAÑANAS HASTA EL MEDIO DÍA EN EL MERCADO MODELO D. ICA, TODOS LOS DIAS INCLUIDOS LOS FINES D. SEMANA, ELLA REALIZA LA VENTA D. FORMA AMBULATORIA, SU ESPOSO ES JUBILADO PERCIBIENDO UNA PEQUEÑA PENSIÓN, ESTO LES ANIMA A CONTINUAR ADELANTE YA QUE LES PERMITE INDEPENDIZARSE ENCONOMICAMENTE Y SOLVENTAR LOS ESTUDIOS D. SU HIJO, QUIEN ES LA RAZON D. TODO SU ESFUERZO, SU SUEÑO D. LUZ ES TERMINAR D. COSNTRUIR SU CASA PARA PODER ALQUILAR HABITACIONES EN EL SEGUNDO PISO,EL PRESTAMO QUE SOLICITA ES PARA INVERTIR EN LA COMPRA D. MERCADERIA AHORA POR LA CAMPAÑA ESCOLAR, CLIENTE ES BASTANTE RESPONSABLE POR LO QUE SE COMPROMETE A SER PUNTUALES EN SUS PAGOS.
texts.en:
Luz is 42 years old and lives with her husband in their own house. She has a lot of experience in the clothes selling business. She walks around selling in the Ica marketplace every morning until noon, including weekends. Her husband is retired and drawing a small pension. This motivates them to move ahead, now that this allows them to be financially independent and pay for their son's education, who is the reason for all of their effort. Luz's dream is to be able to finish building their home in order to be able to rent out rooms on the second floor. She is asking for this loan in order to invest in more merchandise, now that the school year has begun. She is very responsible and promises to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest it merchadise for resale

loans.name: Hartur Socrates

texts.es:
La Sr. A. R. HARTUR SOCRATES tiene 28 años de edad vive en casa de su padre juntamente con su cónyuge tiene un hijo de  dos años de edad se dedica al servicio de taxi en la ciudad de Ica
El cuenta con un carro propio el cual lo trabaja diariamente activo que lo adquirió producto de su trabajo y   con los ahorros que pudo juntar ya que anteriormente tenia una mototaxi y lo vendió para la compra del carro.  
El joven tiene buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos y amigos  donde  manifiestan que es  trabajador responsable y sobretodo puntual en sus labores.
texts.en:
A. is 28 years old and he and his wife live in his father's house. They have a two year-old son. A. drives a taxi in the city of Ica. He has his own cab, which he runs daily, that he bought with the savings from his work driving a "moto-taxi" (a kind of 3-wheeled taxi), which he sold to buy his cab. He has good references from his friends and neighbors, who say he is responsible, hard working, and above all on time with his obligations.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in his taxi business

loans.name: Milagros Fiorella

texts.es: La Sra. H. C. Milagros Fiorella tiene 24 años de edad, es conviviente, tiene un hijo menor, se encuentra domiciliada en casa propia ubicada en el Caserío de Santa Dominguita. Trabaja como docente desde hace 2 años y su cónyuge labora como obrero de campo en una empresa agroindustrial. Gracias a su empeño y esfuerzo ha logrado adquirir sus bienes, brindar mejor calidad de vida a su hijo y reconstruir su vivienda. Requiere el crédito para mejoramiento de su vivienda ya que en el terremoto del año 2007  se vió afectada. Su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para lograr una mejor calidad de vida para su familia. Esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que le podamos brindar a través de este financiamiento.
texts.en:
H. C. Milagros Fiorella is 24, in a common law marriage, and has a young child. She lives in her own house, which is located in the Santa Dominguita neighborhood. She has worked as a teacher for two years. Her life partner is a field worker for an agricultural business. Thanks to her hard work and effort she has been able to get their possessions, give her child a better quality of life, and rebuild her house. She needs the loan to improve her house because it was affected by the earthquake in 2007. Her dream is to finish building her house in order to obtain a better quality of life for her family. She is very grateful for the support we can offer through this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement

loans.name: Carlos Javier

texts.es:
Carlos G. V. de 22 años de edad vive en casa de su padre junto con un hermano el cual tambien trabaja y aporta en los gastos de la casa ellos viven en Caserio Barrio Nuevo – Ocucaje.
El sr. Es soltero desde pequeño a trabajado como ayudante de panadería ya que su meta es surgir y ser mejor cada día èl es un joven con buenas rferencias de responsabilidad.
El sr. se dedica al transporte diario de 7.00am hasta las 9.00 pm realizando colectivo de Ica – Ocucaje ida y vuelta este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 3 años actualmente el carro donde trabaja es alquiler venta por eso que solicita le financiemos para poder terminar de cancelarlo y de esa manera tener algo propio.
Es una persona con bastante ganas de salir adelante es bien luchador y es considerado un buen hijo ya que apoya a su padre a pesar de que el sr tambien trabaja como abrero de campo.
texts.en:
Carlos G. V. is 22 years old and lives in his father’s house with his brother, who also works and contributes to the household expenses. They live in the village of Barrio Nuevo in Ocucaje. Carlos is single and worked as an assistant at a bakery when he was much younger. His goal at the time was to emerge as a better person each day. For a young man, he has good references and has demonstrated responsibility.

Every day, Carlos provides transportation services from 7am until 9pm for the local cooperative. He has been working the route between Ica and Ocucaje for the past three years. Carlos currently leases a car, so he is requesting a loan so that he can terminate his lease and acquire a vehicle of his own.

Carlos is a person who desires to get ahead. He is known for his fighting spirit and considered to be a dutiful son for supporting his father even though they both work in the same occupation.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Terminate the rental agreement of the car he is using so that he can purchase his own vehicle

loans.name: Felomina

texts.en:
Felomina R. is a married woman who supports her family by selling fish. She lives in Brgy 1 Siaton, Negros Oriental, with her husband and their seven children, who are 5 to 33 years old.  Three of their children are currently studying and four are working to help their parents.

Felomina has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since May of 2002 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her fish vending business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of Php 15,000.00.

Felomina is now borrowing Php 19,500 so that she can have revolving capital for her fish vending business. This will be her 10th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 19,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Felomina aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future wellbeing by following the “Dungganon” way.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them "Dungganon" - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Invest in his vehicle

loans.name: Angelica Agustina

texts.es:
Angélica tiene 49 años D. edad, es casada vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus hijos. 
Ella es propietaria D. una bodega ubicada en la ciudad, ella inicio el negocio 
aproximadamente hace 4 años, primero con un capital pequeño producto D. ahorros obtenidos D. sus trabajos anteriores, en la actualidad a incrementado su  negocio con mucho esfuerzo. Ella 
atienD. el negocio D. manera amable ya que la gran mayoría D. sus 
clientes son sus vecinos. Angélica sueña con poder refaccionar su vivienda, pero por el 
momento con los gastos D. los estudios D. sus hijos  le es dificil.  Angélica requiere 
el crédito para la compra D. mercadería por lo que ya se aproxima la campaña escolar.
texts.en:
Angélica is 49 years old, married, and lives in her own home with her husband and children. She is the owner of a store located within the city. Angelica started this business four years ago using a small amount of savings she accumulated from her previous jobs. She attends to her business in an easygoing manner and the majority of her customers are her neighbors.

Angélica dreams of renovating her house, but at the moment covering her children’s educational expenses is difficult enough. She is requesting a loan to purchase merchandise so that will be stocked for the upcoming school year.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchadise for her store

loans.name: Natividad's Group

texts.en:
Natividad B. is a widowed woman who supports her family by operating a general store and retailing gasoline in her community. She lives in Sitio Tayap, Brgy Patag, Silay City Negros Occidental with her 5 children who are 32 to 41 years old.

She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since October 2003 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her general store and gasoline retail business, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly profit of Php 5,000.

Natividad is asking for a loan of Php 29,000 so that she can sustain the working capital needs of her general store and gasoline retailing business. This will be her 15th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of Php 26,000, which she paid off well within its term was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Natividad aspires to elevate her family’s living conditions and ensure their future well being.  

About NWTF:
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Charo

texts.es:
Charo es una mujer de 28 años, está casada con Santiago, de 30 años. Ambos viven junto a sus 3 hijos: Sergio de 11, Jack de 7 y Jean Pool de 4 años, en su casa propia ubicada en una zona  fría de la sierra central del Perú.

Para solventar los gastos domésticos ella se dedica a la compra y venta de productos oriundos de la selva peruana; como café, cacao, maíz, fréjol y achiote (colorante natural) con la ayuda de su esposo. Asimismo, gracias a las buenas ganancias que obtienen de este negocio lograron adquirir dos terrenos productivos más amplios donde plantaron café y están a la espera de su primera cosecha, también pudieron compara  algunos artefactos necesarios para su vivienda, por lo que Charo considera que vive cómodamente sin apuro alguno, sin embargo le preocupa el asma que sufre el menor de sus hijos.
Lo que más le gusta de su labor diaria, desde hace dos años, es visitar las chacras y poder decidir si compra o no los frutos de acuerdo a la calidad que observa.
Para más adelante, tiene planeado situar un puesto en el mercado más antiguo de la ciudad para que sea más fácil distribuir los productos que vende en grandes cantidades, asimismo asegura que sus ventas serán más rápidas porque cuenta con clientes identificados.
 
Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y ante los miembros de su banco comunal se compromete a ser puntual en sus pagos para no defraudar la confianza que están depositando en ella. Como tiene definido qué hacer para progresar, con el dinero que solicita piensa comprar los frutos que hasta hoy comercializa, pero en cantidades mayores que pueda revender para obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Charo is a 28 year old woman who is married to Santiago, age 30. They live with their three children – Sergio (age 11), Jack (age 7), and Jean Pool (age 4) – in their own home in a frigid area in the central mountains of Peru.

To cover her household expenses, Charo buys and sells products that come from the Peruvian jungle such as coffee, cacao, corn, beans, and annatto (a natural food coloring) with the help of her husband. Thanks to the profits from her business, she was able to acquire two plots of productive farmland for planting coffee and is currently awaiting her first crop to harvest. She was also able to buy some basic necessities for her home. Even though she believes her family lives comfortably without any troubles, Charo is concerned about her youngest child who suffers from asthma.

What she enjoys most about her daily work, which she has done for the past two years, is visiting different farms to determine whether or not to buy the harvested produce based on inspecting the quality of the product. In the future, she plans to secure a post at the oldest market in the city so that it will be easier for her sell her products in large quantities. This location will also guarantee her sales will generate faster because the market has its established customers.

Charo will be receiving her first loan from MFP. She has already promised to the other Communal Bank members that she will make her payments on time so as not to betray the trust they have placed in her. In order to progress in her business, she will use the money to buy the same kinds of fruit that she currently sells, except in larger quantities so that she can generate a higher income.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fruit in bulk

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
José C. G. de 32 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos, el mayor tiene 10 años y asiste al colegio de la zona la menor tiene 4 meses de nacida ellos viven en le Caserio de Pinillas - Ocucaje.
El sr. Trabaja desde hace 10 años en el transporte actualmente trabaja en el carro de su carro propio ya que lo ha logrado comprar con sus ahorros  ya que antes el sr trabajo como vigilante y siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una persona ahorradora y muy responsable.
El sr. Trabaja diariamente desde las 7.00am hasta las 9.00 pm realizando colectivo de Ica – Ocucaje ida y vuelta este trabajo lo realiza desde hace 5 años
El goza de buenas referencias de parte de los vecinos los cuales manifiestan que es una persona bien trabajadora.
El desea el financiamiento para poder mejorar su vivienda que fue un poco afectada por el terremoto también para matricular a su hijo y algunos gastos escolares.
texts.en:
José C. G. is 32 years old and lives in his own home with his wife and two children. His oldest child is 10 years old and attends secondary school in the district. The younger child is 4 months old. José and his family live in the village of Pinillas – Ocucaje.

José has worked in the transportation sector for ten years. He currently works in his own car, which he was able to buy with his savings. José previously worked as a security guard and has always been known as a thrifty and responsible person. He works every day from 7am to 9pm for a collective and has been driving along the route between Ica and Ocucaje for the past five years.

José enjoys good references from his neighbors who vouch that he is a hardworking person. He is requesting a loan to make improvements to his home that was slightly affected by the earthquake. In addition, he will pay for his son’s enrollment and school expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pay for home improvements & his son's school expenses

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es un joven carismático de 21 años, vive con su madre, doña Agripina de 56 años, en su acogedora casa propia.
Sus terrenos agrícolas están ubicados en lo alto de los cerros que rodean a su localidad, a los que asiste cada mañana en compañía de su pequeña radio de mano, pues no tiene familiares que lo ayuden en sus actividades agrícolas. Él se dedica a cuidar sus cultivos de papa y arveja desde hace 6 años porque le gusta alcanzar los beneficios económicos que considera son una recompensa a su sacrificada labor, mientras que su madre alimenta y protege a los ovinos y porcinos que cría. Las ganancias que obtienen les permiten solventar los gastos de su domicilio tranquilamente, sin preocupaciones e incluso ahorran para que más adelante puedan comprar animales menores como cuyes y conejos, también desea instalar un negocio de venta de tubérculos como semilla o para consumo y extender su productividad.  

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y desde ya está juntando dinero para pagar oportunamente sus cuotas, al igual que los demás socios de su banco comunal, puesto que siempre se caracterizaron por ser responsables. Para obtener una buena cosecha, Eduardo necesita adquirir abono, fertilizantes y una variedad diferente de semilla de arveja, por lo que solicita mil quinientos nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Eduardo, 21, is a charismatic young man, who lives with his mother, Agripina, 56, in their own cozy home. His farmlands are located on hilltops near his home. Every day he goes to his fields with his small crew of helpers because he doesn't have any relatives to help him with his farming. He has cared for his potato and pea crops for 6 years because he likes to have the economic benefits that his hard work produces as a reward. Meanwhile, his mother feeds and cares for the sheep and pigs she raises. The profits they get allow them to meet their household expenses comfortably and care-free, they even are able to set aside a little so that they can buy small farm animals, like rabbits and guinea pigs, later on. He also wants to sell tubers as seed or for consumption and to extend his productivity. This is his second loan with MFP and he is already saving up money to make his repayments on time, as do his other communal bank members, because they have always been noted for being very responsible. In order to get a better crop yield, Eduardo needs to buy manure, fertilizers and a different variety of pea seeds for which he is asking for 500 new soles.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure, fertilizer and pea seeds.

loans.name: Flor

texts.es:
Flor es una alegre y simpática mujer de 36 años, vive con su esposo Moisés, de 40 años, y con 3 de los 4 hijos que tiene. 
A treinta minutos de camino desde la zona donde vive se encuentran sus sembríos,  donde cada mañana llega con sus herramientas de trabajo; sus toros, con las cuales ara las chacras y los asnos que trasladan los insumos agrícolas; mientras que los cerdos que cría los deja amaniatados al costado de su vivienda. Desde hace 20 años se dedica a sembrar papa, maíz y arveja junto a su esposo, pues lo que más le gusta es ver florecer los productos que le dan vida y belleza a los campos, además porque gracias a este oficio tiene bienes y animales que comercializa cuando tiene apuros económicos, pero lo más importante es que puede vivir cómodamente, sin apuro alguno.
Con el tiempo, anhela seguir luchando para conseguir nuevas oportunidades mediante la compra de terrenos agrícolas que le brinden excelentes cosechas.

Este es el sexto préstamo que tiene con MFP y gracias a la organización de su banco comunal que trabaja entusiastamente. Como sus siembras de papa están para ser fumigados y abonados, solicita este crédito para comprar sacos de fertilizantes e insecticidas, en aras de asegurar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Flor is a happy and friendly 36 year old woman. She lives with her husband Moisés, age 40, and with 3 of their 4 children. Thirty minutes by road from the area she lives are located her planted fields where, each morning, she arrives with her work tools, the oxen with which she plows, and the donkeys that transport her raw materials. Meanwhile, the pigs she raises are left tied up next to her house.

For 20 years, Flor and her husband have been engaged in planting potatoes, corn, and peas. What she likes most is seeing the products she’s given life to flourish and the beauty of the countryside. In addition, thanks to her occupation she has possessions and animals that she can put up for sale when she has economic difficulties, but the most important thing is that she can live comfortably without hardship. For the future, she hopes to continue striving to obtain opportunities for purchasing agricultural land that provides her with excellent harvests.

This is the sixth loan that she has with MFP, thanks to the organization of her communal bank, which works enthusiastically. Since her potato crops have to be fumigated and fertilized she is applying for this loan in order to buy sacks of fertilizer and insecticide to assure the productivity of her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer and insecticide

loans.name: Franco

texts.es:
Franco es un joven entusiasta y emprendedor de 25 años, y está casado con Reina de 25 años. Ambos tienen 3 hijos: Sherlin de 6, Mayte de 3 y Briana de 1 año, esta familia vive en una casa alquilada.

Desde hace 5 años él se dedica a sembrar papa, arveja, habas, zanahoria y maíz, en terrenos arrendados y algunos heredados a su esposa. Lo que más le gusta de su labor es fumigar sus sembríos para evitar que sean invadidos por las plagas; por otro lado, le disgusta caminar largas horas para llegar a sus chacras porque no existe carretera.
Paralelamente aprendió el oficio de panadero, el cual ejerció estos dos últimos meses y al ver las buenas utilidades que recibe de ambas actividades planea en el futuro instalar una panadería, donde elaborará panes, pasteles y tortas, pero sin dejar de sembrar, ya que gracias a la agricultura su familia tiene estabilidad económica.

Este es el cuarto préstamo que tiene con MFP y se compromete a pagar puntualmente sus cuotas ahorrando con anticipación, como se lo enseñaron los integrantes de su banco comunal. El dinero que ahora solicita pretende invertirlo en la compra de varios sacos de abono orgánico y semillas de arveja y papa.
texts.en:
Franco, 25, is an enthusiastic and enterprising young man. He is married to Reina, 25, and they have three children: Sherlin, 6, Mayte, 3, and Briana, 1; they live in a rented house. For the last 5 years he has farmed potatoes, peas, broad beans, carrots and corn on leased farmlands and on lands inherited by his wife. What he likes best about his work is fumigating his plantings to prevent them from being invaded by pests. On the other hand, what he dislikes is having to walk for long hours to reach his farmlands because there is no road. He also learned how to be a baker. He has baked for the last two months and, upon seeing the good profits he makes from both activities, he is planning to set up a bakery in the future to make bread and cakes. He won't stop farming, though, because it's thanks to farming that his family has economic stability. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion, saving money in advance, like he was taught by his fellow communal bank members. The funds requested will be used to buy several sacks of organic manure as well as potato and pea seed.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and seed.

loans.name: Haydee

texts.es:
Haydee es una mujer emprendedora de 39 años y está casada con Francisco de 54 años. Tienen 5  hijos, pero actualmente viven con los 3 menores: Emily de 10, Andelina de 3 y Gresly de 1 año. Su casa es propia y está ubicada en una zona céntrica de la provincia de Tarma.

Desde hace 11 años, junto a su esposo se dedica a sembrar papa, maíz, arveja y habas, también cuenta con la ayuda de su hija mayor, aunque ya no viven con ella.
Pese a tener que cuidar a sus dos pequeños asiste a diario a trabajar en la chacra porque le gusta ver limpios y frondosos sus cultivos. Haydee considera su labor bastante rentable porque le permitió alcanzar logros importantes en su vida: “siembro porque gracias a la agricultura he podido cubrir la manutención de mi hogar, comprar mi casa, educar a mis hijos y comprar más terrenos, además puedo degustar primero mis cosechas y asegurar su calidad y sabor” – manifiesta.
Para el futuro, piensa sembrar en mayor cantidad para obtener mayores ingresos económicos e incluso está ampliando su vivienda para criar y vender animales.

Este es el primer préstamo que tiene con MFP y ante los miembros de su banco comunal, a quienes conoce por ser personas trabajadoras y honestas, se compromete a pagar puntualmente cada cuota. En busca de una cosecha exitosa, con el dinero que solicita, Haydee pretende comprar varios sacos de fertilizantes valorizados en mil nuevos soles aproximadamente. Como se observa en la foto, está en una tienda de insumos agrícolas averiguando precios.
texts.en:
Haydee, 39, is an enterprising woman. She is married to Francisco, 54, and they have 5 children; the three youngest, Emily, 10, Andelina,3, and Gresly, 1, live with them still. They own their own, centrally located, home in Tarma province. For the last 11 years she and her husband have farmed potatoes, corn, peas and broad beans. Her eldest daugheter, although she does not live with them anymore, helps. Despite having to care for her two small children, she comes to work the fields daily because she likes to see them clean and rich in foliage. Haydee considers her work to be quite profitable because it allowed her to meet imprtant goals in her life. She states: "I plant because, farming allowed my to support my household, to buy my home, educate my children and purchase more farmlands. Besides, I'm the first one to taste the crops and insure their quality and flavor." For the future, she plans to plant larger amounts so that her profits will be higher; she is even enlarging her home so that she can raise small animals to sell. This is her first loan with MFP. She pledges to her fellow members, whom she knows to be hard-working, honest people, to repay on time. With the aim of a successful crop, she will use the requested funds to buy several sacks of fertilizers that cost 1000 new soles, approximately. As one can see in the photo, she is in a farm supply store asking about prices.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel es un hombre de 54 años, está casado con el amor de su vida, Dionisia. Esta pareja tiene 6 hijos, pero sólo viven con los dos últimos; Edgar de 7 y Diego de 6 años.   

Gracias a sus labores agrícolas, en compañía de su esposa, consiguió terrenos productivos que le generan buenas cosechas de maíz, papa y arvejas desde hace 30 años. Estos productos los comercializa a los mayoristas del mercado de su ciudad, quienes después de todo este tiempo lo conocen, así como también conocen la calidad de sus siembras.
Lo que más le gusta a él, es cosechar y comercializar la mercadería porque recibe la recompensa de varios días de sacrificio. En un principio todas las ganancias eran para solventar la educación de sus hijos, sin embargo ahora las utilidades que consigue las invierte en cubrir las necesidades domésticas y en ahorrar para más adelante poder convertirse en negociante de tubérculos y arvejas, productos muy solicitados. Además como sembrará en mayor cantidad se proyecta obtener más ingresos que le permita brindar una adecuada calidad de vida a su familia.               

Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP y sabe que si desea seguir accediendo a más créditos debe ser puntual en cada pago. A su vez, le agrada trabajar en su banco comunal porque los integrantes son exigentes y siempre le recomiendan no mal gastar el dinero. Con el dinero que solicita tiene pensado comprar una bolsa se semilla de arveja, abono orgánico, fertilizantes y insecticidas.
texts.en:
Manuel is a 54 year-old man who is married to the love of his life, Dionisia. This couple has 6 children, but only the 2 youngest live with them: Edgar, who is 7, and Diego, who is 6 years old. Thanks to his agricultural work, accompanied by his wife, he was able to get some productive land where he has been getting good harvests of corn, potatoes and peas for 30 years. He sells these products to the wholesale traders in the market in his city, who after all this time know him and know the quality of his products. What he enjoys most is to harvest and market the merchandise, because he gets rewarded for all of his days of sacrifice. At first all of his earnings went to pay for the education of his children. However, now the profits he earns are used to cover domestic necessities and to save so that in the future he can convert his business to the production of root vegetables and peas, products that are in high demand. In addition, he will cultivate in greater quantity so that he can have a higher income, which will allow him to provide an adequate quality of life for his family. This is his 2nd loan with MFP, and he knows that if he wants to continue to access credit he must be on time with every payment. At the same time, he is pleased to work with his communal bank because the members are demanding and always recommend that the money be spent wisely. With the money that he requests he will buy a sack of pea seeds, organic fertilizers, chemical fertilizers, and insecticides.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seeds, insecticides and fertilizers

loans.name: Walter

texts.es:
Walter es un joven muy empeñoso de 21 años, que vive en su casa propia con sus padres Mauro de 45 y Reída de 47 años.
Él como ejemplo tiene a sus padres que son personas integras y trabajadoras que a diario le enseñan las técnicas agrícolas para una eficiente labor, Walter desde hace 6 años se dedica a sembrar arveja, habas, papa y maíz conjuntamente con sus progenitores, lo que más le gusta es arar las chacras porque según cuenta siente que siembra una esperanza o una nueva vida que le dará  frutos de calidad en grandes cantidades ya que las labra con amor, por otro lado estos meses le incomoda tener que luchar con las inclemencias del tiempo puesto que pondrían en riesgo su producción sino es atento y cuidadoso.
Las adversidades no le asustan y está confiado en que la próxima campaña de cosecha incrementará sus ingresos económicos debido a que en la agricultura no hay perdida más aún si le brindas los cuidados necesarios, por eso para su futuro piensa incrementar sus producción, también ser negociante mayorista y trasladar su mercadería hasta la capital del Perú (Lima).  
               
Este es el segundo préstamo que tiene con MFP, con su responsabilidad y puntualidad se a ganado la confianza de todos los integrantes de su banco comunal, con quienes le gusta trabajar.  El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de semilla de arveja y varios sacos de abono, para lo cual necesita mil nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Walter, 21, is an enterprising young man, who lives in his own home with his parents: Mauro, 45 and Reída, 47. He has, as examples, his parents, who are hard-working, honorable people, who daily teach him farming techniques for efficient labor. For the past 6 years, Walter has farmed peas, broad beans, potatoes and corn with his parents. What he likes best about his work is plowing the fields because, as he says, he always feels that he's planting hope or a new life that will bear abundant fruit because he works his fields with much love. On the other hand, these last few months he has had to struggle against the inclement weather which, if he's not attentive and careful, can wreak havoc with his crops. He isn't frightened by these adversities, however. He is confident that the next harvest will increase his earnings because, in farming, there are no losses, especially if you provide the proper care to your plantings. For the future, he plans to increase his production, to become a wholesale merchant, and to sell his merchandise all the way to Perú's capital, Lima. This is his second loan with MFP. His responsibility and punctuality has won over the trust of all his fellow communal bank members, with whom he enjoys working. The money requested, 1000 new soles, will be used to buy pea seed and several sacks of manure.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and seed.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda es una mujer de 30 años que tiene sus metas bien trazadas, vive en su casa propia con su esposo Abelardo y sus dos hermosos e inquietos hijos; Verónica de 10 y Anthony de 8 años.
Todos los días, desde muy temprano, trabaja los terrenos agrícolas que arrienda para sembrar papa, arveja y flores (gladiolos) de diferentes colores, con la ayuda de algunos operarios que contrata. Su esposo se dedica al transporte público de pasajeros con su propio auto. 
A Yolanda le gusta dedicarse a la agricultura (desde hace 10 años) porque obtiene ingresos económicos provechosos que le permiten vivir cómodamente, también puede pagar una adecuada educación para sus hijos en la ciudad, pese a vivir a una hora con 20 minutos de distancia.
Como es una mujer emprendedora y conciente de que puede alcanzar sus objetivos con perseverancia, para el futuro anhela construir una casa en la ciudad para que sus pequeños no se cansen viajando, entretanto ella instalaría una tienda de venta de tubérculos y arveja, y para trasladar sus cosechas hacia el mercado piensa comprar un camión.         

Esta es la segunda vez que tiene un préstamo con MFP y considera que está progresando conjuntamente con los integrantes de su banco comunal. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que viene solicitando, comprará dos bolsas de semilla de arveja y un saco de fertilizantes para obtener buenos productos en esta nueva campaña agrícola.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 30, has very well set out goals in life. She lives with her husband, Abelardo, and two beautiful, restless children: Verónica, 10 and Anthony, 8. Every day, from very early on, she farms leased lands to grow potatos, peas, and different colored gladiolas; she has a few hired hands that assist her. Her husband provides public transport services in his own car. Yolanda likes farming; she has done it for 10 years, because she earns good income that allows her to live comfortably. She is also able to afford a good education in the city for her children, even though they live an hour and 20 minutes away. As an enterprising woman and conscious that she can reach future goals with hard work and perseverance, she hopes to build a house in the city so that her little ones won't get so tired traveling. In the meantime, she will set up a store to sell tubers and peas and, in order to transport her crops, she is thinking about buying a truck. This is her second loan with MFP and she feels that she, together with her fellow communal bank members, is making progress. She will use the 1500 new soles requested to buy two sacks of pea seed and one sack of fertilizer in order to obtain better crops this next planting season.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seed and fertilizer.

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic V. is from the village of Banquero. She is 23 years old. Marivic is married and has 3 infant-aged children. To make a living, Marivic owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting variety of vegetables for sale. Marivic has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Marivic joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marivic is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase new items to expand the products she offers.. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Marivic from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase new items to expand product offerings

texts.en:
Manayon C. is 47 years old and from the town of San Antonio, San Agustin. She is the group leader of a 15-member group loan offered by Kiva partner, ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.
Manayon is married and has three adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a tailoring business. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing general alteration and tailoring services to local community members. loans.name: Gulzat's Group

texts.en:
Balykchy is one of the towns of Kyrgyzstan which is famous not only for its fish and its historical background, but also for its citizens, who are hardworking, self-confident people. One of the examples is Gulzat A.. She is a well-educated young lady. After graduating from the university, she worked in the bank as a financier for many years. Everything was fine, but since the ambitious mind wants success, as it always does, she was not satisfied with her salary and left the job. 

Then she attended a sewing course. Later on she borrowed 20,000 KGS ($445) and opened up a rented pavilion. Now she sews curtains and makes national crafts. At present, she is thirty-six years old and married. She has a daughter, age sixteen, who attends the local school. Her husband works in a plastics factory in the capital. 

Now her profits per month are about 9,000 KGS ($200). She wants a loan to buy fabrics to expand her assortment, because in March she is going to another city to trade. With the money that she would earn, she wants to buy domestic appliances.

Bubukan C. is a married woman whose husband is a pensioner, but has enough strength to help his wife in her business. In 1997 they began to fatten and sell sheep. With the money earned they married off their son and expanded their number of sheep. They began this business with 2,000 KGS ($45) and now their monthly profit is about 15,000 KGS ($335). With the loan they want to buy nine sheep for 2,000 to 2,500 KGS ($45 to $55) each. 

Bakytbek C. is a married man, forty years old. His wife works as a credit manager. He has two children and the elder one attends school. He works in forensics (death investigation) as a dispatcher, and his salary is 6,000 KGS ($134). He is planning to provide education for his children and buy a car as well. With the loan he wants to buy hay.

Rahat A. is a thirty-six year old married woman. She saved some money, approximately 35,000 KGS ($778), with which she bought materials and sewed them using patterns. Her husband does not work now. Her profit per month is about 10,000 KGS ($225). Also she has a daughter who studies at the university and she paid her tuition of about 18,000 KGS ($400). By getting a loan she would expand her assortment of fabrics in order to work in another town.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of a 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy fabrics to expand assortment of curtains

loans.name: Shayinbubu's Group

texts.en:
Balykchy is one of the famous towns of Kyrgyzstan where people have a good time, mostly in the summer because it is on the coast of Kyrgyzstan's beautiful lake, Issyk–Kyl. Although there is unemployment, the citizens of Balykchy mostly sell fish and goods in the markets, and thus they live. 

However, some of them are really hardworking people. One of them is Shayinbubu S., who is a thirty-year-old young lady. She is married and has a son, age five. Her husband is a self-employed taxi driver. Both husband and son help Shayinbubu in her business. Together they sell clothes in the market. With the profit they have bought a car. They thank God that all their troubled days are in the past. 

In the beginning, when it was really hard even to have bread daily, they did not crack. Instead they were determined to find a way out of that situation. About five years ago, for 5,000 KGS ($115), Shayinbubu bought a sewing machine, and little by little she started her business. She was sewing national items and selling them until they got a loan from Mol Bulak Finance. Now she has shifted from making national items to trading clothes. Now she sells women's and men's pants, and she sells apples in the summer. She is planning to buy a big new house and provide education for her son as well. Her monthly profit is about 11,000 KGS ($250). She wants a loan to buy a spring assortment of clothes for both females and males, and to sell the clothes in remote districts on weekends.

Ayzat S. is a twenty-nine-year-old married woman who has two children. Her husband works as the driver of a lorry. His salary is 4,000 KGS ($89). Her elder son is nine and goes to school. Her daughter is five and she attends kindergarten.  Ayzat works at the post office and earns 2,500 KGS ($55). They are planning to buy furniture and educate their children. With the loan they are requesting, they want to buy curtains for their house.

Rakyia B. is a married woman. She is thirty-nine years old and they have four children; two daughters and two sons. The older son attends school, as do their two daughters, but the youngest child is at home. The older daughter helped her mother distribute goods which were bought with saved money (5,000 KGS ($112), and later on the business was expanded and increased among the companies. Her elder daughter graduated from a specialized school. They want a loan to buy a foal and to re-do their house. In the future they are planning to buy a house, a car and give education to their children.

Mednina S. is a young lady who is twenty-four years old and has two children. She is married, and her husband works at a construction company. A year ago, when she started her business with 2,000 KGS ($45), she and her sister were selling half-built houses. Now her revenue is about 4,000 KGS ($90). She wants to buy her own house because she lives with her relatives now. She wants a loan to invest, and with the profits she wants to make her dream come true.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy a spring assortment of clothes to sell

loans.name: Samarkul's Group

texts.en:
Samarkul K.'s background is very rich in experience. After successfully graduating from one of the prestigious universities of the Soviet Union, Kyrgyz National University, she worked as an accountant for more years than she could have imagined that she would. She was suddenly let go in 2004. The way she displayed courage was something unimaginable. Because an ambitious mind wants success, she was able to confront that situation. Thanks to God, she had studied well, because she started a little business which soon turned into big one. 

For 8,000 KGS ($178) she bought a cow. Selling milk didn't contribute enough to the family's budget, so they borrowed money from relatives to buy livestock. They bought bull calves, so that after fattening them they could sell them. Her revenue was about 500 KGS ($12). In the meantime, life went on and now she is fifty-four years old. She has married and has a brilliant husband who works as a teacher. In his free time he helps her with her business. Also she has two children; a daughter and a son. Her daughter is already married and now lives separately, and her son is a student. She is planning to increase the number of calves and provide education for her son as well. She wants a loan to buy bull calves for reselling after fattening. 

Gulzada K. is thirty-eight years old and is married. Her husband takes across passengers. They have six children, the elder one studying in the university, the rest attending local schools.  Ten years ago she successfully opened up a business by selling their bull calf for 20,000 KGS ($445). She sells housewares. Her revenue per month is about 15,000 KGS ($334). They already have bought a house, and have built a shop and a shed. She wants a loan to buy more housewares to sell.

Orozkul H. is a married woman. She is twenty-six years old and has two children who are at home with her. Her husband works on projects sometimes and also resells sheep in the farmyard. Three years ago they started their business with 5,000 KGS ($112) and now their profit per month is about 3,000 KGS ($65). They are planning to get a loan for reselling sheep.

Ulanbek B. is a 22-year-old energetic guy who is planning to build a barn, set up new fencing and increase the number of his livestock. His grandfather started this business ten years ago, but unfortunately he passed and the business was inherited. Now they are dealing with selling milk and cattle raising.  Their total revenue is about 3,000 KGS ($65) and they want to take out a loan to buy a bull calf to keep.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy bull calves to resell after fattening

loans.name: Janyl's Group

texts.en:
Balykchy is a town in Kyrgyzstan. For many years this town has been famous for fishing. In previous times, this town was Rybachyi, which means Fishermen. Janyl J. is one of the citizens of this historical town. She is the elder daughter in her family, and that’s why she has more responsibility for the things which happen around her. As the eldest one, she has leadership qualities. After graduating from school with the help of her parents, who gave her 20,000 KGS ($445), she opened up a little business by renting a pavilion which later on became a bigger one. Now the turnover is 150,000 KGS ($3,335) and there is no more renting because they have their own pavilion. Her business is selling carpets and rugs. She sells them in the new market of Balykchy town. She is married and has a child. Her husband helps her in her business and supports her as well in life. Their revenue is about 30,000 KGS ($665). The future plans are to open another pavilion where they would sell domestic appliances. Now they decided to take out a loan to buy a new gas cooker and new oven, as the previous ones are too old.

Aynur DJ. is a forty-nine-year-old, married woman whose husband takes across passengers. She has two children, both age  fifteen and attending the local school. About three years ago they started baking spice cakes and selling them in Bishkek. They began this business with 10,000 KGS ($225). They are planning to increase their experience by expanding their assortment. At the present time, they make two kinds of pastries, and the turnover is about 20,000 ($445). They want a loan to buy coloring agents, flour, sugar and cake boxes.

Chynar A. is forty-one years old and a married woman. She has three children. The elder son is a student and a daughter is a schoolgirl.  The youngest one is at home. Her husband works as an electrician in a company. She is planning to trade with fish and provide education for her children as well, but now she works in a confectionery. Her salary is 2,000 KGS ($45). She wants a loan to make her plan come true by investing money to grow.

Kaiyrkul K. is thirty-two and a married woman. She has a husband who works in the construction business and has a salary of from 2,000 to 3,000 KGS ($45 to $65).  She has three daughters who attend the local school. Like every parent, she wants to provide for education for her children in the future.  Now she works in a confectionery for 2,000 KGS ($45) per month, but it is not enough. That is why she wants a loan to trade with fish as well.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to buy a new gas cooker and new oven

loans.name: Aydin

texts.en:
Aydin J. is a 43-year-old trader who sells furniture in the small village of Agsu city. He is married and has four children who are the meaning of his life.

Aydin has ten years of experience in selling furniture. He wishes to save money to provide his children with an education. He needs to invest in his shop and purchase more furniture and for this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN.

loans.use: To purchase more furniture to sell

loans.name: Hijran

texts.en:
Hijran J. is a married woman with two children. She runs a business selling office and school supplies. Her seven years of being in business have helped her store flourish into a successful enterprise.

Hijran would like to see her business grow still further. She believes additional financial assistance will help guarantee expansion and higher profits. Hijran’s integrity, good reputation, stability and rich experience working in commerce should secure prompt repayment of this loan and consistent progress in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more office supplies to sell

loans.name: Vahid

texts.en:
Vahid S. is 52 years old, is married, and has two children.

For more than twenty years Vahid has been selling fruits and vegetables such as potatoes, onions, carrots, apples, bananas, etc. His business begins early in the morning at 5:00 a.m.

Vahid buys vegetables from the local farmers wholesale and sells them in the market. Moreover, he is trading in a market that is known among people because of the attractive prices. All this allows Vahid’s business to generate a stable and considerable income for his family.

Today, Vahid is planning to purchase new, fresh vegetables to sell in order to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose he applied for 1,600 AZN. The well-being of this family is in your hands.

loans.use: To purchase more fresh vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ramiq

texts.en:
Ramiq M. is 26 years old. He is single and lives with his parents.

Since four years ago, Ramiq has been a small-business entrepreneur who sells different kinds of foodstuffs like cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many other items in a rented store. Today he is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to increase his stock. 

Ramiq is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is to have his own family. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Adil

texts.en:
Adil H. has always distinguished himself as being a very hardworking person and devoted to his wife and four children who are the apple of his eye.

Adil manages his own business, a grocery store, which he started more that fifteen years ago. Thanks to his business, Adil has been able to help his family.

Today Adil requests a loan of 1,600 AZN. He needs you and, through your generosity, you can help him expand his business so that he may continue to support his children's education.

Please help Adil and his family by becoming part of the development of his small business. Adil will sincerely thank you.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Gloria Elena

texts.es: La señora Gloria Elena, vive en la zona de Nueva Guinea junto a su familia compuesta por 2 hijos menores y su esposo, su desde muy pequeña su principal actividad ha sido la ganaderia y cultivos agricolas sirviendole como una fuente de subsistencia en el nucleo familiar, la mayor necesidad que se le presenta es el sector economico pues no cuenta con los recursos que le permitan poder cubrir necesidades en su pequeña finca, necesita este financiamiento para retencion de 7 terneros puesto que no existe una buena comercializacion en el momento para este tipo de animal, espera que en el transcurso de 15 meses pueda haber un mejor precio en los semoviente y asegurar que su venta sea mas rentable, su compañero de vida  le apolla en las diferentes actividades para el bien comun del la familia, desde ya agradece el apollo que le brinden.
texts.en:
Gloria Elena lives in the Nueva Guinea area with her family, which is composed of her husband and two minor children. From a very early age, she has raised cattle and farmed. These activities have produced income for family support. Her greatest need in the economic sector is that she does not have sufficient funds to cover costs of her small farm. She needs this funding in order to be able to keep 7 calves because right now isn't a good time to sell them. She hopes that in another 15 months livestock prices will improve so that a sale will be more profitable. Her husband supports her in the activities that aim for the common good of the family. She gives thanks in advance for any help she may receive.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer
