loans.use: To afford to keep 7 calves.

loans.name: Santos Eliezer

texts.es: Santos Eliezer de 32 años de edad es casado, habita en la ciudad de Juigalpa en la casa que le heredaron sus padres a el y sus hermanos junto a su familia compuesta por su esposa y 2 niños el mayor de 9 años y el menor de 6 años, ambos estudiando la primaria.  Santos labora en el MAGFOR Chontales como Consultor Agropecuario. Ademas tiene una casa fuera de esta ciudad, la cual esta alquilando para recibir ingresos adicionales, a la cual necesita brindarle mayor seguridad, por lo que esta solicitando su 2do credito a esta institucion esperando ser beneficiado con el fondo kiva para poder construir una tapia en su casa, puesto que el patio no esta bien cerrado y los vecinos llegan a botar basura.  El mayor sueño de Santos es poder lograr que su casa pueda tener las condiciones basicas, puesto que es el patrimonio que en un futuro le heredara a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Santos Eliezer is 32 years old and is married. He lives in the city of Juigalpa, in the house his parents left for him and his brothers, along with his wife and two children. His oldest is 9 and his youngest 6 and they are both in elementary school. Santos works in MAGFOR Chontales as a Farming Consultant. Additionally, he has a house outside of Juigalpa which he is renting to receive extra income. He needs to provide greater safety to the house which is why he is requesting a second loan. He is hoping to receive Kiva funding to build a wall in his house since the yard is not enclosed and neighbors throw away their trash in it. Santos' greatest dream is have the house meet basic conditions as he will leave it for his children.

Translated from Spanish by Rocio Vargas, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Building of wall

loans.name: Esther Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Sra. Esther del S. C. C. es empleada en una institución local en el Municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito el que va a utilizar en la compra de un terreno para construcción futura de una casa.

Ella empezó a trabajar por la necesidad de tener un ingreso fijo mensualmente y mejorar sus condiciones de vida, ella tiene aproximadamente unos 3 años de trabajar en dicha institución de lunes a viernes desde las  8 de la mañana hasta las cinco de la tarde, cabe señalar que antes de trabajar ella se dedicaba a sus estudios en secundaria.

Ella espera que con compra de este terreno en un futuro se le facilite aun más la construcción de su propia casa y darle un hogar justo y digno a su familia ya que ese un uno de sus principales objetivos al estar trabajando. Ella es una mujer casada y con un niño que aun no esta en edad escolar y vive con su esposo en casa de sus suegros.

Este es el primer crédito que ella solicita en Ceprodel y espera que dicho financiamiento le beneficie positivamente ya  que su principal objetivo es la construcción de su casa de habitación y quiere empezar por la compra de dicho terreno ya que por cuenta propia no se podría por que los ingresos familiares son muy bajo.
texts.en:
Esther del S. C. C. is employed by a local institution in the city of Condega. She is requesting funds to buy a lot for the future building of her home. She began to work because she needed a secure, monthly income and to improve her living conditions. She has been working for the aforementioned institution for about 3 years from Monday-Friday from 8am until 5pm. It's worth mentioning that prior to starting to work she was in high school. She hopes that the purchase of this lot will make building her house in the future easier and will give her family a just and proper place to live since this is one of her main goals in working. She is married and has a son, who is still too young for school; she lives with her husband in the house of her in-laws. This is her first loan with Ceprodel and she hopes to benefit greatly from it since her main objective is building her house and she wants to start to purchase the lot because her family income is insufficient to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a lot.

loans.name: Yovany Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Sra. Yovany del Socorro L. O. es empleada en una fábrica de Puros en el casco urbano del Municipio de Condega.

Ella solicita un crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción tales como arena y ladrillos de construcción, con la compra de estos ella llevara a cabo la construcción de una etapa más de su casa de habitación. Ella a empezó a trabaja en esta fabrica con el objetivo de tener un ingreso mensual fijo para poder con sus gastos familiares.

La Sra. Yovany L. O. se ha dedicado a la elaboración de puros desde hace 4 años, ella trabaja de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde, antes de dedicarse a esta labor ella trabaja de obrera en otra fábrica.

Ella espera que con la compra de dichos materiales llevar a cabo la construcción de su casa de habitación y así tener un techo digno para ella y su familia ya que ese a sido s sueño, ella es casado y tiene dos hijos uno de ellos en edad estudiantil a quien le costea los gastos escolares.

Este es el segundo crédito que ella solicita en Ceprodel en un periodo de 3 años. El impacto que ella ha recibido de dichos financiamientos an sido positivos ya que ha logrado ir construyendo su casa en etapas lo que ha sido su principal interés y que por cuenta propia no lo hubiese logrado ya que sus ingresos son muy bajos
texts.en:
Yovany del Socorro L. O. is employed by a cigar factory in greater Condega. She is asking for funding to buy building materials like, sand and bricks, to complete another building phase on her house. She began working in this factory in order to have monthly income to meet household expenses. Yovany del Socorro L. O. has manufactured cigars for 4 years; she works Monday through Friday from 7am until 5pm. Prior to this employment she worked in another factory. She hopes that the purchase of these building materials will lead to the completion of her home and that her family will have a proper roof over their heads, since this has always been her dream. She is married and has two children, one of whom is of school age and she pays for his education. This is her second loan in three years with Ceprodel. The loans have had a positive impact on her life allowing her to build her house in phases. This has been her goal since she would have not been able to do so without the loans because her income is very low.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Magdaleno

texts.es:
El señor Magdaleno T. P. es originario de la comunidad el coyol municipio de condega se dedica a actividades agrícolas y ganaderas su finca tiene una extensión de 160 mz de terreno siendo estas mas a la actividad de ganado, se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de 4 novillos de engorde para después venderlos de pesa en el matadero de condega ya que es una de las principales actividades de este cliente.

Su negocio comenzó desde niño ya que su papa también se dedicaba a este rubro por lo que no fue difícil para él aprenderlo y sacarle provecho a este negocio  de compra y repasto de ganado él espera que 
Con el crédito le vaya muy bien porque tendrá mas oportunidad de seguir trabajando y obtener un buen ingreso y comprar mas ganado de repasto cabe mencionar que este productor también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos y papa esto con el objetivo de mejorar cada día mas su finca y poder dejarle a sus hijos un buen patrimonio de su parte.


Don Magdaleno es casado y tiene cuatro hijos dos edad escolar y dos que trabajan con él ya mayores de edad. Este es sexto crédito que se le otorga y trabaja con ceprodel desde el dos mi cuatro y nos expreso que esta agradecido con la institución por la ayuda que se le a brindado ya que a mejorado sus condiciones de vida de su familia y espera seguir trabajando sin tener problemas.
texts.en:
Magdaleno T. P. is from Coyol, Condega. He is a farmer and cattleman. His farm is 160 manzanas (one manzana=7000 square meters approx.) which are dedicated almost exclusively to cattle raising. He was given a loan to buy 4 calves to raise for subsequent sale to the Condega slaughterhouse; this is one of the main activities of this client. His business began when he was still a child because his father was in the same line of work so it wasn't difficult for him to learn and take advantage of this cattle raising business. He expects the loan will do him good because he will have more opportunity to continue working, have higher income, and buy more cattle to raise. It is worth mention that this producer also farms basic grains and potatoes in order to improve his farm and leave a greater asset to his children. Magdaleno is married and has four, school-age children and two adult children that work with him. This is his 6th loan and he has collaborated with Ceprodel since 2004. He stated that he is grateful to the institution for the help it has given him because his family's living conditions have improved and he hopes to continue to work problem-free.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy calves.

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: Doña Luisa es madre de familia de tres hermosos hijos, junto con su esposo han forjado un pequeño negocio la venta de productos plásticos el cual llevan varios años en ventas, compran en el mercado oriental por docenas a bajo precios y luego lo venden a un mejor precio. Poco a poco han ido haciendo las mejoras con los financiamientos que la institución ha dado y se siente contenta por estos beneficios, de mejorar su casa. Con su crédito anterior logro cerrar con maya su terreno para una mejor seguridad. Y con este préstamo desea poder construir un servicio higiénico ya que lo que tiene es una letrina ya muy vieja y por falta de dinero no había construido lo cual es de mucha necesidad para una mejor higiene de su familia. Comprara: bloques, cemento, arena, y un inodoro, tubo, pvc para hacer las conexiones del inodoro y comenzar hacer la obra. Esta contenta por este objetivo mas que hace para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Luisa is the mother of three beautiful children. Together with her husband, she has set up a small business selling plastic items. They have been in this line of work for several years. They buy at Oriental market by the dozen at low prices and then resell at a better price. Gradually, they have used loans from the institution to do home repairs. She is very happy with these improvements. She used her previous loan to fence in her property thus making it more secure. She will use this loan to build a bathroom because what she has now is a very old latrine and she didn't have funds before to do this. Having a proper toilet is vital for her family's hygiene. She will buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, a toilet and pvc tubing to connect it. She is happy with this goal because it will greatly benefit her family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy concrete blocks, cement, sand, a toilet, pvc tubing to connect the toilet, and start the project.

loans.name: Germán

texts.es:
El señor Germán O. H. trabaja en la universidad católica agropecuaria del trópico seco (ucatse) como celador tiene mas de cinco años de estar laborando y desempeñado bien su trabajo se le otorgo el crédito para la compra de un dinamo y calzado de pozo artesanal ya que la necesidad de agua que se  encuentra en su lugar es muy critica su trabajo es día de por medio ya que le toca cuidar también por la noche 
Antes de tener este trabajo el se dedicaba a hacer ladrillos como trabajador de otra persona. 

El espera que con la hecha de este poso no tendrá problemas del vital liquido ya que tiene un buen caudal y se mantiene en el verano. Don Germán es  casado y tiene tres hijos en edad escolar por lo que espera que ellos se preparen algún día y  pueda ver el fruto de sus hijos. Sus padres no viven con él porque formo su propio hogar pero los ayudas cada ves que él puede.

Este es el cuarto crédito que Germán tiene con ceprodel 
y trabaja desde el dos mil seis con la institución y nos expreso que los créditos con ceprodel han ayudado mucho  a mejorar su nivel de vida ya que a mejorado su casa y a comprado cosas necesarias del hogar por tanto desea seguir trabajando y espera no quedar mal con ceprodel.
texts.en:
Germán O. H. works as a watchman at UCATSE (a university); he has been employed there for over 5 years and has done his job very well. He was given a loan to buy a dynamo and to line an artesian well because his area has a critical shortage of water. He must do this work during the day because his watchman duties are at night. Prior to this employment, he made bricks as an employee of another person. He hopes that the digging of the well will end his problems with water supply because the well is well-fed and it does not dry up in Summer. German is married and has three, school-age children. He hopes that they will become prepared in the future and that he will see the fruits of his labor in his children. His parents don't live with him because he started his own family but he helps them out whenever he can. This is his 4th loan with Ceprodel and has collaborated with the institution since 2006. He stated that Ceprodel loans have been very useful in improving his living conditions because he has been able to improve his home and buy things needed in his home. He is, therefore, hopeful to continue working with and not disappointing Ceprodel.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To line a well and buy a dynamo.

loans.name: Gloria De Jesus

texts.es:
la señora Gloria de Jesus C. tiene 38 años de edad, es madre de dos hijas, una de sus hijas ya tiene un bebe, viven en casa de un hermano suyo en el barrio suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome Valle.
 
Gloria se dedica a la fabricacion y venta de arreglos florales, tambien hace decoraciones para eventos especiales como bodas, cumpleaños , fiestas en general.
 
su deseo es construir su propia casa para darle un hogar digno a sus hijas y su nieto.
en estos momentos Gloria necesita el credito para comprar mas flores y materiales para decoraciones, quiere obtener mas ganancias para tener un buen capital para empezar a construir su casa.
texts.en:
Gloria de Jesus C. is 38 and has two daughters. One of her daughters already has a baby. They live in her brother’s house in the Suyapa neighborhood in the city of Nacaome Valley. Gloria makes and sells floral arrangements. She also makes decorations for special events like weddings, birthdays, and parties in general. Her wish is to build her own house in order to give her daughters and her grandson a decent home. Gloria now needs a loan to buy more flowers and materials for decorations. She wants to get more income to have a good amount of capital to begin building her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy flowers, decorative ribbons, vases, and bags

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana
texts.en:
Juana has already had two loans from FVP, both of which she repaid punctually, and both of which she used for home improvements.

She is requesting a loan to put-in the doors and windows for her house, as she is only lacking a few details like these and then the house will be finished. At this moment she does not have the capital necessary to be able to complete the improvements.

She wishes to fit the doors and windows as she has three small grandchildren and she wants her home to be better for their health. She plans to repay the loan with the income she gets from working as a maid in a private home. Her husband, Gerardo, takes care of the family expenses with the income from his food-selling business.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Putting-in doors and windows

loans.name: Alba Lidia

texts.es:
la señora Alba Lidia I. tiene 32 años de edad, es madre de un hermoso varon de 11 años de edad, vive sola con el ya que su esposo se fue para estados unidos a trabajar, el tiene 10 años de haberse ido para ese pais en busca de una mejor oportunidad de trabajo y de un mejor porvenir para su familia.
 
Albita como es conocida en su comunidad se dedica a la confeccion de prendas de vestir desde hace 8 años, tambien hace cortinas y ropa de cama, vestidos para quinceañeras y uniformes de colegio.
 
esta solicitando el credito para la compra de una maquina sorgeteadora para mejorar las condiciones del taller y dar unos finos acabados a sus prendas que fabrica.
texts.en:
Alba Lidia I., 32, has a beautiful, 11-year-old, son. She lives alone because her husband went to the United States 10 years ago to seek work and a better future for his family. Albita, as she is affectionately known in her community, has been a seamstress for 8 years; she also makes drapes, bedding, party dresses for quinceañeras (15th birthday party for girls) and school uniforms. She is requesting funding to buy a serger (a special sewing machine to do finishes on garments) to better equip her workshop and to produce fine finishes on the garments she makes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a serger (sewing machine useful for making fine finishes)

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Luis Enrique

texts.es:
el señor Luis Enrique P. F. es soltero y tiene dos hijos, radica en el barrio Suyapa de la ciudad de Nacaome Valle.
Luis se dedica al comercio tiene una pulperia en su casa de habitacion la cual administra muy bien, tiene 1 año de tener su negocio.
esta solicitando el prestamo para surtir mas su negocio y desea que este año las ventas se mejoren. 
 
su mayor deseo es que sus hijos terminen sus estudios y sean unos buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
Luis is single and has two children. He resides in the Suyapa neighborhood of the city Nacaome Valle.

Luis runs a grocery store from his home, and he manages it very well. He has had his business for one year.

He is requesting a loan to better stock his store and he wants sales to improve this year.

His greatest wish is that his children will finish school and become good professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Hynd, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, bread, chicken, corn and wheat flour, tortillas, soft drinks, dairy products, powdered milk, toilet paper, sanitary towels, pills, candles, matches

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miskiunu-Phiry Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Miskiuno está formado por mujeres y hombres trabajadores que buscan a cada momento las oportunidades para salir adelante y con su esfuerzo diario entregar un mejor futuro a sus hijos, las socias viven la ciudad D. Phiry del distrito D. Ollantaytambo D. la provincia D. Urubamba del departamento del Cusco, urbe que se caracteriza por su clima caluroso, sus paisajes hermosos, su agricultura y su ganadería.

Florentina es socia del banco comunal Miskiuno, tiene 58 años D. edad, es casada y es madre D. cinco hijos pues dos depenD. D. ella todavía (Aled y Elvis) y su esposo trabaja como cocinero.  
Florentina se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza D. animales menores como cuyes, ella tiene actualmente 300 cuyes y los venD. a los restaurantes a costo D. 15 a 18 soles por cuy, le va bastante bien ya que sus cuyes son D. calidad en la zona y lleva dos años comercializando estos cuyes, Ya son dos años que la socia pertenece al banco comunal Miskiuno, el crédito que reciba va a mejorar el techo donD. viven los cuyes y va comprar comida para los cuyes. 

Los otros socios se dedican a la agricultura como por ejemplo: Susana, Yolanda, Eloy, Silveria y Pablo y los demás a diversas actividades como al servicio D. sastrería, a la venta D. comestibles,  artesanía, comida, verduras y pasto.

Los socios están preocupados por que las ventas han disminuido debido a la fuertes lluvias que cayeron por tres días en la ciudad del Cusco pues sus compradores trabajan directamente con el turismo, el turismo a decaído considerablemente. Otros D. los socios que tenían sus terrenos D. cultivo cerca a las orillas del rió vilcanota, el rio arraso sus productos dejando nada a su paso y dejando perdidas irrecuperables.  Los socia continuaran a pesar D. las adversidades del clima.

Los socios en general agradecen la oportunidad brindada y se comprometen a cumplir con el pago D. sus diferentes cuotas en los plazos establecidos.
texts.en:
The Miskiuno communal bank is composed of hardworking women and men who constantly look for opportunities to get ahead and who work everyday to be able to give their children a better future. The members live in the city of Phiry, in Ollantaytambo district, in Urubamba province, in the department of Cusco. The area is characterized by its warm climate, its beautiful views, and its agriculture and cattle herding. Florentina is a member of the Miskiuno communal bank. She is 58 years old, married, and the mother of five children, two of whom are still dependent on her (Aled y Elvis). Her husband works as a cook. Florentina works in agriculture and raises small animals, such as guinea pigs. She currently has 300 guinea pigs and she sells them to restaurants at a cost of 15.00 to 18.00 PEN per guinea pig. Things are going very well for her because her guinea pigs are known in the area for their quality. She has been selling them for two years. She has also belonged to the Miskiuno communal bank for two years. Her loan will be used to improve the roof where the guinea pigs live and also to buy feed for them. Some of the other members work in agriculture—for example, Susana, Yolanda, Eloy, Silveria and Pablo. The rest work in a variety of activities, such as tailoring, food sales, crafts, food, vegetables, and animal fodder. The members are worried because their sales have gone down due to the heavy rains that fell for three days in the city of Cusco. Their buyers work directly in the tourist traD. and tourism has fallen off considerably. Other members have their fields near the banks of the Vilcanota River; the river washed away their crops leaving nothing behind except unrecoverable losses. The members forge ahead despite the adversities of their climate. The members are grateful for the opportunity they have been given and they promise to make their loan payments within the established time frame.

Translated from Spanish by Jennifer Day, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Florentina needs the loan to improve the roof on the structure where her guinea pigs live and to buy food for them

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es:
la señora Maria Auxiliadora C. C. tiene 45 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos.
Maria se dedica a la venta de comida, tiene 1 año de haber iniciado su negocio en el cual vende almuerzos, desayunos y golosonas como ser burritas, tortillas con quesillo, enchiladas, papas fritas etc. 
Maria vive con sus hernmanos.
Sus ventas son diarias y le va muy bien, en estos momentos esta solicitando el credito para la compra de productos que necesita en su comedor 
 
su sueño es tener su propio local para montar un comedor grande y con mucha variedad de comidas y bebidas.
texts.en:
Maria Auxiliadora C. C., 45, is single and has no children. Maria sells prepared meals. She has been in this line of work for a year; she sells breakfasts, lunches and snacks like: burritos, quesadillas, enchiladas, fried potatoes, etc. Maria lives with her siblings. She works daily and does well. She is requesting funding to buy the ingredients she needs to prepare her meals. Her dream is to have her own site to set up a large dining room with lots of variety of dishes and beverages.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft-drinks, fruit juices, pork, beef, chicken, vegetables, tortillas, disposable plates, cheeses, butter, lard, cooking oil, rice, beans,eggs, bread, spices, fruit, sugar.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: La señora Maria Teresa L., tiene la edad de 62 años, habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, ella es una mujer muy luchadora desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a su pulpería, ya que esta inicio con sus propios esfuerzos y a la vez a  incrementado su inventario gracias al apoyo de Afodenic, atravez de los fondos Kiva, que apoyan al pequeños negocios con intereses bajos y facilidades de pagos según sus posibilidades, doña Teresa tiene tres hijos ya todos casados e independientes, la mayor dificultad que se  le presenta son alzas de la canasta básicas que poco a poco disminuye su consumo por la crisis que enfrenta el país, los planes futuros para su negocio es poder abastecer todos las necesidades de sus clientes para que compre de una solo vez todo y no vayan a otra pulpería. Agradece a la institución por la aprobación de su onceavo crédito el cual invertirá en diversos productos para el consumo del hogar.
texts.en:
Maria Teresa L., 62, lives in Ticuantepe. She is a tenacious woman who has run a grocery store for some time now. She started off by investing her own savings. With loans from Afodenic and Kiva, that support small businesses with low interest and easy payments, she has managed to increase her inventory. Teresa has three children, all of whom are married and independent. Her greatest difficulty is the rising cost of the canasta basica (basic items needed by a household for a month) which leads to people spending less and less every day due to the crisis the country is facing. Her future plans for her business is to be able to stock all that her customers need so that they can buy everything they need at the same time and not have to go to some other store. She is grateful to the institution for approving her 11th loan, which she will use to buy various products for home use.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Hilda Delia

texts.es:
la señora Hilda Delia C. Izaguirre tiene 32 años de edad, su esposo radica en los estados unidos y
tiene un hijo que depende de ella al 100%. Hilda tiene casa propia y vive con sus padres y su hija.
Su salon esta ubicado en la parte de atrás de su casa,  este negocio le es muy bueno y rentable.
Los fines de semana Hilda estudia en la universidad. 
 
Hilda esta solicitando el credito para comprar accesorios para el negocio.
 
su deseo es graduarse de la universidad lo mas pronto posible.
texts.en:
Hilda Delia C. Izaguirre is 32 years old. She has a child, who is 100% dependent on her. Her husband lives in the United States. Hilda has her own house and lives with her parents and her child. Her beauty salon is located in the rear of her house. This is a very good and profitable business. Hilda attends the university on weekends. Hilda is asking for funding to buy supplies and tools for her salon. Her desire is to graduate from the university as soon as possible.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy suppies and tools for her beauty salon.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es:
la señóra Juana F. tiene 55 años de edad, esta casada y tiene 9 hijos los cuales 3 hijos que dependen de ella y 6 que se encuentran en los ee.uu.
el esposo se dedica al corte de caña en la temporada y es agricultor.
Juana se dedica al comercio vende granos basicos y refrescos, esta solicitando el credito para comprar mas mercaderia y tener mayor inventario en su negocio.
texts.en:
Juana F., 55, is married and has 9 children, 3 of whom are still dependent on her and 6, who are in the United States. Her husband is a farmer and works as a seasonal sugar cane cutter. Juana sells basic grains and beverages. She is asking for funding to buy merchandise so that she can have a larger inventory.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Modesto

texts.es:
el señor Modesto Q. tiene 65 años de edad, tiene cuatro hijos todos grandes.
Modesto se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, tiene varios años de realizar este tipo de actividad, los pescados los vende en su comunidad y en la ciudad de Nacaome.
Modesto esta solicitando el credito para compra de pescado seco ya que se acerca la epoca de semana santa en donde este tipo de producto se vende bastante para hacer la tradicional sopa de torta de pescado.
texts.en:
Modesto Q. is 65 years old, and has 4 children, all grown up. Modesto works buying and selling fish. He has worked for years doing this activity, and sells thr fish in his community and in the city of Nacaome. Modesto is seeking a credit to buy dried fish as Easter is coming and this type of product is sold quite a lot, to make the traditional fish cake soup.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jose Leonzo

texts.es:
el señor Jose Leonzo J. P. tiene 52 años de edad, tiene 4 hijos dos viven con el y dos en los ee. uu.
Su esposa vende tortillas y el se dedica a la compra y venta de pescado, esta solicitando el credito
para compra de una res para destazo y comprar pescado seco.
se siente muy feliz ya que todo le esta saliendo bien, y ahora quiere dedicarse tambien a la venta de carne de res. 
las ganancias las necesita para el sustento de su hogar y su familia.
texts.en:
Jose Leonzo J. P. is 52 years old, and has 4 children, 2 of whom live with him and 2 in the United States. His wife sells tortillas and he works buying and selling fish. He is seeking a loan for the purchase of a cow and to buy dried fish. He feels very happy that everything is going well, and now he wants to work selling beef as well. He needs the earnings to sustain his home and family.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fish and a cow

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
la señora Alba Luz H. tiene 42 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene tres hijos dos de ellos ya estan casados.
 
Alba se dedica a la fabricacion de pan, rosquillas, quesadillas y las vende en el mercado viejo de san Lorenzo.
 
sus ventas son todos los dias, se levanta muy temprano todos los diaspara fabricar sus panes y luego los sale a vender hasta el atardecer. 
Esta solicitando un prestamo para comprar de maiz, leña, harina, aceite.
sus quesadillas y rosquillas son muy famosas por que tienen un buen sabor.
texts.en:
Alba Luz H. is 42 years old. She is a single mother and has 3 children, 2 of whom are married. Alba works making bread, rosquillas, and quesadillas and sells in the old market of San Lorenzo. She sells every day, and gets up very early every day to make bread and later leaves to sell them until the afternoon. She is seeking a loan to purchase maize, firewood, flour and oil. Her quesadillas and rosquillas are very famous because of their flavour.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase maize, firewood, flour and oil

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Greysy Mayela

texts.es:
la joven Greysy Mayela V. tiene de 22 años de edad,  es madre soltera y tiene un hijo de 2 años.
Greysy es graduada del colegio. Se ha dedicado desde hace 5 años a la elaboracion y venta de tortillas.
greysy vive con sus padres y su hijo.

Greysy quiere superarse y salir adelante con su hijo.
esta solicitando un prestamo para comprar maiz, leña, cal, fosforos.
su meta es seguir estudiando y graduarse de la universidad y asi poder darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo que es lo que mas quiere en este mundo.
texts.en:
This young lady Greysy Mayela V. is 22 years old. She is a single mother and has a 2-year old son. Greysy is a school graduate, and has worked for 5 years making and selling tortillas. Greysy lives with her parents and son and wants to move forward with him. She is seeking a loan to purchase maize, firewood, lime and phosphorous. Her goal is to continue studying and graduate from university, to be able to give a better quality of life to her son, which is what she wants most in the world.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase maize, firewood, lime, and phosphorous.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Lesbia Lizeth

texts.es:
la joven Lesbia Lizeth Z. D. tiene 31 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos, vive con su abuela.
lesbia se dedica a la elaboracion de pan, quesadillas, hojaldras, rosquillas, tiene varios años de realizar este tipo de actividad. Su madre le enseño el oficio con el cual a podido salir adelante en estos años. 
 
Su producto lo fabrica en su casa y lo vende en el mercado viejo de san lorenzo y tambien les vende a los empleados de la camaronera,  sus ventas son diarias.
 
esta solicitando el credito para compra de maiz, leña para almacenar para la epoca de lluvia 
ya que la leña se escasea para esa epoca.
texts.en:
The young woman Lesbia Lizeth Z. D. is 31 years old, single with no children and lives with her grandmother. Lesbia makes a living making bread, quesadillas, puff pastries, and doughnuts. She has been working at this for several years. Her mother taught her the trade, which has allowed her to get ahead throughout these years. She makes her products in her home and sells them at the old market in San Lorenzo and to the employees of the shrimp farm. She sells her products daily. She is requesting this loan to purchase corn and firewood to store for the rainy season. Firewood is very scarce during that period.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Bobbit, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase flour, oil, butter margarine cheese and firewood.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en:
Ilham N. has been able to support his family in an honorable way by selling different kinds of foodstuffs in his grocery store. He is married with four children.

In order to improve the quality and quantity of his products, he wants to buy more foodstuffs and for this purpose he needs a loan of 1,600 AZN. Ilham has put a lot of effort into developing his business; he would like to keep growing as a micro-entrepreneur, and with your help this could be possible.

Ilham and his family are sincerely grateful for your generosity and support.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to sell

loans.name: Rasim

texts.en:
Rasim H. is married with three children and he has always been a hard-working man who has made sure, from a young age, that his family never goes without their daily bread.

Rasim has a grocery store where he sells different kinds of foodstuffs. With a small starting capital, thanks to his perseverance and dedication, he began this enterprise eleven years ago. Over time he expanded his business and today his business has become domestic as his family is also engaged in it.

Today, Rasim needs to buy additional foodstuffs to increase the range of his goods. For this purpose he is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur.

We believe Rasim’s perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to increase his range of goods

loans.name: Anar

texts.en:
Anar A. is 30 years old and is single. He lives with his parents and supports them financially.

Anar is a small-business entrepreneur who sells fruits and vegetables which he buys from the local farmers. His dream is to get married in the next several years and for this purpose he works very hard to earn more profit.

Anar is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more seasonal goods to sell

loans.name: Sayavush

texts.en:
Sayavush Q. is 43 years old and is married with two children. He is a small entrepreneur who sells different kinds of goods like cookies, candies, soft drinks, juices, macaroni, detergents and many other items in his grocery store which he built five years ago. Today he is requesting a loan of 1,600 AZN to increase his stock. 

Sayavush is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices, and push every once in a while to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. One of his dreams is that his children progress by means of their studies, for which he is doing his best. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key success factors in his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase his stock

loans.name: Mais

texts.en:
Mais I. is a businessman from Agsu city where he lives with his wife and two children. He sells flour, cookies, soft drinks and some seasonal vegetables in the market.

Mais does a good business because he keeps his merchandise well stocked and makes sure it is good quality. Presently, he is making about $300 each month. Mais is very honest and polite with both his suppliers and his customers. It has helped him to gain a reputation as a trustworthy and friendly vendor and to build a solid client base.

Mais is applying for a loan of 1,600 AZN to restock his merchandise and hopefully generate additional profit. He is sincerely appreciative of your support!

loans.use: To restock his merchandise

loans.name: Zahid

texts.en:
Zahid R. is a 46-year-old entrepreneur who runs his own car washing service. He has nine years of experience in this field and two years ago he was able to build his own car wash, thanks to his hard work and long years of experience in this field.

Zahid is married and has three children who are the meaning of his life. Now Zahid would like to expand his business and purchase new and modern car-washing tools. For this purpose he applied for 160 AZN. Be an important part of Zahid`s business.

loans.use: To purchase new and modern car-washing tools

loans.name: Ramil

texts.en:
Ramil A. is a 39-year-old man who sells vegetables in the central market in Agsu city. Ramil started his small convenience store when he was unemployed more than fifteen years ago. His biggest dream is to have a general store where he can sell other items besides vegetables and fruit.

With the loan, Ramil expects to keep growing his business little by little and, with the earnings, he'll keep improving his quality of life and economic situation along with his business until he achieves his goal.

Ramil’s wish is that one day he will build his own family together with his prosperous businesses.

loans.use: To purchase more vegetables and fruit to sell

loans.name: Hafiz

texts.en: Hafiz A., 55 years old and married with four children, sells flour wholesale as well as retail. In this business for more than 20 years, Hafiz is able to support his family from the generated income. Today he is requesting a loan of 1600 AZN to purchase more flour to enlarge his range of goods. Hafiz thanks everybody for their support and promises to repay the loan on time.

loans.use: To purchase more goods to increase profit

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif F. has always distinguished himself as a very hard-working person who is devoted to his wife and three children. Vasif manages his own grocery store, a business he started eight years ago when he found himself needing his own way to support his family.

Thanks to his business, Vasif has been able to help his family, and today he requests a loan of 1600 AZN. He needs you, and through your generosity you can help him expand his business so that he may continue to support his children's education. Please help them by becoming part of the development of his small business.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Islam

texts.en:
Islam Q. is a hard-working man. He actively contributes to the well-being of his family by selling different kinds of food, such as cookies, candies, and beverages, in his own grocery store. He has seven years of experience in this field. Islam works from 6:00 a.m. until late at night for his family, and especially for his adorable daughter. 

Islam realizes that, with the excellent quality and customer service he gives, he can expand his business, so he is requesting 1600 AZN. Islam is counting on your help and thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To purchase more merchandise to sell

loans.name: Nan

texts.en:
Mrs. Nan S., age 50, and her husband, Mr. Pheap Phoung, age 51, live in a small village along National Road Number Five about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1979 and have five children, one of whom is a truck driver, one is a construction worker, and another two are in school.
 
Mrs. Nan S. has been a farmer for twenty years, growing rice and lotus. Her husband has been working for the council of the commune office for two years. When he is free, he also assists his wife with her farming business.

Nan is requesting her first loan of $500 to purchase a water pump and to buy fertilizer and pesticide to use on her farm.

loans.use: To purchase a water pump, fertilizer and pesticide for her farm

loans.name: Phalleap

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalleap S., 31 and her husband, Mr. Thy Sun, 36, (pictured together) live in the Muk Kampoul District of Koh Dach, a famous island located thirty kilometers along the Mekong River roughly fifteen kilometers northeast of Phnom Penh. Koh Dach has been nicknamed Silk Island because of the many villagers there who weave silk on traditional looms. There are also many fishing villages on the island which is how Phalleap S. and Thy Sun earn a portion on their income.

The couple has two girls ages 12 and 15 attending grade eight and grade five respectively. In addition to selling fish they also produce alcohol from rice in their yard. Now, they are now looking to expand their reach into a third business, raising pigs! It is common for people here to run several businesses at one time in order to survive when one business has a bad month.

Phalleap will use her Kiva loan to build a pigpen next to the alcohol/rice production facility in their yard. She will also use the money to buy several piglets to raise. In the future the couple would like their businesses to continue to grow.

loans.use: To construct a pig pen and buy piglets

loans.name: Hangry

texts.en:
Mr. Hangry T., 28, shown in the photograph with his wife and son, lives with his widowed mother in a small village on National Road Number Two about twenty kilometers south of Phnom Penh City.

Hangry has been driving a motorcycle taxi since 2006. He drives from his village to Takhmao market and back which is about four kilometers from his village.

Under his wooden house is an open-air space where it’s difficult for Hangrey to keep out the elements, especially regarding his motorbike. Therefore, he is requesting a loan of US$300 to build a concrete room under his wooden house.

loans.use: To build a concrete room under his wooden house

loans.name: Naro

texts.en:
Mr. Naro O., 27 and his wife, Mrs. Thida Nuy, 22, (pictured together) have been married since 2006 and just have a young son. They are living in a PhnO. Penh suburb.

Naro has been working in a hotel in PhnO. Penh since 2008 while his wife works alongside him. The couple wants to buy a motorcycle for commuting to work but they do not have money. So, Naro is requesting his first loan of $1,000 in order to make the purchase.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike for commuting

loans.name: Bunthoeun

texts.en:
Mr. Bunthoeun T., 29, and his wife, Mrs. Sokny Mot (pictured together), 28, live in a small village across the Mekong River about 17 kilometers from Phnom Penh. They have been married since 2001 and just have one young son who is attending grade two. 

Bunthoeun has been a construction worker for five years in his village. Mrs. Sokny Mot has been a silk weaver for 10 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who then takes them to sell in Phnom Penh. The house where they live has fallen down in some areas and it's difficult for them to live. Hence, Bunthoeun is requesting his first loan of $800 to repair his house.

loans.use: To repair the house where he lives.

loans.name: Chanthol

texts.en:
Mrs. Chanthol S. is 42 years old and her husband, Mr. Ty Bouy, is 50 years old. They are both in the photo. They have been married since 1983 and have eight children: five sons and three daughters. Two of their children are drivers, two others work in the garment factory and three attend school. The family lives along National Road Number Six about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.


Chanthol and her husband have been farming for 27 years. They grow vegetables on their farmland. They hope to expand their productivity, so Chanthol is asking for her first loan of US$300 to purchase seed, fertilizer and pesticide to maintain her vegetable farm.

loans.use: To use for farming.

loans.name: Klo

texts.en:
Mr. Klo H. is 40 years old and his wife, Mrs. Nhoek Kimsri, is 34 years old. They live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They have been married since 1995 and have three sons. Two of their sons attend school and the other one is still young. Klo is not in the photo; his wife is pictured instead.  

Klo has been driving a taxi for over one year. He drives passengers everywhere around Phnom Penh, and sometimes to the beach town of Sihanoukville. Mrs. Nhoek Kimsri has been selling mangoes for 15 years. She buys them under contract from the villagers for resale in Phnom Penh market.  

By the way, Klo’s taxi is old and does not work well. It cost him a lot of money to make repairs. He could not manage his income to support his family. Therefore, Klo is requesting his first loan of $1,000 to add to his own money to purchase a new taxi. He also will use a part of his loan to provide capital to his wife for her business.

loans.use: To buy a new taxi.

loans.name: Ra

texts.en:
Mr. Ra M. (pictured with his son) is 27 years old and lives with his widowed father, sister and brothers in the Muk Kampoul District of Koh Dach. This is a famous island located 30 kilometers along the Mekong River, roughly 15 kms northeast of Phnom Penh City.

Ra has been a security guard for a year. He does not have his own transportation and spends a lot of money on traveling costs. Ra is, therefore, asking for a loan of $300 to purchase a motorcycle for commuting to work.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting to work.

loans.name: Phalla

texts.en:
Mrs. Phalla C., 46, and her husband, Mr. Sivuth Vann, 48, live on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1987 and have three sons, one of whom has full-time employment and the others are in school.

Phalla has been a silk weaver for twenty years, a skill she learned from her mother. Her husband has been a wooden house builder for twenty years as well. Phalla wants to supplement her income with a new business raising cows so that she will be able to earn extra income from selling the cows when they grow big enough.

Hence Phalla is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to purchase calves to raise. She will also use a part of her loan to buy a motorcycle for family commuting.

loans.use: To purchase calves to raise and a motorbike for family commuting

loans.name: Dasak

texts.en:
Mrs. Dasak S., 27, and her husband, Mr. Sophak Horng, 30, have been married since 2007 and have two children: one son and one daughter, both of them still young. The family lives on an island in the Mekong River about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. Her husband has had full-time employment in Phnom Penh for ten years.

Dasak has just started a business selling rice. She does not have enough capital to purchase more rice for resale, so she is requesting her first loan of $1,000 to add to her capital. On the other hand, a part of her house needs repair so it’s difficult for her family to live in it. So she will also use a part of her loan to make house repairs.

loans.use: To purchase more rice to sell and to repair her house

loans.name: Kimsour

texts.en:
Miss Kimsour K. (shown in the photo) is 34 and single. She lives with her widowed mother and sister on an island in the Mekong River about 15kms from Phnom Penh.

Kimsour has been a silk weaver for almost 20 years. She sells her finished products to a middleman who sells them in Phnom Penh market. The house where she lives needs some repairs.  It is difficult for her family to live there. 

Kimsour is, therefore, applying for a loan of 1,000USD to repair her house.

loans.use: To repair her house

loans.name: Pisey

texts.en:
Mrs. Pisey S. (pictured here), 24, and her husband, Mr. Chanthorn Phon, 28, married in 2003. They have two young daughters. They are living on an island of Mekong River roughly 15kms northeast of Phnom Penh City.

Pisey has been a silk weaver since she was 14. Also, she buys finished silk fabric from people in her village which she resells to a middleman. He then sells it in Phnom Penh market. Her husband has had a full-time job in Phnom Penh for 3 years. 

Pisey is applying for a loan of 800USD to purchase silk materials for her weaving business and to buy finished silk fabric for resale.

loans.use: To purchase silk materials and finished silk fabric for resale

loans.name: Ny

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny K., 40 and her husband, Mr. Sophorn Un, 36, live along national road number one about eighteen kilometers from Phnom Penh. They were married in 1994 and have two daughters. Both of them are in school.  

Ny is a garment factory worker, while her husband is a mason. He does his work in the village and a near by province. Ny is requesting a loan in the amount of $800 to purchase additional construction material for her husband to continue his business.

loans.use: To purchase additional construction materials for her husband to continue his business.

loans.name: Byona Biyinzika Group, Kampala

texts.en:
K. Margaret is the leader of her lending group in Kampala. She is a hard-working woman with several businesses. 

She has a hardware shop, she makes pancakes and she also makes banana juice for sale in Kampala central. She decided to work in all these businesses because she has always wanted to provide the best for herself and her family. She is surely doing that. 

She is grateful that she has been able to educate her children using the proceeds from her growing businesses. Margaret needs a loan to help boost all her businesses and increase profits.

loans.use: to buy hardware materials and bananas for making juice for sale.

loans.name: Chay

texts.en:
Mr. Chay C., 49, and his wife Mrs. Chanthy Hong, 36, live along National Road No.1, about 35kms from Phnom Penh. They are pictured together. They were married in 1993 and have five daughters. One is married and does not live in the family home; three attend school and the other one is still young.  

Chay and his wife have been farming for 17 years. They grow rice and vegetables on their farmland in the village. Some parts of his house are in need of repair and it is difficult for his family to live there. Therefore, he is applying for his first loan of 800USD to repair his house and also to purchase a water pump for his rice and vegetable farm.

loans.use: To repair his house and purchase a water pump for his rice and vegetable farm.

loans.name: Julieta's Group

texts.en:
Julieta A. is from the village of Antagan 2nd. She is 44 years old. Julieta is the group leader of a 7-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Julieta A..

Julieta is married and has 3 adult children. Julieta owns & operates a specialized retail store where she sells personal products such as glasses and watches. Julieta has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Julieta joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Julieta has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to buy new stock to expand her inventory. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Julieta from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Imelda's Group

texts.en:
Imelda C. is from the village of Villaluz. She is 44 years old. Imelda is the group leader of an 8-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Imelda C..

Imelda is married and has 2 school-aged children. Imelda owns & operates a general store where she sells a variety of different products. Imelda has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 4,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Imelda is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Imelda from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Channat

texts.en:
Mrs. Channat B., 43, is a widow with two sons, one of whom has full-time employment and the other one attends school. She lives in a small village along National Road Number One about fifteen kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

Channat has been selling groceries since 2001. She buys them from Phnom Penh market for resale in her village. She wants to expand her business so she is asking for her first loan of $1,000 to purchase additional grocery items to sell.

loans.use: To purchase additional grocery items to sell

loans.name: Merlyn

texts.en:
Merlyn M. is from the village of Pigsag-an Cagayan de Oro City. She is 54 years old. Merlyn is married and has four adult children. To make a living, Merlyn owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Merlyn has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Merlyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Merlyn has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Merlyn is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Merlyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Pigsag-an, Cagayan De Oro City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Siphal

texts.en:
Mrs. Siphal H. (pictured here), 26, and her husband, Mr. Sokha Khoem, 38, were married in 2005 and have two young sons. She lives with her parents along national road number one about 18 kilometers from Phnom Penh. 

Siphal has been a garment factory worker for six months, while her husband is a policeman. She wants to build a kitchen because she does not have a proper place to cook and it’s difficult for her. Therefore, Siphal is requesting her first loan in the amount of $800 to use for that purpose.

loans.use: To build a kitchen.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock her retail shop with more goods

loans.name: Victoria Group 2, Lugazi

texts.en:
F. Ayubu is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is 35 years old and married with six children aged 12 to 2 years. He also takes care of three dependents, two of them orphans.

Ayubu operates a ferry service from Buvuma to Kiyindi, mostly operating from Kilongo landing site. He has transported traders for eleven years and he is able to make 70,000/= as profits every week. He says that this profit margin would have been higher only there is a ferry that offers free transport to traders and his only chance is that it is slow and takes a long time to fill.

Ayubu would like to expand his business. He already has four fishing boats and he would like to use his loan to buy fishing nets and hooks and employ three people on each boat for increased earnings.

Ayubu is such a friendly and hardworking man.

loans.use: To buy fishing nets and hooks for his four boats

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en: Vivian A. is currently in the business of selling chairs at the market and is requesting a loan to purchase more chairs and tables to sell. Vivian is 40 years old and is married to a teacher. She has six children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to open a wholesale shop. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs and tables to sell

loans.name: Dallal

texts.en:
Dallal is a 48-year-old married woman with three unemployed children. She has helped her husband in the household by working as a hairdresser for the past ten years. She receives clients at her house and also works upon request by visiting her clients at their houses.

Dallal is thankful for her work; it allows her to alleviate her hard living situation. Today, she is requesting $1,200 to buy beauty products such as hair accessories, hair colors, and make up needed to satisfy the needs of her clientele.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: A. Solange est née le 21 Juin 1968 à Zangnanado au Bénin. Mariée à AYIKPANDO Marcelin, un rebobineur, Solange est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Solange vit depuis une quinzaine d'année au quartier Womey dans la commune de d'Abomey Calavi. Elle y vit avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Solange n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour assurer ses différents besoins et ceux de ses enfants, Solange vend de liqueurs (alcool)et parallèlement à cette activité, elle vend également du maïs à son domicile. C'est à Agonlin et à Adja au Mono, que Solange se ravitaille. Solange a bénéficié antérieurement d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qu'elle a bien remboursé. Solange voudrait augmenter le stock de ses produits et gagner une grande part de marché. Mais Solange ne dispose pas assez de moyens financiers pour y arriver. C'est la raison pour laquelle Solange sollicite un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé, ce qui lui permettra de rehausser son activité.
texts.en:
Solange A. was born on June 21, 1968, in Zangnanado, Benin. She's married to Marcelin AYIKPANDO, an electric technician, and she's the mother of three school-attending children. For approximately fifteen years, Solange has been living in the Womey neighborhood in the city of Abomey Calavi. She lives there with her family. The couple supports the family expenses together. Solange only attended primary school. To provide for herself and her children, she sells liquor (alcohol), and she also sells corn at home. She gets her supplies in Agonlin and Adja in Mono Department. Previously, Solange benefited from a loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, and repaid it without problems. She would like to increase her stock of products and gain a large market share. But she lacks financial means to do so. This is why Solange is seeking a second loan from ALIDé, which will enable her to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 10 cans of liquor and 2 sacks of corn

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en: Tereza H. is currently in the business of selling beer and local alcohol at her bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell. Tereza is 29 years old and is married to a businessman. She has three children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a hotel (restaurant). About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To restock his retail shop and pay his children's school fees

loans.name: Falateza

texts.en: Falateza V. is currently in the business of selling cooked food in her hotel (restaurant) and is requesting a loan to stock soft drinks like sodas, boxed juice, water, etc., to sell. Falateza is 32 years old and is married to a soldier. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children. About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To buy a stock soft drinks to sell

loans.name: Paula

texts.fr: Née en 1973 à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin, G. Paula est mariée à GANDAHO Didier, un hotelier. Le couple a cinq enfants à charge, dont trois représentent leurs propres enfants. Tous les enfants sont scolarisés. C'est depuis 12 ans environs que Paula vit au quartier Womey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi, avec sa famille. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la famille. Paula a fréquenté l'école jusqu'au secondaire. Mais depuis près de 8 ans, Paula mène comme activité, la vente de charbon de bois et de bois de chauffage à son domicile. Cette activité lui génère des revenus qu'elle utilise pour assurer les besoins de ses enfants et se prendre également en charge. Parallèlement à cette activité, Paula vend également de façon secondaire, des produits vivriers (maïs et mil) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Paula a bénéficié entre temps, d'un prêt auprès de ALIDé, prêt qui a été bien remboursé. Paula ambitionne élever le niveau de son activité et devenir une grande distributrice de sacs de charbon de bois dans la ville. Pour y arriver, Paula sollicite un deuxième prêt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Born in 1973 in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin, Paula G. is married to Didier GANDAHO, a hotel manager. The couple has five children to support, out of whom three are their own. All children attend school. For approximately twelve years, Paula has been living with her family in the Womey neighborhood in the city of Abomey Calavi. The couple supports the family expenses together. Paula attended school up to secondary level. For approximately eight years, Paula has been selling charcoal and firewood at her home. She uses the income drawn from this business to provide for her children and herself. Besides this, she also runs a secondary business selling food products (corn and millet) in her shop located at her home. In the meantime, Paula benefited from one loan from Kiva's partner, ALIDé, which she repaid without problems. She ambitions to take her business to a higher level and become a large supplier of charcoal sacks in her town. To reach this goal, Paula is seeking a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 20 sacks of charcoal and 2 sacks of corn

loans.name: Nour

texts.en:
Nour is a 25-year-old married woman who has been working as a hairdresser in a salon for the past five years.

In 2008, after having her first child, Nour started working as a home-based hairdresser to support her husband with the family income. The income from her work helps in satisfying her baby’s needs.

Today, Nour is requesting $1,000 to buy additionA. hairdressing tools and supplies because she's planning to expand her business in the coming months and make it better to earn more income for her family.

loans.use: To buy additional hairdressing tools and supplies

loans.name: Cecelia

texts.en: Cecelia J. is currently in the business of selling beer in her bar and is requesting a loan to stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell. Cecelia is 35 years old and is widowed with four children who all go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to educate her children and build a hotel (restaurant). About BRAC BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To stock more crates of beer and sodas to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy hair extensions

loans.name: Neamat

texts.en: Neamat is a 48-year-old single woman living with her parents and 3 siblings. She has been working as a tailor since 1999. During this time she has become well known in her town and its surroundings. She helps to earn income for her family. Today, Neamat is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy a new sewing machine to be able to make a variety of products for her clients.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Victoria Group 4, Lugazi

texts.en:
B. Patrick is the leader of his lending group in Lugazi. He is a 36-year-old businessman who buys fish for resale to his customers in Lugazi and Mukono. From his sales, he is able to make over 300,000/- as profits a month.

Patrick works so hard for his business to increase as he hopes to become the biggest supplier of fish around the region and his determination and hard work, in addition to the loans for increased capital, will take him there. He needs a loan to be able to buy more fish for resale.

(One of the ladies squatting in a black sharia with a yellow and white robe appears in another subgroup since in this photo, her face is not very clear.)

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Victoria Group 5, Lugazi

texts.en:
N. Flista is the leader of her lending group in Lugazi. She is a widow with eleven children and ten dependents.

Flista has a business selling matooke (green plantain) in Kiyindi. She says that her challenge is that at times the matooke is too expensive hence reducing the number of customers, leading to some of her food ripening.

Flista has been in the business for seventeen years and she has been able to introduce the sale of charcoal to her business, hence increasing her income. She hopes to expand her business further as well as educating all her children.

Flista needs a loan to help with purchasing more matooke and charcoal for business sustainability.

loans.use: To buy more matooke and charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en: Lorna G. is from the village of Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro City. She is 36 years old, is married, and has three school-aged children. Lorna owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products including fish and shrimp in the local community. Lorna has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month. In 2008, Lorna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lorna is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP which will be used to invest in expanding her business. This loan will be her 4th from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding her business

location.town: Tumpagon, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Al Amir Abdel Fatah

texts.en:
Al Amir Abdel Fatah is a 43-year-old married man with two young children. He has owned a computer shop since 2008 with a previous seven years of experience in this field. He is the only provider of his family with this business.

Al Amir Abdel Fatah sells and repairs computers in addition of buying mobile phones and rechargeable cards to make a good income. Today, he is requesting $1,200 to buy computers and phones needed to fill his shop and attract more clients.

loans.use: To buy more computers and phones

loans.name: Khamro

texts.ru: Абдулхамидов Хамро проживает в районе Шахритуз. Возраст, 67 лет. Женат, имеет 6 детей. Хамро более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Он выращивает пшеницу и вывозит на рынок. Этот бизнес ему приносит хороший доход. Жена и дети ему помогают в этой деятельности. Кредит просит для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений. Хамро хочет расширить свой бизнес. Он намерен посадить фруктовые деревья.
texts.en:
A. Khamro lives in the Shahrituz region. He’s sixty-seven years old, married and has six children. For more than six years Khamro has been a farmer, growing wheat, which he sells at the market. This business, in which his wife and children assist him, is very profitable for him. He’s requesting a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer. Khamro wants to expand his business and plant some fruit trees.

Translated from Russian by Alex Kostrubsky, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Bernadette Baï

texts.fr: S. Bernadette Baï est née le 11 Juillet 1970 à Abomey, ville historique du Bénin. Il a environs 16 ans que Bernadette Baï s'est installée au quartier Womey, dans la commune d'Abomey Calavi. Mariée à GBOCOGO Claude, un agent de la COGESSA au Bénin, Bernadette Baï est mère de trois enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Bernadette Baï vit seule avec ses enfants et assure seule leurs charges. Bernadette Baï n'a fréquenté que l'école primaire. Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de ses enfants, Bernadette Baï mène comme activité, la vente de condiments (oignons, piments, tomates fraîches, épices : poivre, ails, etc.) dans sa boutique size à son domicile. Bernadette Baï vend également divers produits (oeufs, poissons fumés, etc.). Bernadette Baï s'approvisionne à Glazoué et au marché Djoda au Bénin. C'est depuis 12 ans que Bernadette Baï mène cette activité. Bernadette Baï a déjà bénéficié d'un crédit auprès de ALIDé, crédit qui a été bien remboursé. Bernadette Baï voudrait agrandir son activité et ouvrir une seconde boutique dans le marché de son quartier, afin d'accroître son revenu et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle. C'est ce qui amène Bernadette Baï à solliciter un deuxième prèt auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Bernadette Baï S. was born on July 11, 1970 in Abomey, historical town of Benin. About 16 years ago, Bernadette Bai settled in the neighborhood of Womey, in the town of Abomey Calavi. She is married to Claude Gbocogo, an agent of COGESSA in Benin. Bernadette Bai is the mother of three children, all attending school. She lives alone with her children and she alone supports them. She only attended primary school. To meet her needs and those of her children, Bernadette Bai sells condiments (onions, hot peppers, fresh tomatoes, spices: pepper, garlic etc…) in her store located in her home. She also sells various products (eggs, smoke fish etc…). She gets her supplies in Glazoue and at the Djoda market in Benin. She has been practicing this activity for 12 years. Bernadette Bai has already received a loan from ALIDé, the loan was reimbursed fully. She would like to expand her activity and open a second store in her neighborhood’s market place, in order to increase her income and to better meet the needs of her customers. This brings Bernadette Bai to request a second loan from ALIDé.

Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of 3 baskets of fresh tomatoes, 2 baskets of hot peppers and vegetables, fish.

loans.name: Ihab

texts.en:
Ihab is a 20-year-old single man who has been working as a car repairman for the past eight years after stopping his education.

In 2008, Ihab opened his own car repair shop to earn income to help satisfy his life needs and to support his family. He is planning to expand his business and make it better to attract more clients. To do so, he is requesting $1,200 to increase his inventory and to buy more tools needed for his business.

loans.use: To increase his inventory and to buy more tools needed

loans.name: Edna's Group

texts.en:
Edna B. is from the village of Calamagui. She is 54 years old. Edna is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Edna B..

Edna is married and has five adult-aged children. To make a living, Edna owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Edna has been engaged in her business for over fifteen years and earns approximately $130 a month from this activity.

In 2007, Edna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation by engaging in business activities. Edna has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Edna is requesting a new loan of 13,000 PHP which also will be used to purchase additional products. This will be her 7th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to further improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Omar

texts.en: Omar has owned a poultry shop in his town since 2008 and has five years of experience in this occupation. He's 20 years old and engaged. He works hard to make a good income and to be able to finalize the preparation of his house and the marriage. His shop is well known in the whole region, and he distributes chicken to the nearby restaurants. Today, Omar is asking to borrow $1,200 to buy additional chickens to expand his sales and therefore his income.

loans.use: to buy additional chickens
