texts.en:
The 2 de Junio committee was formed 2 years ago thanks to the interest of various women who are residents of Villa San Miguel, of Thompson. They did it and they were able to last over time. Through much sacrifice they have been able to overcome diverse situations. They are very united, They meet every Sunday at the home of the general coordinator who is Perla R.. The loan they are getting will be used for improvements in the activities that each of the members of the committee in general does in the purchase of articles which will be sold in their respective commercial activities. Such as Ms. Perla who has a small store where she sells everything for a family's basic food basket such as sugar, pasta, rice and more. She runs her business with the help of her children in their free time, since they are all students. They attend to customers in the store. The activities of the other members are as follows: 1 Perla R. Store 2 Josefina P. Garbage collection service 3 Elvira C. Beverage sales 4 Elizabeth Gonzalez Store 5 Lida L. Food sales 6 Teresa C. Cosmetic sales 7 Sonia P. Cosmetic sales 8 Magdalena Servin Clothing sales 9 Mirtha C. Selling games of chance 10 Viviana A. Clothing sales 11 Felipa Gonzalez Food sales 12 Gladis E. Clothing sales 13 Haydee C. Clothing sales 14 Dayana L. Selling artisanal slippers 15 Claudia V. Food sales 16 Cynthia Gonzalez Clothing sales 17 Ramona G. Selling costume jewelry

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of sugar, rice, herbs, drinks, and other products for the basic food basket.

loans.name: Apoowegi Akidi Christine Group

texts.en: A. Christine is a business woman of thirty-two years, married with three children in schooling. She also has 7 other dependents, 2 of which are still in schooling. She has sold smoked fish for the past 5 years. She is using the loan to purchase fish and sell to her customers. The loan is adding capital into her business improving stock. She is a hardworking business woman whose dreams are to educate her children and build a better house.

loans.use: To purchase fish and sell to her customers.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 35-year-old married man and father of 3 young children. He has been working in construction since 1997 and specialized in decorating houses with a special construction stones. He's well known by the customers and the entrepreneurs due his long experience in this field. Today, Mohamad is requesting to borrow $1,200 to renew his business tools because he has a big project in the coming months and he has to be ready for it.

loans.use: renew his business tools

loans.name: Khalid

texts.en:
Khaled owns an aluminum manufacturing workshop where he produces doors, windows, and other aluminium products. He has been running the workshop, with the help of his brothers, for eight years.

Khaled is a young man from the Aida Refugee Camp in Bethlehem in the southern part of Palestine. He is one of seven brothers who work together to support the family.

Khaled is taking a loan from FATEN to expand his business and bring more customers to the workshop. He will use the loan funds to purchase more raw aluminium and a device to manufacture aluminum products. His workshop is one of the successful ones, as well as being the only source of income for the entire family, beside the simple salaries of his brothers.

The sustainability of the business will help Khaled getting married and continue supporting his family.

loans.use: To buy a device for manufacturing aluminum products

loans.name: Shola

texts.en: Shola sells second hand clothes and bags at retail prices to her customers in her house. She lives in Lagos state. She has been in this business for a long time. She has 2 children. Her eldest child is 6 years old. She is 36 years old. Her husband is a police officer and he also supports the home. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 70,000 to purchase more second-hand bags and clothes to sell. She is indeed grateful to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more second hand bags and clothes to sell

loans.name: Beloclaide Enoque

texts.pt:
Beloclaide Enoque Macie B. nasceu em gaza tem 31 anos de idade estudou ate 10ª classe é solteiro pai de 1 filho de 2 anos. Responsabiliza se pela sua tia enviando lhe 500.00MT em cada três meses e consegue mensalmente poupar 1.000.00MT.


Quando sai de Gaza com seus pais para Vila de Namaacha na Fronteira de Suazilândia, inicia os estudos e faz a 10ª classse, mas teve que interromper quando engravida a sua namorada. Assim seu pai da lhe um fundo para iniciar o negócio de criação de frangos para conseguir sustentar a sua família. Anos depois arranja um emprego na segurança privada, é funcionário permanente a mais de seis anos trabalha em turnos auferindo 2.600 mensalmente.  Aproxima se a hluvuku primeiramente solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 8.000.00MT e agora pede estes 15.000.00MT para reforçar o negocio de criação de frangos aumentando assim a renda familiar. Tem metido em média de 3caixasx100pintos em cada fase (15 em15 dias), pois ele tem vendido alternadamente para não perder a clientela. Gastando em cada fase um valor de 21.000.00MT obtendo de lucro um valor de 8.000.00MT quando vende a grosso para revendedores, e de 7.000.00MT quando vende por unidade a consumidores locais.



Este é o segundo empréstimo de Beloclaide na Hluvuku e Kiva o primeiro de 8.000.00MT foi usado para aumentar o volume de criação, este segundo de 15.000.00MT será para o mesmo fim. Já teve empréstimo no Banco Novo no valor de 4.000.00MT pagou com muito sucesso, esta confiante que vai reembolsar antes do tempo previsto e pedir outro empréstimo para construção de dependências para aluguer uma vez que este serviço é muito solicitado pelos alunos e trabalhadores que vem de outros distritos.
texts.en:
Beloclaide Enoque Macie B. was born in Gaza, Mozambique. He is 31 years old and the father of a two year-old boy. After sending 500.00 MT to an aunt whom he helps support, Beloclaide is able to save 1.000.00MT per month. When Beloclaide was very young, his family moved from Gaza to Namaacha, on the border of Swaziland. He had to interrupt his studies in 10th Grade, when his girlfriend got pregant. In order to help him find a way to support his new family, his father gave him money to start a poultry business. For the last six years, in addition to running his poultry business he's also been working as a security guard, with a monthly salary of 2.600 MT. Beloclaide sells an average of 3 boxes of 100 chicks every 15 days, both wholesale and retail so as not to lose his clientele. Spending 21,000 MT in each phase, he earns 8,000 MT in profit when selling wholesale, and 7,000 MT when selling retail to local consumers. This is his second loan with Hluvuku, and he will use to buy more baby chicks to raise, like he did with the first 8,000.00MT loan. He's had a loan with Banco Novo before, in the amount of 4.000.00MT, which he was able to pay back successfully. He's confident he'll repay his Hluvuku loan before it's due, so he can apply for new ones to build some rental properties, since boarding is always in demand by students and workers who come to Swaziland from other regions.

Translated from Portuguese by Aline Pereira, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more baby chicks to raise

loans.name: Tecla

texts.es: La señora Tecla P. tiene 69 años ,tiene 5 hijos todos mayores  de edad ,ella tiene una despensa  que heredo de familia por lo que ya tienen una buena clientela formada en el barrio en donde vive ,ella se levanta muy temprano para ir a  surtirse  del mercado de abasto en  donde realiza sus compras  ,Tecla   necesita  de este crédito para la compra de mercaderías en cantidad y asi lograr a mejor precio  .En el futuro desea comprar un vehículo para realizar mejor su trabajo.
texts.en:
Tecla is 69 years old and has five adult children. She has a pantry store that she inherited from her family and she has a good customer base in her neighborhood. She gets up very early to go to the marketplace where she buys her stock. Tecla needs this loan to buy merchandise in large quantities so that she can negotiate better prices. In the future she wants to buy a vehicle so that she can do her work better.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy groceries for resale

loans.name: Youness

texts.en: Youness has been the owner of a shoe store in his town since 2000. He’s 46 years old, married and has three unemployed children. His shop is situated in a busy area so, over the years, he has had a growing number of clients pass by his shop and buy shoes. He's always trying to fill his shop with the latest collections to attract more clients. Today, Youness is asking to borrow $1,000 to add new decor and renovate his shop in order to attract more clients and increase his income.

loans.use: To add new decor and renovate his shop

loans.name: Ricardo Uaquene

texts.pt:
Ricardo Uaquene H. nasceu em Inhambane tem 58 anos de idade é casada pai de 6 filhos com idades compreendidas entre os entre os 14 aos 30 anos de idade todos vão a escola. Para alem dos seus filhos responsabiliza se pelos seus pais que vivem em inhambane enviando lhes 1.500.00mt em cada 3 meses e consegue poupar por mes 1.000.00mt.

Ricardo sai de inhambane para vila da namaacha na fronteira da Suazilândia com seu tio a procura de emprego, após sua chegada começa a trabalhar no hotel li bombos mas devido ao baixo salário e a falta de ambiente no trabalho ele abandona o emprego e consequentemente é contratado para trabalhar no hotel xisaka onde se encontra ate então, trabalhando das 12h as 22h auferindo um salário mensal no valor de 4.200.00mt. consegue construir sua própria casa que não foi concluída devido ao elevado custo do material, então ele aproxima se a hluvuku e kiva solicitando um empréstimo no valor de 12.000.00mt para concluir com a obra da sua cozinha.

Este é o terceiro empréstimo de Ricardo na Hluvuku e primeiro com kiva. O primeiro de 10.000mt foi usado para comprar um jogo de sofás, o segundo de 12.000.00mt foi usado para comprar uma mesa de madeira de 6 cadeiras.
texts.en:
Ricardo Uaquene H. was born in Inhambane. He is 58 years old, married, and has six children between 14 and 30 years old. All go to school. Besides his children, he also supports his parents who live in Inhambane by sending them 1,500 MZN every three months. Ricardo is able to save 1,000 MZN each month. Ricardo left Inhambane with his uncle for the village of Namaacha on the border with Swaziland in order to find work. After he arrived there, he began to work at the Hotel Li Bombos. However, because of the low salary and the poor working environment, he left his job and was hired at the Hotel Xisaka, where he works today. He works from 12pm to 10pm and earns 4,200 MZN per month. He was able to start to build his own home, but could not finish due to the high cost of materials. For that reason, he came to Hluvuku to request of loan of 12,000 MZN in order to finish building his kitchen. This is Ricardo's third loan with Hluvuku and his first with Kiva. The first loan of 10,000 MZN was used to buy a sofa set, and the second loan of 12,000 MZN was used to purchase a wooden table and 6 chairs.

Translated from Portuguese by Erika Korowin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase construction materials

loans.name: Mostafa

texts.en: Mostafa has been working in electricity maintenance since 2004. He’s 26 years old and married. He's living with his parents, so he cooperates with his father in the household. He works hard to earn a good income so that he will be able to get his own house instead of living with his parents. Today, Mostafa is asking to borrow $1,000 to buy new tools that he needs to satisfy the standards of the market and the requirements of his clients.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Virgilia

texts.es:
La  señora Virginia 53 años y  esta casada con el Sr Alejandro  con quien tienen 3 hijas ya adolescentes ,una D. ella trabaja en una fabrica D. ropas D. Marca, las otras dos les ayudan en la confección D. ropas y cortinas, en su casa y luego en la posterior venta por los barrios  D. la  Ciudad D. Capiata. DonD. viven desD. hace 12 años, en su casa propia que fueron pagando mensualmente con el fruto del trabajo D. la Familia. 
El Sr.Alejandro  trabaja también en forma independiente en la Ciudad D. Asunción donD. se dedica a la venta  Tarjetas  D. Loterías  y todo los relacionados a juegos D. Azar, esta actividad lo viene realizando desD. antes D. casado.
El Proyecto D. ellos es  tener un Taller D. Confecciones con mas Maquinarias  y dar Mano D. Obras ( Trabajos) a muchas otras Familias.
texts.en:
Mrs. Virgilia is 53 years old and married to Mr. Alejandro with whom she has 3 adolescent daughters. One daughter works in the Marca clothing factory; the other two help make clothes and curtains at home, then sell them in the neighborhoods of the City of Capiata. They have lived there for 12 years in their own house, for which they pay monthly with the fruits of the family's labor. Mr. Alejandro also works independently in the City of Asunción where he sells lottery tickets and everything related to games of chance. He has been doing this since before they were married. Their project is to have a shop to produce clothing with more machinery and to proviD. employment for many other families.

Translated from Spanish by Harold Sims, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: BUYING A 5-THREAD OVERLOK MACHINE TO MAKE CLOTHES

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en: Rabih is a 35-year-old married man. He has five children who still go to school. He has owned a car repair shop in his town since 2001 and has 18 years of experience in this field. In addition to repairing cars, he also does car painting. He receives a good number of clients in his shop, which is situated in a large depot. Today, Rabih is requesting a loan of $700 to buy more spare parts and car paint to meet the requirements of his clients and make a good income for his family.

loans.use: To buy more spare parts and car paint

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 60-year-old married man and father of three children. He has owned a mini-market for the past 20 years. Over the years, thanks to his business income, he has been able to meet his children's needs. A good number of the village clients pass by his shop and buy all types of products. 

Today, Mohamad is requesting a loan of $1,000 to purchase additional merchandise needed to satisfy the needs of his customers and make a profit.

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise

loans.name: Isabella

texts.en: Isabella is happily married, with nine children. Her children are still dependent on her and they attend school. She is 40 years old and her husband is a businessman who also supports the home. She sells foodstuffs and groceries in her shop at retail prices. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She wants to increase and expand her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs and groceries to sell

loans.name: Saymakhmud

texts.ru: Мадчидов Саймахмуд проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 27 лет. Женат, имеет одного ребенка. Жена, домохозяйка. Отец, преподает в средней школе. Сам Саймахмуд животноводством занимается более 3 лет. Он откармливает и продает крупно- рогатый скот. Саймахмуд раньше преподавал в средней школе. Он имеет высшее образование. Кредит просит для закупа крупно- рогатого скота.
texts.en:
Saymakhmud M. lives in the Hamadoni region. He is 27 years old. He is married and has one child. His wife is a homemaker. His father is a teacher in secondary school. Saymakhmud has been in animal husbandry for more than three years. He feeds and sells large cattle. Saymakhmud used to teach in secondary school. He has high education. He is asking for a loan to buy large cattle.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy large cattle

loans.name: Apoowegi Lanek Polline Group

texts.en: Polline L. is a hard-working business woman who is 37 years old and the group President of Apoowegi. She is married and blessed with five children, of whom four are in school, and she is looking after three dependents who are in school too. She is running a business selling bananas and it has been eight years so far. She will be using the loan to purchase and transport bananas from Paidha and Mbarara to Layibi and Gulu for sale. The loan will improve her business stock. She is a hard-working and motivated businesswoman whose future hopes are to educate her children, build a house and drive herself.

loans.use: To purchase and transport bananas from Paidha and Mbarara to Layibi and Gulu for sale.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El Sr Juan es casado, vive en casa propia en el barrio San Francisco de Caacupé, desde chico empezó a trabajar en el rubro de la chipería con sus padres, cuando formo su familia empezó a independizarse y emprendió su propia chipería, ayudado por su esposa en la producción y ventas, solicita un crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva, para la compra en cantidades de materia primas para la producción de su producto, ( queso y almidón), elabora su deliciosa chipa en su domicilio y lo lleva a vender en capital generando así logra obtener un ingreso diario en su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is married and lives in his own house in the neighborhood of San Francisco de Caacupé. At a young age, he began working with his parents in a chipería (a shop selling chipas, a Paraguayan bun with a cheese filling). When he formed his own family he began to become independent and started his own chipería, with his wife helping in production and sales.

He is applying for a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and KIVA for the purchase of quantities of raw materials (cheese and potato flour) for the production of his product. He makes his delicious chipas in his home and takes them to the capital to sell, thereby achieving success in obtaining a daily income for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Richard Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For the purchase of raw materials (cheese and potato flour)

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail sells notebooks, textbooks, pens and pencils in her shop, and she has been in this business for five years. Abigail is very happy with her business growth and she hopes to grow her business into a world-class book store in the future. Abigail is happily married with four children, all boys. Her children are still dependent on her and attend school. Her husband is a businessman who also supports the home. She is 43 years old and very determined to increase the prosperity of her business and that of her family. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell.

loans.name: Toyin

texts.en:
Toyin is happily married, with four children who are in primary and secondary school respectively. Toyin supports her husband, who is a spray painter, in taking care of the family. She sells drinks, wine and sachet water (water sold in plastic bags) in her shop at retail prices. She hopes for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more drinks, wine and sachet water to sell. She is 38 years old. She hopes to expand her business in the future, and she has a good relationship with LAPO. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders and LAPO-Microfinance for the financial support given to her in this hard time.

Lift above poverty organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, wine and sachet water to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans, and flour that will be used for the business

loans.name: Uche

texts.en: Uche is business oriented: she is a fashion designer and she also sells clothes and tailoring materials in her shop to earn a living. She makes both Nigerian and western designs for her customers. She has been in this business for 11 years and she has been able to use her years of experience to attract and retain her customers. She is 30 years old and married, with 2 children, and her husband is a businessman. She hopes to expand her business. She hopes for a loan of NGN 70,000 to purchase more clothes and tailoring materials to sell. She says "thank you".

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more rice, beans, and flour which will help her restaurant

loans.name: Fish Monger A Acan Pasca Group

texts.en:
Pasca A. is the president of her loan group. She is twenty-eight years old, married and blessed with two children who are in school. She also has one dependent in school, too. 

Pasca has been selling smoked fish for over ten years. She is using the loan to purchase fish from the source to sell in the Layibi Market. She used to purchase a half-basket or one basket of fish, but now she is purchasing two-and-a-half baskets and more fish to sell. At least, she is improving her stock. 

She is a hardworking and courageous businesswoman whose dream is to educate her children

loans.use: To buy fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase charcoal in bulk

loans.name: Fawusat

texts.en:
Fawusat is an advanced woman who is very optimistic and energetic about the growth of her business. Although her husband works as a commercial driver, he still supports their home. She is 50 years old. She is very enthusiastic in pulling her family out of poverty. 

She sells loaves of bread to earn a living. She has 4 children who attend school and still depend on her. 

She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase food to cook and sell. She hopes to start to sell cooked foods in addition to her bread business. This will enable her to meet the basic needs of her family. She says "thank you" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase  food to cook and sell.

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a 44-year-old mother of four who operates a tailoring business in Kariobangi. She earns extra income by farming. She has been in business for 15 years and describes her business environment as competitive. 

She is requesting for a loan of Kes. 40,000 to add a stock of fabric to her business. Jane hopes to open more outlets and increase her investment. She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To add stock of fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase beans, rice, and maize in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase banana in bulk

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase maize in bulk

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice sells tailoring materials and sarongs. She travels to Ghana to purchase goods to sell in Nigeria. She loves this business because it is highly profitable. She is married and has 4 children, two of whom are in a tertiary institution. She hopes to be a major distributor of tailoring materials and sarongs in the future. 

Eunice is hoping for a loan of NGN 120,000 to purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell. She says "thanks" to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more tailoring materials and sarongs to sell

loans.name: Fish Monger A Aber Florence Group

texts.en:
Florence A. is the cashier of her loan group. She is thirty-two years old and married, and she has four children and eight dependents. Three of her children and four of her dependents are in school. 

Florence has been in the fish business for over nine years. She is using this loan to purchase smoked fish from fishermen to sell in the Gulu Market. She is an active and promising businesswoman whose future hope is to work for the well-being of her children.

loans.use: To purchase smoked fish to sell

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: . Madame Fatou S. est une yoffoise de 65 ans qui habite dans le quartier de Layenne. Elle est membre de la caisse de l’U-IMCEC Yoff depuis juin 2000.Elle est veuve et mère de 9 enfants. Elle a déjà rembourse deux prêts antérieurs. C’est une spécialiste en tresses  pour femme. Elle évolue depuis 2004 dans le commerce d’objets d’art, de tam-tam, de boubous, d’arachide et d’oseille en destination de la France. Elle a opte pour cette activité dans l’intention de gagner sa vie et de participer dans la gestion de son avenir ainsi que celui de ses enfants. L’aspect qui  intéresse le plus c'est le caractère    lucratif de son activité  a travers les bénéfices réalises qui lui permettent de satisfaire ses propres besoins.  A la suite du décès de son mari elle avait interrompu ses activités Actuellement son intention est de redémarrer son commerce. Par conséquent elle sollicite un crédit de 150 000 frs pour l’achat de marchandises dans la mesure ou elle programme un voyage. Son objectif est de toujours améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatou S. is a 65 year old woman from Yoff, who lives in the neighborhood of Layenne. She has been a member of the U-IMCEC credit union since June 2000. She is a widow and the mother of 9 children. She has repaid her previous 2 loans. She has specialized in braiding women's hair. Since 2004 she has been in business selling artwork, small drums ("tam-tams"), long dresses ("boubous"), palm oil and hibiscus, which she intends to sell in France. She chose this business in order to earn a living and in order to manage her future, and the future of her children. The aspect of the business which interests her the most is that its lucrative nature enables her to realize enough profits to satisfy her needs. Following the death of her husband, she stopped her business for a while. Currently, it is her goal to start her business up again. As a result, she is requesting a loan of 150,000 francs in order to purchase enough merchandise, or to plan the trip to sell her goods. Her goal is always to improve the conditions of her family's life.

Translated from French by Margot Bonner, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To grow her funds.

loans.name: Rabih

texts.en:
Rabih is an 18-year-old young man who lives with his family. He has owned a recorder repair shop in his town since 2007. He learned this occupation from a friend when he was working in his shop four years ago. After getting the needed experience, he opened his own shop. 

In the future, he's planning to develop his business by taking more and more advanced recorders. To do so, Rabih is asking for a loan of $1,000 to buy more tools and the recorder accessories that he needs to reach his objective.

loans.use: To buy more tools and recorder accessories

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 47-year-old married man and the father of 3 children. He opened a car repair shop in 1980 to earn income to help satisfy the needs of his family. Noting that his children are still unemployed, and he is the only provider for them, he works hard to meet their needs.  

He has a great demand for his shop services, so he wants to take a loan of $1,000 to buy new tools for his business. This will enable him to meet the demands of the market and satisfy the needs of his clients.

loans.use: To buy new tools

loans.name: Itojo Twimukye Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
Lydia K. is 43 years old and the leader of her lending group in Ntungamo. She is a hard working lady. She is married and has five children, ages  22 – 15 years. She also cares for 2 dependents. 

Lydia has been selling clothes at the Itojo Trading Centre for 10 years. She is able to make 200,000/= (Ugandan shillings) in profits from her business each week, despite the challenge of having limited capital to acquire more clothes to sell. However, with the help of loans, she is able to have a wide variety of clothes, enabling her customers to have a choice. 

Lydia hopes to make more wholesale purchases and have better health for her children and sustainability. She needs a loan to be able to purchase more clothing to sell.

loans.use: To buy more clothes to sell

loans.name: Augustina

texts.en: Augustina is married and has 7 children. She is 48 years old. Her husband is a businessman and he also supports their home. She sells Nigerian and Ghanaian cooked food. She has been in this business for a long time. She is hoping for a loan of NGN 50,000 to purchase more food to cook and sell. She loves this business because of the one-on-one interaction that she has with her customers. She appreciates the kind gesture shown to her by Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more food to cook and sell

loans.name: Rubaare Twimukye Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
Pelly K. is the leader of her lending group in Ntungamo. She is 38 years old and a widow with one 18-year-old child who is in school. 

Pelly has a soda depot in Rubaare Trading Centre where she offers wholesale and retail services to customers. She is able to make 100,000/= (Ugandan shillings) in profit every week. She has been in business for 8 years earning her enough experience to handle her customers well. She is the only one with this business in the area. She would like to expand further and use a trailer to offload instead of a truck. She hopes her child can study and take over her business after she is gone for better management and increased income. She needs a loan to purchase soda for her inventory.

loans.use: Buying more crates of sodas to resell

loans.name: Esperence's Group

texts.en:
Esperence is 41 years old and she is married. Esperence lives in Nyarugenge, a region of Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Here, Esperence has owned a business of selling charcoal for about 5 years. The hours of her business are from 7 AM to 7 PM every day except Saturday.

Esperence is now requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company so that she can satisfy the demands of her customers. She wants to increase her business by adding more sacks of charcoal to sell to her customers. With this business expansion, Esperence hopes to earn more profits. Those profits will allow her to continue progressing in her business and keeping her business financially stable. Esperence is very thankful to any Kiva lender who will contribute to the progress of her business.

loans.use: To buy more sacks of charcoal for sale

loans.name: Mario

texts.es: El Sr Mario es soltero vive en casa propia en el barrio Kennedy en la ciudad de Caacupe, desde muy joven emprendió su micro empresa de venta de sus mercaderías en forma ambulante ( compra ventas de ropas y zapatos deportivo), cuenta con clientela bien formada, solicita un crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva, para poder sastifacer la demanda de su clientela para tener todo activo y así generar mas ingresos a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Señor Mario is single living in his own house in the neighborhood Kennedy, in the city of Cacupe, where since he was young he started his own business selling goods by traveling (selling clothes and sports shoes). With his well-formed client base, he is asking for a loan from the Fundación Paraguaya, an affiliate of Kiva, in order to satisfy the demand of his clientele to have everything active, and in order to gain more income for his family unit.

Translated from Spanish by Lois Parshley, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy athletic clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Itojo Bakyara Tutungunkye Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
Juliet B. is 48 years old. She is a very hard-working and friendly lady. She is a widow with 6 children, ages 17 - 22, who are all in school. She also cares for 2 dependents. 

Juliet is a multi-business lady who has been operating a retail shop, a "hotel" (small restaurant), and a bar in Itojo Trading Centre for 24 years. She started with only one business and the rest were started with her ever-increasing profits and the help of loans. She is able to make 120,000/= (Ugandan shillings) in profits each week. She attributes her profitability to her good customer care and the loans that help to her recapitalize her businesses. 

Juliet has a dream of owning a business house as well as ensuring that her family is self sustaining with increased income. She needs a loan to be able to purchase more stock for her shop, more food for her restaurant, and drinks for the bar.

loans.use: To buy more shop products, more food for her restaurant, and drinks for the bar.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a single man who is 31 years old. He opened a restaurant in his town in 2008. He services all type of platters, sandwiches and soft drinks to his customers. He's known for the delicious chicken sandwiches he presents to his clients. He's happy with his new business. 

He's asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a refrigerator specifically designed for restaurants to protect the food products and attract more clients in order to earn a higher profit.

loans.use: To purchase a commercial refrigerator for his restaurant

loans.name: Iringo Twebiseho Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
Henry M. is a hard working 45-year-old man. He is married and has 9 children. He also cares for 2 dependents. Most of Henry’s children are grown and out of school, so he no longer pays school fees. 

Henry is a carpenter. He has had a carpentry workshop in Iringo Cell, Iterero for 3 years. His biggest challenge is lacking enough tools to do his job. He is able to make 120,000/= (Ugandan shillings) in profit each month. He would have earned more profit, were it not for assorted challegges, because his business in a monopoly in the area. 

His goal is to ensure that he improves the quality of his products and for the family to be self-sustainable. Henry needs a loan to purchase more materials and tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials and tools.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 36 years old. She is married to Patrick Kibunja and they have a two-year-old baby. She has a pool table business where she charges people to play a game. This has been her source of income for the last year. Her business is in Naivasha Town.

She was introduced to KADET by her friend. This will be her first loan. She plans to add another pool table so she can cater to all her customers, especially during weekends and holidays when people flood her shop to play a game of pool as they relax. This will enable her increase her income because multiple games can be played at the same time.

In future, she plans to buy a piece of land where she will set up the business and save the monthly rent she now incurs.

loans.use: Buy another pool/snooker table

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy additional goods such as drinks, foodstuffs, etc.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 53-year-old married man with two children. Since 2004 he has owned a photography shop. He has vast experience in this line of work, as he has been in the business for 36 years. In addition to working in his studio, Hussein photographs special events such as weddings and private ceremonies. He is happy with his business and always learns the new systems and programs that are specific to the photography sector. Today, Hussein is requesting to borrow $1200 USD to buy an advanced digital camera to be up to date with the market and develop his business.

loans.use: To buy an advanced digital camera

loans.name: Rwenshekye God's Mercy Group, Ntungamo

texts.en: K. Polly is the leader of his lending group in Ntungamo. He is married with five children aged between four and thirteen years. Polly is a businessman who, for the last eight years, has run a carpentry workshop in Nkongoro trading center. His biggest business challenge is insufficient business capital and the small store from which he operates. He says that his business location and honesty with customers would have enabled him to make more profit had he had the necessary capital to invest into his business. Polly is requesting a loan to purchase more materials and tools for his business.

loans.use: To purchase carpentry materials and tools

loans.name: Olga

texts.es: La Sra. Olga es separada vive en casa propia en la compañía Almada de Caacupé, se dedica a la producción y ventas de ladrillos desde hace tiempo, solicita un crédito a la Fundación Paraguaya y kiva, para la compra de arcilla en cantidad para asegurar su producción permanente y así satisfacer la demanda del producto a sus clientes, asegurando el ingreso permanente a su unidad familiar.
texts.en:
Mrs. Olga is separated and lives in her own home in Almada de Caacupé. She has a business making and selling bricks that she has been at for some time. She is asking for a loan from Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva to buy large quantities of clay (mud) to insure production and satisfy her customer's demands. This also insures her continuing income and family unity.

Translated from Spanish by Shelly Hubman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy mud to make bricks.

loans.name: Ghassan

texts.en: Ghassan is a 28-year-old married man who has one child. He opened a small photocopier shop in his town in 2009, but he has been involved in this sector for the past 15 years. He sells cartridges, paper, folders and photography films, etc. in addition to offering photocopying services. Ghassan is appreciative of his new business income and is now asking for a loan of $1000 USD to buy an additionA. photocopier machine to satisfy the demand of his customers, especially students.

loans.use: To buy an additional photocopier machine

loans.name: Kihihi Progressive Association Group

texts.en:
(For this photo, it was taken during the night hence the color needs adjustment, it's next meeting date is a month after today and i guess it will pass since all the eight members are in the photo)
B. Justus is 53 years old and a hardworking married man with four children, aged three to ten, who are all in school. He is a businessman with a bar in Kihihi daily market. He has been operating the bar for four years and is able to make 70,000 UGX profit a week. Justus says that he is often affected by defaulting customers who become used to regarding him as a friend, which is not good for business. He makes sure that he employs good customer care skills with customers and those he employs. In the future, he hopes to expand his business further so that he can continue to educate his children. He is requesting a loan to invest in his bar by purchasing a range of drinks such as beer, soda, local brew and wine.

loans.use: To buy more drinks such as beer, soda, local brew and wine

loans.name: Ramona

texts.es:
Ña Ramona tiene 52 años, está casada con don Ramiro Dominguez y tienen 3 hijos. Es comerciante ya hace casi 20 años, se dedica a la compra-venta de frutas y verduras, realiza 2 viajes por semana en el mercado de abasto para comprar sus mercaderías y para luego distribuirlas entre sus clientes a quienes les visita diariamente con sus productos montada en una motocicleta con carrito ya que posee una clientela formada de hace años.
Ña Ramona prácticamente crió crecer  a sus hijos con el esfuerzo y la dedicación a su actividad, que hasta ahora con la utilidad que genera cubren las necesidades básicas de la familia y los gastos de los estudios de sus hijos. 
Con los préstamos que obtuvo de la Fundación Paraguaya pudo ampliar su stock de mercaderías y así satisfacer a medida las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ramona is 52 years old, is married to Mr. Ramiro D., and has three children. She has owned a fruit-and-vegetable-selling business for almost 20 years. She travels to the wholesale market twice a week to buy the produce that she will then sell to her customers, whom she visits every day in a motorcycle which pulls a little cart. Ramona has raised her children thanks to the effort and dedication she has put into her business. With the money the business gives her, she continues to cover the basic needs of her family and the studies of her children. With the loans she has obtained from Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya, she has been able to increase the quantity of the produce she offers her clients.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying wholesale fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Jandark

texts.en:
Jandark is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. She has been working as a home-based tailor for the past 20 years. She learned her occupation from her grandmother when she was very young. This business helps Jandark to earn extra income for her family.
Today, she is asking to borrow $1200 USD to buy a new sewing machine with more functions and options in order to develop her business and produce a variety of products for her customers.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en: Stepan is married and has three children. For the last four years, he has sold bicycles and children's toys at the local market in Stryi town. His good location, as well as the high quality of his inventory, attracts many customers. Stepan is a very hardworking and purpose-driven person. He wants to develop his business further to receive sufficient income to take good care of his growing family. Stepan is requesting a loan of 15,500 UAH to increase the variety of his goods.

loans.use: To increase the variety of his stock

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy more used clothes for resale

loans.name: Tasuthekeh Ii Group

texts.en:
Here are small-scale local entrepreneurs from the small town of Waterloo, near Freetown, the capital city of Sierra Leone. These women have come to SMT, a partner of Shine on Sierra Leone, to seek a loan of 3,000,000 SLL in order to expand their businesses, make better sales, and consequently improve their standard of living.
Isatu M., second from left, is the leader of this group. She is 38 years old, married to a professional worker, and has four children. For 15 years now, Isatu has been selling cooked food. With her share of the loan, she will buy cooking ingredients, such as rice, fish and meat, in order to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking ingredients such as rice, fish and meat

loans.name: Deborah

texts.en:
Deborah sells frozen food such as chicken, turkey and ice fish in her shop at retail prices. She has been in this business for seven years. She hopes to expand her business and is requesting a loan of 120,000 NGN to purchase two deep freezers as well as frozen foods for her business. She thank all Kiva lenders.
Deborah is married with three children who are excelling in school. She supports her husband, who is a businessman, in taking care of the family with the profits she makes from her business.

loans.use: To purchase two deep freezers and frozen foods

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en: Mohamad is a 29-year-old single man. When he was 15 years old, he finished his education in order to learn an occupation. He learned home painting and started to work to earn an income and help his father support the household. In 2000, having acquired some good experience, he began his own business and started taking private projects. Today, Mohamad is asking to borrow $1000 USD because he is taking on a new project and needs to be prepared with all the necessary tools and supplies so that he is ready for the customer and can earn a good income from the job.

loans.use: To purchase tools and supplies
